Restaurant was tasty, Location was ok if you get there by car, very functional the direct access to the shopping mall. There was a really famous restourant just across the street (flor 40 th) but we didnt go there because we where travelling with small kids, but people really recomended it. Pets are allowed, we took out dog, 10/10 to this hotel. everything was ok, maybe the room service menu could be better.

Breakfast was very good, they had different meals for kids and adults. We stayed for 4 nights and had 2 different breakfast over the duration of our stay. Location is only 7 minutes walk from Ueno station so it was very convenient It would be nice if it had an extra room/area outside of your room where you can go an read a book. This is handy for those who are travelling with kids

Check in was smooth and I was upgraded from standard room to executive room, the room was a good size, clean and comfortable. Except the bathroom lights all room lights were controlled together so could not use the bed side lights independent of the overhead lights which meant I couldn't carry on reading when my daughter wanted to go to sleep.  It is quite expensive for one night at ¬£170 for a standard room.  Both times I have stayed recently 1 of the three lifts was broken.

Close to Suria KLCC and KLCC Park. Superb view of KLCC and neighbouring skylines from our room, and from the pool terrace. Nice breakfast spread. Buggy services to and fro Suria KLCC until 10 pm. The family room with breakfast (for 2 adults and 2 kids) does not include breakfast for the kids, hence we had to pay for 2 kids' breakfast.

We liked the location and found the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent and delivered quickly and warm in a beautiful courtyard setting. The rooms were large,quiet and air conditioned My daughter couldn't use the swimming pool  because of couples smoking and drinking around the pool. The beds were a little hard for our backs.

Very good location right in the beach, 5 min walk from Port Grimaud with a ferry service to St Tropez. Friendly staff and amazing facilities with bars with live music, nice restaurants and an amazing swimming pool onsite for kids. The lodges are a bit more outdated than on the pictures, there are other providers on the campground that provide newer lodges. The nova lodges are placed in a more Forrest environment of the campground therefor they are a bit darker and attract a lot of mosquitoes.

The hospitality from the owner of the hotel , his son Alex & other staff made our one night stay memorable . Right from the time we arrived at the entrance until we checked out, they treated us like a guest to their house. They greeted us personally at the entrance providing us 3-4 water bottles to each of us, played with our kids, handled our luggage to room etc. These things makes a lot of difference for guests than just providing more luxury in the room.     Room we stayed was also excellent with a double bed and 2 separate single beds and other amenities. Breakfast was also good enough. Though we stayed just one night, we wish we could have extended atleast a night more had our itenary allowed.     Property location was also excellent and we covered many places around borjomi easily. Nothing specific as we just stayed one night.

It was very clean.  Location was very convenient.   The family room was spacious and had a door separating the sleeping areas. Unfortunately, the elevator didn't go all the way up to our floor.  However, it was only one flight of stairs to the family rooms.

Fantastic room with great layout, facilities and views. very friendly staff. great location. Lacking in personal atmosphere. Had feeling of a chain, which could have been changed with a few personal touches and extra. Few activities or facilities for children (other than a kids club which catered for children under 5 mainly.

We loved everything about the Monte Carlo!  Being right on the boardwalk but a little away from the hustle bustle of the amusement park was perfect!  The indoor pool and hot tub were ideal since it was too cold to enjoy the ocean right outside (not their fault LOL).  We loved the bright colors and modern look of the hotel's decor.  The room was plenty big enough for our family with comfy beds and nice bathroom.  I love the size of this hotel, not too big and not too small - JUST RIGHT! The only thing that could have been an issue (but wasn't for us, thankfully) is parking.  Due to it's location, parking is naturally a challenge.  The lot closest to the property only accommodates a few cars and fills up quickly.  The overflow lot is blocks away.  If you are checking in late, like we did, that would not be a good thing.  The walk from the lot to the hotel is  pretty dark, long and isolated.  I honestly don't know what they could do to improve that.  They do allow guests to park next to the entrance for up to 20 minutes to check in but if there were several people coming at once, the area would not accommodate that.  Like I said, we got lucky and found a spot in the close lot and then didn't move the car until we checked out days later.

Clean and convenient location. Close to one of main metro stations It has enough beds to sleep 5 people but 1 bathroom and all is tight. I requested to have early check in as we were traveling from USA with a toddler. Our flight got delayed and our arrival time was delayed two hours but still we had to wait  for hour and a half to finish cleaning the apartment, we didn‚Äôt get it till 2pm. They offered yo leave luggage and walk around but we were too tired to do so.

The location is very good. It‚Äôs close to shopping, restaurants and major tourist attractions. It is a cute house and could have been maintained better than its current conditions. The blinds are in bad condition and should have been replaced. The first floor is dark and the stairs/floors are dirty. The bed sheets inside the sofa bed have a musty smell and the bathroom is not easy to use at night as any guest sleeping on the sofa bed has to climb up the flimsy stairs. This is not the best fit for family travel.

Spacious and well equipped air conditioned apartment. Great choice of food which changed daily. Parking  at ‚Ç¨15 per day is not bad compared to other in the area. 7 mins walk to beach but there‚Äôs plenty onsite for kids. Staff is friendly and efficient .

We stayed for three nights and had breakfast each day and dinner in the hotel on two nights. The food was excellent.    Staff are very friendly and efficient. Hotel location is excellent, with beautiful views over Dunoon's West Bay and the Firth of Clyde.    The hotel is clean, room was comfortable. There is no guest lounge, with guest seating only available in the bar, as well as outside in the sun!  It is a small hotel so the lack of a guest lounge is understandable, but it could be useful to be aware of this if travelling with children or planning a longer stay. Otherwise no complaints and we had a very enjoyable stay here.

Location, breakfast inclusion, cleanliness. We had noted down a child was staying with us so we had three persons in the room, however each day, we were always provided with two towels. We'd call housekeeping and no one ever answered.

A perfect place for family with kids. There are so much activities for the kids and the beach is very clean and beautiful. The workers were very nice except of the nightshift at the reception. We got an upgrade to our room and the room was very big with a fridge a very comfortable bed etc. It‚Äôs a very dead place, just the hotel and 20other buildings at the beach and the harboure the rest are fields and the dunes. There is one blasserie that is open until 22:30 pm but the rest closes between 20-21 o clock. that‚Äôs too early. the kitchen in the hotel also closes at 21 o clock and there are no other possibilities to buy drinks or food after 8pm. Most of the stores and restaurants opens at 12-16 o clock so you have a short window to eat and drink.

The staff was very kind and helpful, the gardens were gorgeous and the views beautiful. They had several seating areas by the water and a fire pit as well. The rooms were spacious and all of the linens were crisp and clean. They had plenty of coffee in the room and any type of glasswear needed. They were very dog friendly, and everyone's pets were well behaved. We didn't hear a peep out of anyone else's dog the entire time. Kid friendly, dog friendly and a beautiful location! If you are traveling with family or with a dog, it's a great place to stay and feel welcomed. The stairs have gaps where you can see down which was scary for our young child and dog- we had to carry the dog down the stairs because she refused to go down. The carpet on the balcony was a bit odd and weathered. These are by far not big deal items in the long run and I'd definitely stay again.
spacious room with enough beds, great for a family of 5-6 people, The kitchen equipment and TV are very old and not in good condition

The¬†location¬†was¬†good. Paddington train station is nearby. The city tour big¬†bus¬†and¬†tootbus¬†get¬†closer¬†to¬†nearest hotel¬†bustop, which is 5 to 7 minute walk away. Staffs friendly and healpfull. Specially the lady at the restaurant. The¬†room was small, and there were no place to place luggage. Even the washroom is very small. There is no carpet in the room, in case if no temperature controller set, the surface is too cold to walk on, you must wear socks or slippers.  Breakfast¬†at¬†the¬†hotel¬†is¬†ok,¬†but¬†not¬†exceptional. In addition, children under the age of ten are charged complete price, wherelse other hotels in London offer free or reduced-price/half price breakfast.

Great location right along the lake. Good on site activities, the kids loved the tennis courts and bike hire from the hotel. A very easy walk into town and to playgrounds for the kids. Good buffet breakfast and after a long trip was very convenient to have room service avaliable. Nothing

good spread of breakfast and location very apt for most places..   The staff goes out of the way to help you and we have a baby so they took even more care of our needs and gave us all the support in terms of preparation of baby food as well..   special shout out to Aditi, Krishnendu, Vivek and other members for their service levels.. none as such

Location was great, nice pool, quite cold because there was shade but that was quite refreshing. Staff helpful but not particularly friendly, location for shops 7/11 etc great abx right in beach. Walls very thin in the older style accommodation, late night music could be heard but wasn‚Äôt really loud but from street bars. me and my kids were woken on our last morning by rooms either side of us with young lads who had got home at 5am then were sat out side smoking weed and chatting like it was the middle of the day.  Breakfast was rather disappointing, never had such bad coffee, luckily asked for kettle for room and made my own. It was like camp coffee. A lot of the food out didn‚Äôt stay warm when put out, and the tea was made in a coffee pit with 6 tea bags which was stewed instead of having water to make yourself.

Miha and Mateja were very friendly, helpful and made us feel like home. Our room was clean and comfortable as we stayed there with two small children. The terrace and outdoor space is additional plus. Also the bed was really comfortable and we slept very well! Clean kitchen and free coffe :) If you're looking for relaxing stay and want to be near nature, this is a perfect location, also with children. Sharared bathrom, but it's ok because there are only 3 rooms.

Location is perfect, wonderful combination between forest and sea.  Variety of options for breakfast and dinner, would rate 10/10 for options and 7/10 for quality and taste. There is no control from the staff over the guests who are loud listening to music and partying till the early hours of the day. Considering that the majority of the guests staying for longer period of time are families with kids, not controlling the noisy guests is unacceptable.

We loved the staff and the location. The room was very clean, and the staff was extremely attentive to our needs. I would stay there again. Booking.com messed up our initial reservation and this hotel was able to accommodate us without a problem. I wished the rooms were bigger, we were two families of four and had to ask for a bigger room. They only had one bigger room the other family had to stay in a smaller room.

This hotel is very good value for money. The Manager Mr Nair really went out of his way for us. My daughter lost her favourite comforter and Mr Nair was so understanding about this and went out of his way to try and find it including viewing CCTV footages. We cannot thank him enough. Mohsin was really helpful and made our stay as comfortable as possible and arranged for my birthday decorations and cake. The breakfast is ample and really good value for money. Location is good and Pizza Hut is opposite the hotel which is handy with young kids. The beds are really comfortable. The massages are fantastic. We loved our stay here. I think if there was an iron available that would have been great. A kids pool would have been great to keep the kids busy.

Room size is larger than most hotels we have stayed at before.  Kids liked the bunk beds.  Nice to have a washer/dryer unit.  Separate toilet was nice too.  Kitchen is a plus but did not cook. It was scheduled to be cleaned on thursday but nothing happened.  Could have more instructions on how to use washer.  Could have said to leave garbage outside.  Only did so after another unit left it out.

The W14 is in a great location close to Kensington and easily accessible by the tube. Quiet street at night.  The rooms were clean and had plenty of room for our family. The staff was welcoming and helpful. We liked everything about the hotel. Was exactly as we expected. Great value for the rates we were charged which can be difficult to find in London

The location of the hotel is very central, 5 minutes walk you can find train station, buses and taxis. It is very near to piazza Garibaldi which is full of shops and restaurants. The staff are very helpful and speak good English. It is very clean and our  room for a couple and a child was excellent. The lift only goes up to second floor. For the third floor one has to use the stairs.

I liked how the beds were in separate rooms. Also enjoyed the balcony on the river. My daughter enjoyed watching the raccoons at night. Also just 1 traffic light away from the convention center which is why we were there. Wasn't much I didn't like. Maybe offer a breakfast.

Great value for the money, top location and great breakfast at hotel restaurant. Nice pool area, enjoyed it very much. Want to acknowledge Dilek, at guest relations, contacted us before the check-in, asked whether we need transfer, baby crib, during the stay was helpful as well. Totally recommend! -

lazy river and pool were great. the room was huge and the kids liked their little separate room area. the kids beds were very comfortable The king bed was not comfortable at all. My husband and I were both hurting from the bed. Our backs were killing us by the end of our trip.

Great room. we took suite for 4 people (2 kids and 2 adults). Big space, grande terrace. Delicious breakfast with plenty  fresh juices and  fruits. Warm pool. beach just near hotel. we spend just a week

Lovely little studio flat. Was comfortable, had a decent working kitchen and fridge etc. Staff are friendly and was able to organise return airport pick up for 72 euros. pool is clean, and breakfast was expensive, but it's easy enough to make your own. Able to provide cot and high chair for our baby. the rooms are actually studios, although i think the photos are misleading. Could have done with providing little things like washing up liquid and cloth.

great room, great views, beautiful beach a stroll down the road staff not overly helpful or friendly, spa does not cater for children or teenagers (must be over 18 for a massage or to use facilities including gym and saunas etc.  Heated pool and hydrotherapy pool were very cool (needed to be warmer to be enjoyable).  Bar and restaurant closed at 7pm, TV didn't allow for streaming services (not smart) which seemed crazy for an expensive resort.  Roof top chairs were too low to allow you to see view so had to stand to watch the sunset.

The room was great, clean, and a nice size for 3 adults & 2 children. The hotel staff was friendly & helpful when/if we needed anything at any time! The inside pool was a favorite of all of ours, considering it was the 4th of July in South Texas!! I would definitely go back! The construction in front of the hotel is a huge ongoing job that consists of reconstructing a major highway (Hw146) right at the Kemah bridge but by far was it any fault, of course, of hotel's, but beware, the lanes literally go down to only 1 right in front of hotel!

Excellent room arrangement for young families and sleeping babies, seperate living area from bedroom allows all to enjoy the space. Parking is a bit of a hassle but not a deal breaker, the stations are close enough.
The kids had a ball in the pool !!! Loved to see them happy , and the breakfast was perfect N/A
Nestled in beautiful countryside Had to book in for breakfast. Would be Nige if kids could use the pool earlier in the morning.

Staff were very friendly especially reception staff and breakfast staff they really went over and above for us. The man at reception had our room ready early which meant alot with 2 kids and even gave them colouring books that evening while we sat in the hotel lobby. The breakfast staff made my 6 year old feel very important showing her how to make pancakes at breakfast.The hotel grounds are perfect for families. The pool was heated and so warm which was brilliant. Bar staff, we didn't have a great experience for our evening meal. Our dinners were brought out a half an hour apart so we didn't get to eat together, tgey got an order wrong. We weren't once asked if we were ok.. after about an hour of the last eating, we had to go to the bar to order dessert. It then took another 30 minutes to come. The bar/restaurant wasn't even busy. There was 3-4 staff working so there was ni reason for this. Other tables were also having same problems, we didn't even get an apology.

Located very close to the termini station. Breakfast was really nice. Rooms very clean. Staff extremely friendly.highly recommend. Lots of nice restaurants near by too Room was slightly on the small side(but we had a travel cot for our toddler)
spacious clean rooms. great games room for the kids. dinner and breakfast were both very good. would prefer if it wasn‚Äôt pet friendly. as have allergies but appreciate that is personal.

The property is in a great location . 5 mins walk to JBR.  It is a well equipped apartment There‚Äôs a supermarket on the doorstep.  Basketball court  and kids playground on the doorstep Bar/restaurant on the doorstep (Hilton‚Äôs Mango Tree) and all the restaurants of JBR only 5 mins walk The pool gets a good amount of sun during the day and was always quiet. Both showers leak and require a lot of ‚Äòmop up‚Äô afterwards. it would be good to have  one of the squeegee-mops in each bathroom.  For people who ONLY want a pool holiday, there are periods of the day when the pool is in shade - but this was not an issue for us.

Location was perfect, close to the beach, restaurants, Lidl, bike rental. There is a bar next door with a waterslide and playground for kids which was awesome. The rooms were clean and rhe terrace was spacious. The pool was clean and nice. They provided a cot and high chair for the baby. Really pleasant stay. The appartment could use an update, as would the pool tiles. All the doors were squiking, especially the balcony doors.
The resort has a lot of activities for kids. I‚Äôll return next year. Buffet restaurant food is average and overpriced.  Bayshore air conditioner is loud at night.

The parking outside the hotel was very convenient as was the tram stop directly outside the hotel that easily got you into Blackpool centre. The facilities, as well as the room was very clean and the beds were really comfortable to sleep on. The only minor issue in the room was the towel rail couldn't be turned off so had to be covered at all times with a towel due to a toddler having access to it.
The place is charming and the courtyard is a perfect hang out spot with young children. Very friendly staff. The breakfast quality could be better

Food - Spy-Bag / Mavi restaurant in IC Residence was excellent on every visit.  Food was tasty, and staff was top-notch. Special thanks to Mehmet for great hospitality (e.g., providing boxed lunches to take with us when we mentioned we were going off-property for sight-seeing, and making some amazing crepes), Merve for excellent, friendly table service, and Cihan for really good pizza.  The entire staff did a great job.    Housekeeping - Ismahan & the team kept our room in great shape!    Front desk staff - Friendly and very helpful with all of our many questions.  They also found two lost stuffed toys for our daughter. Seafood a la carte restaurant menu was okay, but not great.  The only choice was between salmon and sea bass for the main course; the preceding courses were all fixed.  Because it's a resort that emphasizes kids, having a few kid-friendly options would have helped to make sure that there would be something for everybody.  On the plus side, the service was really good.

Location, Close to train station and bus and covers 3 sights (Small World, Team Labs and Disney in just 5-10 mins of train).  The mall and spa are in the connected building so lot of restaurants of varieties, even vegetarian (Indian), desert, pizzas, TGIF etc.. Kids play area and shopping. Rooms were too small if you have luggage, then you will struggle with the space.

Social/Happy Hour was cool for the whole gang. Drinks for Dad, nachos for the kids.  Breakfast is second to none.  Indoor/Outdoor pool was cool.  Having the rooms on the parameter of the grand center room gave it a fantastic appeal.   The standard room had enough beds for all 3 of us to sleep alone and have our own sink. N/A. If the price is right, I will stay here again.

Waiting time for almost 3 hours despite the booking done in advance and on arrival we'd to wait long time with my mother and kids were very tired and then the room also not good. Based on the advance booking they'd to ensure the room ready before the arrival however that was not the case.

It's a great location! I had the best experience here with my family. When we arrived, the staff greeted us politely and with amazing smiles. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Good location. Walking distance to popular eateries. The room is well maintained. Aircond wasn't cold enough.
I liked that this was a family friendly hotel at a reasonable rate. I really would have loved if they had a restaurant on site or at least had breakfast available. Other than that, no complaints.

the location and clean. in general it is comfortable and good for family the supply is very limited. no basic cooking ingredients, salt and oil. and the shampoo and bodywash is also very few. However, the staff added more shampoo/bodywash on our last day

great location. staff were pleasant. clean and spacious room fridge in room was unplugged- no mention prior. we plugged it in and it ended up not working anyway. wasted our drinks/food. around elevator and in hall- smelled like marijuana the entire weekend (not kid friendly)

The room was large and comfortable with Bali wood carvings and paintings. There were two enormous bedrooms that housed my family of four easily. The hotel is located very near the beach and the main road however its very quiet. The grounds and pool are nicely laid out with lush green spaces. The entrance to the hotel and the breakfast area have intricately carved panels and statues which are marvelous to see. The WIFI was very slow during the day. The Breakfast was sufficient but not very wide ranging. The wall at the end of the pool needs repainting

Hotel rooms and bathroom - very old fashioned and need updating  Food service - food available at most times from 7am to 1am with plenty of variety to cater for most. Desserts definitely the highlight, I counted 45 different desserts on one evening. Overall good quality and variety.  For kids - plenty of pools and slides for kids. Beach is walking distance away. Plenty of activities for kids to keep them entertained For Muslim visitors - although Turkey being a Muslim country its almost impossible to avoid cross contamination with alcohol on drinks glasses, cutlery and plates. The same people who serve the alcohol are the ones setting up the tables. Your glasses, plates, table or cutlery will almost definitely have come in contact with alcohol. 90% of the adults there are alcohol drinkers. There is no prayer room as far as I could tell but you can request prayer mats to your room. The bedroom bar will have lager and wine. There are no issues in wearing a burkini. They have a separate spa if women would like a Turkish bath or massage in a private room (subject to availability).   Negatives - everything is overpriced. Massages, hair cuts, excursions, taxis, shops, extra activities etc. All more expensive than what you would pay in the UK. Expect to have your pants pulled down, so buy everything you need from your own country. They work on Euros, pounds and dollars here, nothing is priced in liras. They only currency exchange ¬£20 maximum at the hotel reception. You will have to catch a taxi to a currency exchange shop if you need more. But all the places accept euros, dollars and pounds so liras aren't necessary. When you book a taxi to do shopping they will take you to shops where they earn a commission from. We asked for a taxi at the hotel they said it would cost ‚Ç¨75, we downloaded the gettransfer.com app and we paid ¬£30 for a taxi. That's how much of a difference it is.  When we checked in at 12.30am, they didn't even ask us if we were hungry or gave welcome drinks.   In conclusion, in conclusion I do think its a very good hotel and good value for money for families with young children. Outside of the hotel is better than inside. Bedrooms definitely need updating. I will give it a 7.5 out 10. If they stopped trying to rip you off with extras at every given opportunity I would have given it a 8.5.

The facility was very good. Close to Haram 4 minutes walk and shuttle available every 10 minutes. Staff was friendly. Amazing breakfast with a lot of variety. Family friendly hotel. Check in time took long. You have to turn on the room lights so you can turn the lights in the toilet Which is not comfortable while family is sleeping

We (family with one small kid) liked size of the room (we've booked two-room apartment). There were a lot of activities in hotel from noon till midnight. All inclusive concept is very good. The breakfast was the same each morning, but the lunch and dinner were very good, with resh sea food. the meat was also interesting with a lot of options to choose. Location was isolated. It is nice to get away from town, but if you are planing to go and explore, definitely book rent a car in advance. Some staff were kind and friendly and a few of staff were unpleasant. We come in February witch was a little cold period of the year for Tenerife, the pools didn't have pleasant temperature. Even that we knew what hotel offers like four star hotel, we really still missed spa. ( we knew that hotel doesn't have spa, but still in this time of the year we recommend hotels with spa)
The room was very clean and comfortable. There were 2 of us adults and a 2yr old child and the room was very comfy for us all. What could be better is more breakfast options

Very nice hostel in a quiet area of Berat on the other riverside of the castle. We stayed in the family room for 2 nights and booked two double rooms for another night to spend more time in the beautiful area. Rooms very spacious and nicely decorated- immediately felt home. Good breakfast, comfortable beds, Wi-Fi and a beautiful garden with a ping-pong table make you wanting to stay longer than planned. Other guests can be a bit loud in the garden late in the evening - we had one night when sleep was very limited.

The rooms were sparkling clean, the staff was super nice, and the breakfast was superb. Playground, indoor and outdoor games are great for entertaining kids. The location was great. The AC was too loud and old. We had a hard time sleeping due to the noise and had to turn it off at night. Also, the lighting is weak.

Good service. Recommended for stay with kids. We took all food from the hotel. The outside environment is not satisfied. Good for staying in a room or traveling something far. Recommended for VFS appointment travelers. Checking time and checkout time can change by request. Outside Environment.

The overall grey an yellow theme inside and out. Pool was fantastic and also looked new and well cared for. Room was clean and well furnished. Staff was welcoming and helpful. The soft full size beds were very uncomfortable for us as a couple. Both adults in our party left with a backache. Even my kids had a hard time sharing a bed without running into each other. The bathroom faucets are not appropriate for those sinks. The faucet barely hangs over the bowl. You have to basically shove your hands against the sink bowl just wash your hands. Washing your face would be a trainwreck. The occasional loud noises from the nearby road can be startling. Not within control of the hotel, but it sounded like a few people were participating in a drag race from time to time. Thankfully our room was on the third floor facing the pool. The 2 story portion of the hotel facing the highway would be much louder.

Tu tu was absolutely perfect from start to finish ! Speaks perfect English, and was in contact well before the booking to make sure everything was going to plan. We made a mistake with the dates, and she sorted it out with no fuss. Stayed one night at her uncles down the road, that was also very good. Tu tu will help you with anything that she can. The place is a little paradise, swimming pool, billiard table, fridge with beer (cheap), and the family meals are a must. Loads of home cooked food, and a chance to talk to your fellow travelers. Tu tu and her adorable husband will also pick you up and drop you off at the bus station, which isn‚Äôt far, but too far to walk. Highly recommend 100% 0

Was great as it was very close to the airport so great if you have an early flight the property was nice family room The only thing I didn‚Äôt like every time someone moved in the room next to us we could hear every noise so that wasn‚Äôt ideal .

We loved our stay in Barcelona, and we enjoyed the apartment.  We had 4 adults and 4 children, and we were very comfortable. We loved the design and all of the upgrades. The location was superb.  It was right next to the Sagrada Familia.  There were very nice restaurants nearby.  We also enjoyed the rooftop!  You could find tour buses in front of the Sagrada Familia as well as taxi stop just steps away from the apartment.  Also, we felt very safe. *small upgrades are needed in the bathroom, so there is no water damage being created every time someone showers  *The only trouble that we had was probably our fault because even though we paid for the apartment long in advance, we could not pay the deposit couple of days before as we were traveling in other countries with no easy access to the email...  We arrived at the apartment, and we couldn't get in.  After a few phone calls (we felt as the staff ignored us after the first 2), we followed the instructions, paid the deposit and got in, but it was not fun to wait on the street for 45 minutes to sort it out.

Cozy and conformable for family of 5 but don't expect hugh space.  Kitchen appliances and cutleries were new. Thanks for the, coffee, chocolates   Parking is right outside the apt. Toilet is small. For family of 5, work round by doing brushing and face wash at kitchen.

It was  very clean and updated, had adjoining rooms for the whole family. It was such a cute quaint place located not too far from all the action and within walking distance to a few restaurants and the ocean. The Air Conditioner didn‚Äôt work very well to cool down the place. We ended up sleeping with the windows open because it was pretty warm in the room. There is a big gap between the door and the floor so cool air may be escaping there as well. The lamp on the nightstand didn‚Äôt work and the toilet paper holder came off when using it and could not be  put back together.

We LOVE the location. The staff was great, kind and friendly! We loved that the property/Hostel was repurposed and is now such a beautiful multipurpose property.  The use of the kitchen/bar/pool tables is also a great feature for guests and proximity to the old village and ski hill is great! You can easily bike/walk around. Quick drive anywhere too. Great for a couple getaway or for a family! The only issue we had was the AC. Our room did not have an AC controller and when we arrived it was 26 degrees in our room. We were able to open the window and the room cooled slightly. That said, we had to keep the window open all night because the rooms were sold out and there were no extra controllers. The smoke (from wild fires) was not great and we unfortunately breathed it all night. We did get a controller the following day which was great and the AC worked perfect! Slightly hiccup but I suggested they get a few extra controllers in case :)

The treehouse rooms in the jungle were really nice. The property was great to walk around the nature paths and they were well maintained. The food was good, though we eat so basic, I felt bad we kept asking the chef to make it more plain. Loved the front desk staff and the Two Little Monkey Chocolate class (about 8 min drive) was a real treat. We made dark chocolate candies starting with cocoa seeds and the class was local and felt authentic, not touristy. Pool was nice. Good place to bring your kids and they can run around, play in pool and it's not so fancy you'll be worried. The resort/complex is in the country, so there is no city to see. That's ok, it was nice to relax, park the car and take a few days break from Costa Rican driving :) We zip-lined at SkyTrek, which is maybe a 1 hour drive, that was awesome, then you can do the very touristy Talumbos (wrong name, we thought it was too crowded) hot springs stuff near Fortuna. And there's a great restaurant called Travessa (name ?), something like that, in Fortuna. If you're driving around Arenal Lake to go west eventually, eat at Macadamia Cafe overlooking the lake (about 2 hours from Helioconias) . Great food. I have nothing negative to say. Cool spot.

The location was fun and unique, the kids loved the theme. The accommodation was good and spacious, with most of what we needed. We were lucky enough to be able to have the bonus of visiting light night whilst we were staying there, which was really great, and made the stay exceptionally good value. We could have done with some way to wash dishes - luckily we‚Äôd brought washing up liquid with us. We couldn‚Äôt figure out how to turn down the heating, and ended up having to turn it off on the boiler. It was relatively clean but we found a sock on the floor and some rubbish under the bed. The options at the restaurant were very limited, so we decided to go to a local pub to eat instead.

Proximity to shopping and restaurants, few steps away from Glorietta Mall. staff are all welcoming and fantastic! For a 5star hotel, rooms could have been cleaner, rooms could‚Äôve been upgraded, exhaust fan in the bathroom should have been provided (mold started to seep thru the ceiling) , a bidet would be a plus! and free access to the Koi pond for staying guest would have been appreciated! I booked 2 rooms for my 2 sisters and for me and my 9yr old, my son loved the garden, but was told we‚Äôre not allowed to stay there unless we are paying customers, paying for 2 rooms is not enough,so I had to tell my son he was not allowed unless we order something,which we ended up doing. wish they put a signage there, or allow people to go at the koi garden, when they are already a guest of the Hotel! I didn‚Äôt like also that they gave me a room with mold in the bathroom, Even the cleaners should not be allowed to get in there unless they have protective gears on them. I was moved to a different room, but the lavatory was not clean either! had I booked a refundable rooms, I would have.. lesson learned!

We loved to stay at the hotel, it was clean, our rooms were tidy and new. We loved the playground and the inner children playing space too. The beach was near and beautiful, it‚Äôs great that there you can find a bar also and use the sunbeds. Pools were super. For the money it‚Äôs faboulos. From food and drinks fewer variety, but better quality would be so much better and there wouldn‚Äôt be so much waste. If you want to sleep earlier ask for a room in the buliding farer from the music and cooking.  Our aircondition wasn‚Äôt working.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at your hotel, and I wanted to take a moment to express my sincere gratitude to Ridvan and Hekmat at the reception, and Fatmanur in the restaurant, for their outstanding hospitality.  From the moment I arrived, Ridvan and Hekmat were warm and welcoming. They went above and beyond to make sure that I had everything I needed, and they answered all of my questions with patience and knowledge. They also made sure to check in with me throughout my stay to make sure that I was happy and comfortable.  Fatmanur was also incredibly attentive and friendly especially with my baby.  She was always happy to recommend dishes to me. The food at the restaurant was delicious, and I was especially impressed with the variety of options available.  Overall, I had a wonderful stay at your hotel, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable and welcoming place to stay. The hospitality of Ridvan, Hekmat, and Fatmanur made my stay even more enjoyable.  Thank you again for a wonderful experience! No swimming pool

Excellent location opposite the station. Breakfast selection was good albeit the same each day. Futons were so comfy. Get the Japanese style rooms - spacious & comfy.  My children enjoyed the playroom.  Coin operated laundry & dryer onsite came in handy.   Good restaurants a short walk down the main road, across the bridge.  The external elevator was useful. Soap/shampoo/conditioner.

The beach access was great and the pools. Very family friendly and the room was wonderful. Clean rooms and bathrooms. We will definitely book here again. The layout of the hotel. But once we figured out where the room was it was all good

Great location. More than enough space for 2 adults and 1 5 year old. Access to Flora was really easy, we used the pool there most days and our 5 year old son loved it. Massol itself was very quiet but ideal if you prefer a more relaxed stay Cleaners were v poor. Left the door open the first time they cleaned. Left only 2 towels for 3 the second time. Didn‚Äôt clean at all the 3rd time. Minor disappointment in an overall great stay but they were v poor!!

Only stayed one night en route to Scotland. Nice clean hotel, family room was huge! Bed was comfy, plenty of tea and coffee in the room. Bar prices were very reasonable. Breakfast was fantastic, especially since I didn't realise it was included in the price. Bathroom was way above my expectations for a hotel. The toilets in reception were impeccable! (I judge a lot on an establishment by the cleanliness of toilets, and these were fantastically clean) The staff were friendly and approachable. If we come this way again we'd definitely look to book here first. A minor concern initially was we could hear people in rooms when in the corridors, although when in our room we didn't hear others. Only 1 window in our room had the ability to open. We thought that we'd get too warm, but fortunately we didn't.
Great service from the staffs and they cooperate with the surprise cake for my daughter for free. Thank you so much! The breakfast is delicious also worthy. None.

Very correct 2 stars hotel, very clean, nice staff. The  bathroom is small but in good conditions which is more important than the seize.  Very close to the metro station, convenient to travel fast to Paris city center. Very lively terasse just close to our bedroom.  Altough we would have liked to join the party we were with our kid, so a bit noisy.  Truth being said the music stopped at a very reasonable hour.

Really great stay, reliable, roomy, excellent location  and v clean. Staff were great and attentive. Great to stay with children. Easy, near tram, galleries and centre but not noisy at all. Good temperature in rooms, really relaxing rooms, blackout curtains and very comfy beds.     On arrival we had to wait a little while because of some very demanding and rude customers but staff dealt with it so gracefully. I felt sorry for the staff with these type of guests.     My mum left her mobile phone in the hotel room and the staff arranged for it to be couriered to UK very cheaply. They were so helpful. The only issue was our room door which twice was left unlocked and slightly ajar by cleaning staff when we returned from having been out all day. The staff said they would fix this security risk immediately. This was the only issue we had while staying.
The hotel is situated in central location and secured well. The pool is great and kids friendly. Not to mention reception lady is very helpful. In house cafe is required

Holiday Style is located on the main street directly opposite Nopparat Thara beach in Ao Nang - easy walking access to the Night Markets, a variety of restaurants, convenience stalls and longboat services to other beaches and islands. We booked a two-bedroom suite and were lucky enough to be allocated pool-access rooms (interconnecting) - the pool next to the rooms was separate from the main pool, which meant it wasn't busy with strangers right outside your door, but being able to step out and straight into water was fantastic, especially for the kids.  The main pool is heated and lovely, and breakfast was plentiful (if lacking a bit in variety).  Wifi access and speed was great, and they have a laundry room on site, which was very handy. The rooms are in desperate need of maintenance - our showerheads spurted water in all directions and one was almost breaking, one phone did not work whilst it was barely possible to hear on the other, drainage in one shower was questionable.  Towels are fairly old and worn, and the TV only has 5 working channel.  I did request for the showerheads to be looked at, but no-one ever came. These are all small things that in isolation are not a big deal, but added up makes a difference.

personal was really polite and very helpful. Sauna and Swimmingpool on the top floor has really nice view and you can enjoy your time there with your family alone.  Also they have presented vine during accommodation and few bottles of water for trip back home. Nothing

We were with my 1 year old baby girl. The birthday was celebrated by hotel staff (thanks for attention). They helped with late check out. Every day during breakfast day offered extra things for baby (banana, cereal). The location is perfect. The staff is amazing. The rooms were so clean. Again, I never saw such amazing staff. Hope to see them again during my next trip! Thanks! Nothing

Nice modern and spacious room. Good cleaning standards. Upon arrival the staff was not very friendly or welcoming, which was very surprising considering that we had a small baby with us.  When checking out, there was a different team but only one person seemed to be friendly.

The hotel is located across the street from the beach, close to a playground and a children's museum. It is within walking distance of several restaurants. The room is large and has a kitchenette with dinnerware. It was clean, spacious, quiet, and perfect for our trip. No complaints.
This is my second visit in this hotel. This is completely family Hotel. I highly recommend this   Place if you planning stay near Delhi Airport. Nothing

Great location in the Wellington airport which was convenient for an early morning departure flight. The room was modern, comfy and quiet. Very, very expensive stay for a family of four (they gave use 2 connecting rooms). Bathrooms were also quite small and a bit hard to move around in.

Great room layout for family. Cot supplied for baby. Staff very friendly and accommodating. No plug found for bath. I could‚Äôve requested one and I‚Äôm sure they would‚Äôve supplied but was late so left it.

We loved staying at property. Great staff, clean place, great location, great breakfast, the heated indoor pool, and exercise room was fabulous. Great stay! üòÄüòÄ Everything was great! I would recommend many people in future to stay at Embassy. Myself and family will definitely be staying at Embassy in the future again. We felt very comfortable and staff was great.

Amazing location. Few minutes walk from St Peters Square and lovely streets with bars and places to eat.  Extremely comfy beds and kids loved having NETFLIX to watch after a day of sightseeing. One of the bathrooms felt a little cramped and toilet didn't flush properly. Privacy has been addressed with a roller blind.

Good Spacious Room sufficient for my family of 3 Good location within 1/2 Km from Metro Station and many nearby eateries. Room included Washing machine, microwave, iron etc. AC could have been better No instructions provided for operating the washing machine

Beautiful surroundings, immediate access to the forest and climbing sites. We have got a very big and comfortable room with a direct access to the garden which was very convenient with our dog. The breakfast was good with a decent variety of savoury and sweet food. The hotel has an indoor swimming pool which is a big plus. The renovations are planned in early 2024 so we are looking forward to stay there again and see the new swimming pool area. It‚Äôs a great place for a family weekend. Drinks at the bar are too expensive.

The bed is good, as well the bathroom. The breakfast is really good! The pillows are very thin and small what is pretty bad. You can only access the pool if you pay the SPA, and the worst thing is that SPA do not accept children under 16!!! It‚Äôs very frustrating‚Ä¶ I have checked in the reception that the breakfast starts 6:30 with ‚Äúcold‚Äù meals, but at 6:30 we couldn‚Äôt access the breakfast area and they offered only black coffee and tea in the hall. I was really disappointed.

Beautiful cottage, very comfortable, amazing location. We had a lovely time and would definitely book again. Car parking is on the main road which can be a bit tricky for families with kids but the driveway of next door cottage was used for loading and offloading kids and luggage. But the cottage itself is amazing, most beautiful views and cute decor throughout. Vey happy with the living conditions, very comfortable. Kids absolutely loved it.

The hotel is a lovely old coaching inn and there is still lots of character and charm from its history around the hotel like the bells around the stairway which would call staff to different rooms for service. We used to come here as children and I always enjoy coming back. It is always so central near the city centre and beautiful cathedral. A bit tired in the bathroom

I loved the location and it was really spacious the beach and the heated pool was amazing! The pier is really close to the hotel and another of restaurants  and stores. There was only 3 forks and 1 bowl for a family of five no pot holders and bare minimum  to cook with. Maybe even have a broom so we could sweep the sand.

Location is very good, close to Campa and Carlov Bridge. The room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast also was nice. Near this hotel is very good fish restaurant. Hotel has many stairs, that‚Äôs why it is really hard to accommodate with little children and buggies.

The property looked very nice and smelled fresh and clean when walking in the front lobby. looks like they are under construction which is great to see they are working on improvements. it is looking awesome! The room was made up very nice! great job housekeeping!! From a census of my family, it is they would have liked more options for breakfast, and would have liked to have an ice machine, but other wise they loved the stay, comfy, quiet, clean, and the staff were great!

It is a short drive from the airport and to local attractions like santa's village.. the accommodation is spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 children.. it was very clean and well equipped for our short stay. Beautiful surroundings that are well kept too.  All the staff we encountered were very helpful and polite. Thank you for an enjoyable stay! There was no oven, limited food to purchase to cook at the chalet, and no supermarket within walking distance, when temperatures drop to -24‚Å∞ you don't want to risk walking for 2 hours and taxis are around ‚Ç¨40. That was the only negative.

The one bedroom apartment is great with 2 small kids. It has 2 balconies with nice view. The restaurant is great, the food is very tasty, especially at dinner. The spa center is decent. I also like that there's a small kids room and playing room with billiards, table football and table tennis. There was not great variety of food in the breakfast but the products are good quality and very tasty. I didn't like the coffee.

Location was great, family friendly, also very comfy beds and clean rooms. Loved the large walk in showers, great for kids to quickly wash up! Great location, 25 minutes to Key Largo, next to a Target for all quick needs, Pinecrest Bakery is also close by which is great for delicious Cuban food. We couldn't get conjoined rooms, just next to each other - still not bad, but with 6 kids, we were hoping to have connecting rooms.
location is good, and baby supplies could be provided by the hotel on request basis (especially love the pajamas), but sadly the children's pajamas could not be boughtü§£ no
Wonderful ryokan in a great location. Room was spacious and comfortable. Staff were lovely and provide a great tea ceremony and breakfast. Highly recommend. Family loved it. Nothing
Warm, friendly welcome, the rooms were immaculate & the bed was so comfy (and I'm very fussy) kids enjoyed it and got to help feeding the cows. Nothing. I couldn't fault anything
Great city location, our family was able to walk to a plethora of cafe's and restaurants for meals. Clever use of the space to make it work for a family. Some coffee sachets would be nice.

Pros:  The food in the restaurant was great.  The heritage feeling was good.   Staff was courteous.  The garden view and the swing in the garden are very nice.  There was a puppet show in the evening that kids can enjoy.    Cons:  Rooms and even the bathroom felt a bit gloomy with the dim lighting  Pool had rusted stairs. The dim lighting and the gloomy feeling
Ideal place to stay with your family for one day Good Food, and staff in the restaurant are very helpful and polite  Food is great, specially Poori & Bhaji and

Rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable.  The amenities were fun and well kept. We could have spent a full day just playing at the property.  The staff was wonderful. We came early to get our parking pass so we could go to Dollywood with friends. I didn‚Äôt expect to be able to check in early but they checked and said it was ready so we were able to get that done. It made all the difference getting back late at night with sleeping kids. Absolutely wonderful experience, we will be back! The only thing was the bathroom door and shower door were kind of cramped. Nothing terrible but not a great set up.
Kids playground and Pool Generator too loud.

We were traveling with family from both the Netherlands and the US and experienced comfortable beds, clean rooms and facilities, very friendly and helpful staff, and location was great for exploring the city. One of the rooms was a jr suite and accommodated 3 in the room comfortably. nothing! we liked it all.

Beautiful garden where we ate dinner. Excellent accommodation -- the family room we stayed in was large and tastefully decorated. The building was very old and sturdy which meant we didn't hear the other guests at all. Breakfast room also a lovely calm space. The products in the bathroom were natural and smelled lovely.   We walked from here to the next village along backroads through vineyards (20 mins) to arrive at the train station which took us into Reims (5 mins). Note: the train only comes once an hour. The accommodation was easy to find too. Honestly there was nothing to not like. I'd highly recommend this place for people travelling with children, there was even play equipment that belonged to the owners as well as lush grass to sit on.

Fantastic place. The pools were amazing, the breakfast superb. Everything was clean, staff was very friendly (there was a waiter I saw during breakfast and dinner, he probably worked over 12 hours that day and he was still smiling and playing with the kids - unbelievable!)  It was in front of the beach, my room had seaview, there was space to hang wet clothes outside, the room had a separate living room with all kitchen amenities and we asked for a cot and they also gave us a baby bath tub.   I'd stay again in this place a million times The only thing I wish we had was a proper double bed instead of two single ones side by side

From the moment we arrived the team welcomed us with warm smiles and caring tone so the children felt very at ease. The facilities were brilliant and kids felt like they were rock stars. The pool was perfect for adults and kids enjoyed it too. We only had 1 night, wished we had 3! The light switches at night were hard to work out which was a bit annoying and the two cups provided for tea and coffee were tiny so it was a 'sip' of your drink not much more.

Hotspring inside the room was good, water fills up fast and is hot. Location is alright, lots of food around the area. Toilet door cannot be locked, curtains are placed outside the toilet which kids can open if they are playing outside while someone is showering inside. Design overall is not very young children or wheelchair friendly

Bangkok and particularly the areas closeby the airports are busy places. The moment you enter this little boutique hotel you feel like entering an oasis: you forget everything going on outside. The two ladies running the hotel are by far the best I've ever experienced in any hotel. They are very warm hearted, friendly and were trying to accommodate every need we had. My 5 yrs old daughter got very sick. The assistance and help we received exceeded by far everything I could ever have expected. Awesome with and without the assistance. THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!! I liked all.

I like the huge room and comfy bed. the dining area have a lot of crow, not a good experience with it while we are having breakfast there. and I ordered a baby cot, and they confirmed already but end up there are cot in my room.

Location and amenities. Comfy bed, working TV with cable, and walking distance to bars and restaurants as well as the Walton Arts Center. Overall great stay. If I had to give honest feedback, it got cold. Even though I set the temperature remote well into the 70s, I couldn‚Äôt feel it. I could hear street noise as well - for me that‚Äôs not an issue and it‚Äôs probably beyond your control. I would imagine that it probably wouldn‚Äôt appeal to families with kids though- for me it was fine though.

Villa Retreat truly exceeded expectation.  The family suite was spacious, clean, comfortable and stylish.  The staff couldn't have been more helpful, attending to our every request.  Two bedrooms became 3 with an extra small bed in the additional room for our child.  The food delicious, the breakfast menu in particular varied, beautiful setting with a lawn overlooking the valley below.  Right alongside Coaker's Walk, a short walk down to the lake.  The fire being lit each evening in the suite was a lovely touch.  Would highly recommend. Nothing, possibly add a small fridge in the kitchen/dining area.

Excellent central location. Kids loved the pool and the pool bar was great.  One of the cleaners would leave a different towel animal on our beds each day, elephants, rabbits, dogs, my son was excited each day to see what he had on his bed. Grounds and pool area are a little run down. The rooms (especially the bathrooms) weren't very clean.  Any items accidentally left by the pool side (clothing, shoes) were never seen again..... even after leaving descriptions with ground staff, cleaning staff and reception. Can't say for sure that other guests didn't pick them up but one pair of shorts were absolutely picked up by ground staff because I watched him out my window.
Great for children - but sad when we found friends staying at the Mercure & hotel deals for the light show Long way to walk to the pool & reception

Positives- Beautiful quiet location. Connecting family rooms have private balcony with loungers so kids can sleep separately. Free parking /lots of spaces. Excellent Staff. Opposite Miramar shopping centre Sea views Spa (additional charge, very common for this region) Huge spacious rooms Hot water, good pressure. Excellent soundproofed rooms Good WiFi on 4th floor.  We went during the off season in January, extensive and beautiful Christmas decorations in the hotel.Would recommend as a family hotel for a laid-back family, not looking for entertainment  just a nice setting where kids can play by the beach, adults can relax, or a couple looking to get away to a quiet, beautiful location for a few days.   Negatives- Gym - very basic and very hot/windows facing sun with no Aircon. No good local places to eat you need to go into fuengirola (15 min drive - not an issue if you are driving/taxis) With so many restaurants, we were surprised to find nowhere to eat in the hotel between 16:00 and 19:30. We wanted to eat in the tapas restaurant (closed) or in the lobby bar/lobby balcony and were told we could only eat a burger, ham and cheese sandwich or order from the more varied room service menu which can only be eaten in the room (not served in lobby bar/balcony or anywhere else in hotel) + costs an additional charge of 12 Euros on top of order. It was also very quiet we were one of two guests in the lobby bar at the time so felt they could have made an exception so we could eat in the hotel and enjoy the hotel surroundings, we ended up eating in Miramar shopping centre instead and never got the chance to use the hotel restaurants apart from the buffet as we only stayed one night/half board.  Easy win for the hotel would be changing the shower heads to rainfall showers to upgrade experience. Generally not happy with the lack of food choices for dinner, but it was tasty. We came at a very quiet time in the off season so may be more varied in summer. Breakfast was fine.  One restaurant should be open at all times in public areas.  Overall nice experience but we expected better for the price and from a 4star hotel.

Close to beach and value for money the price of rooms and the view was absolutely amazing The bed wasn‚Äôt very comfortable  And wasn‚Äôt anything for my sons to do but play pool , they got bored quickly in the evening

Great location to shops & restaurants. Spacious and comfortable. Attention to detail. Coffee facilities in rooms. Great secure space for kids to run free.  provider lamps and candles for load shedding. Could consider investing in an inverter to run TV; lights & a kettle during load shedding.

Loved the toiletries so much I have now written to the company providing them to see if they sell to individuals as well.  Their make up remover wipes were the best I've ever tried.  The toiletries include hair conditioner.  For some reason, we didnt get a nail file for the first 2 nights, got one on the 3rd, by which time I had already gone out and bought one.    Was travelling with a 3 year old, wrote to the hotel beforehand and they provided her a robe sized 3-4 yrs, her own slippers, a children's toiletries set, and as we were checking in, they gave her a rubber duck as a gift.    A decent sized mini fridge with enough space for both the hotel-provided drinks that were refilled daily and our own fruits and snacks to keep fresh.    Very close to the Mansion House tube station, which sits on the Circle line, making it easy for seeing the city centre.    Loved a pizzeria near the hotel - Pizza Vics on Cannon Street - so much that we had take away from there twice during our 3 nights trip :D Not necessarily 'didnt like', but more of a suggestion. Offer some kind of step stool for people travelling with kids, and a potty would be very appreciated.

We had a fabulous stay with our 8 month baby. We were lucky to be upgraded and were given a cot for her. Great breakfast and loved the tom yum noodles on the second morning. Beautiful view, lovely staff and a great beachside pool. Nothing

Right on the beach with a locked entrance to the hotel grounds. The pool area is very nice with plenty of lounging chairs and a shower to rinse off pool water or ocean water. Rooms are basic but large enough for a family of four. Staff is excellent and can book tours for you. We were able to use their shower after our check-out time. This was our 3rd stay and we will stay there again. Everything is great!

We stayed in the penthouse unit. The room was super clean. Clean and functional kitchen utensils, plates, and cutlery. Strong shower with hot water. Easy check-in & out. Conveniently located next to the station and yet very quiet. Fantastic view of the platforms. We enjoyed watching trains and the station with our son. Highly recommend. Everything was good.

You can enjoy your off time after a day of activities in the Falls. Hotel maintains a very good standard with a reasonable price.   It is far away from the falls and view was not important for us. Room was great (702) and beds were conmfy and we had a good rest and sleep. restaurants and fast foods are all in 15 mins walking distance.   We used the pool and my son enjoyed it a lot in early morning. all was good
Good location adjacent to a mall, MRT and bus station. Moderna and spacious family rooms. I can't think of anything not to like.
Full equipment apartment with all things that your need for comfort stay. Quiet and nice and fits for family staying. Close to all main tourists activities. In badroom a conditioner a little noise.
It was clean and friendly and breakfast was good The pool was under repairs so no swimming, but that happens my son was just a bit disappointed but he survived!!
Services from the staff are excellent.  The kids loved the pool. The price.

The family suite was spacious and worked well for traveling families. The staff was polite, the location was good, and it felt safe. The lights did not work properly our first night and they did not fix the problem; additionally, while the staff was courteous, when you asked about local restaurants or attractions they had few recommendations and weren‚Äôt able to provide suggestions, nor did they offer help in making reservations.
Big room, great staff and food the pool area is small and had a group of teens unsupervised who took over the pool-diving, jumping etc‚Ä¶ when young kids were trying to swim in the 3ft area

property was close to beach with a nice view the parking wasn‚Äôt appropriate for the facility. there should be at least one spot per unit available and there isn‚Äôt which leads to families have to park AWAY from the facility and walk with young children to and from. I strongly dislike that. The bathroom shower also leaks bad.
It was across from Convention Center where my daughter Gina was working. Close to Boardwalk. Long walk to the beach with children and a handicap daddy.

Location was key for me as I was a mother travelling with her daughter to an unfamiliar city. It felt very safe around the hotel and we were near everything and more importantly we had a choice of restaurants very close to the hotel for evening dinner.    Room was much nicer in reality than what website pictures showed It was perfect for our needs

Great staff, very polite. Nice place and location. Gave us public transport tickets for the city free of charge. Tasty breakfast Good extra bed for the baby. Water leakage in the shower is a little bit uncomfortable
Excellent location- close to everything, friendly staff, clean room, comfortable beds. I travelled with my son so we booked the twin rooms, it was the perfect choice. n/a

The family room was big, clean and comfortable. Great beds and shower. Little details in the room that made it very liveable. You can have breakfast in the room if you order beforehand. Parking behind gate. The staff were not really that friendly. It was almost like you were imposing on their time. That's a great pity. However the managers were friendly and very accommodating.

The pools were great for kids, slides were great fun. The entertainment for the kids was brilliant and all of the the entertainers were lovely. The food was nice, something for everyone. You pay 4 star you get 4 star food. The hotel is lovely and clean and staff are happy to help. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people with young families its great. The town around is very Spanish (which is what i like), there is not much nightlife, if that's what you are looking for you wont find it in Pineada but we went with the kids so this didn't bother us. There is a few lovely restaurants in the town and down the road in Callella. The only thing i would say is that there are not enough sunbeds in the hotel for the amount of people that stay there. You have to get down to the pool around half 8 to get a sunbed. The rooms are a bit on the small side if you have a big family but they are very clean and nice and modern. The room for the entertainment in the night is very very hot but it is August so its expected and there are a lot of people that stay in the hotel. This did not affect our holiday in any way but i think people should know before they go. Also they have a cocktail menu with cocktails you have to pay for and certain drinks you have to pay for but I think that's the same in most hotels now. If you are all inc you get the drinks you have to pay for at half price. We didn't pay for many drinks at all maybe the odd cocktail. Also If you re-use your bath towels you will collect water points which you can hand in and get free cocktails and other drinks. I think its 6 tokens for a free cocktail. i used all mine at the end of my holiday so that was good.

Loved the property, the service, the breakfast on the terrace and the decor ! Location is very good too. Beautiful sunset view from the terrace. Nothing that I can think of ! Perhaps - they can add a complimentary 30 minute spa for the family guests knowing parents are always tired when traveling with the kids. It would be great to have pampering session and just a suggestion that will bring your customers back again and they will highly recommend it to all their friends as well.
A variety of programs especially for kids, a large and beautiful environment, and professional staff differ this hotel from other one Nothing

In general, very nice stay. Especially, the water park and the kids club. Also, staff is very friendly and the room cleaning service is very good. The room interior is old, but ok. The room is clean. The buffet is also ok, but it could be a bit more exciting for a 4-star hotel. Wifi is perfect. Minor improvements for a 4-star hotel is expected: - Push car for luggage - A shelf or similar in the bathroom to store things better - Tissues for each room - Beach towels should be offered for free - Kitchen towel - Safety box with key and for extra charge is not 4-star standard

Centrally located with supermarkets, shopping malls and railway station across the street. Kitchen fully equipped. Perfect for a family holiday. No lobby. No wardrobe for hanging clothes at the third room, and the two cots are fitted with pulleys so that the beds are easy to move when sleeping on them.

The room is big, the breakfast was great I sent the hotel and mentioned that we are a family with 2 kids, we arrived after 24 hours of traveling and there was no bed for our kid, we had to stay together with him in the same bed.

Breakfast was great.   Room was comfortable.   Swimming pool was good fun.   Staff were polite. To many dogs in the hotel.   Limited menu for kids in the bar and no vegetables with the meals.    Table in the room where the kettle was, felt like it was going to fall apart.

The hotel was very modern and has some nice design choices. We booked two rooms on the way to and way back from another destination and on the way back we had a huge room with a separate living area, for the same price as the tiny room we had on the way out! Not sure why but it was a nice surprise.  We had warned the hotel we had a 6 month old baby with us and they had provided and set up a cot in the room for us which was really appreciated. Breakfast was a great selection and the pastries were delicious.  The location of the hotel is perfect for travelling elsewhere. Lots of restaurants around too and even a macdonald's! Staff were really friendly and one of the staff members really made a fuss of our baby which was sweet. We would definitely stay again. The baby cot provided had the thinnest mattress, it was rock hard! We didn't expect a cot to be provided so it didn't matter, but maybe something to improve. We ended up padding the mattress out with bathroom towels underneath the top sheet.

The owner was super helpful and offered pick up and drop off in Arusha, free of charge   he does everything to help you keep safe.  Its a quite and simple place and the kids loved the beds and of course Wifi.  Breakfast was more than sufficient.  A little camp fire was a nice touch.  He is doing a great job. Eating dinner was not a great idea, food was not great and not good value for money, you can eat locally for much cheaper.  It is an African experience, but the out doir kitchen outside my window was my alarm call.
Clean, modern apartment  Lovely hotel Large and clean pool/area Kids activities Friendly staff No late check out

Comfortable beds, food was so nice really enjoyed it beside the bread was never fresh my mother in law complained, and friendly stuff from reception to the house keepers love them Not changing my bedding even after my daughter had dirty them i still slept on same bedding for the past 4days. And there was some dirt underneath the bed room 909 we saw it when my daughter played with her toys.   Secondly the knocking at the door while we still in the room  3rd eish its next to the clubs so at night not nice to sleep.  Last room service delivery guy not friendly too seriously as if he get irritated for ordering food at night but had no choice my baby was hungry and grandmother. And their bread was never fresh my mother in law complained we had to toast it and we also got cold eggs and they should train them how to do cheesy melty omelet

the guest service front desk officer were excellent and guest service manage was very cordial and sincere about guest satifaction,the property is in posh area of bangkok,the area is very sober,clean and sophisticated ,and the accomodation is very much perfect to live during work travelling and family vacation with kids and family.i was booked the place for 3 nights first then i extended up to 7 nights and again i am going there for 1-2 nights .the stay was pleasant.thanks to the manager meen to take good care of guests during there stay to make it happened. some front desk male staff were a bit rude but the manager took really proper actions and tried her best to satisfy the guest.
Central location, met our needs, tidy.  Great  breakfast. Shared shower facilities, although it was quiet, so it was just our family.

Excellent location.  So clean.  Everything in good working order and looks very new.  Children loved playing outside with the toys and trampoline.  Very good price. Parking can be a bit challenging. Note, the driveway is accessed from the main road, not small laneway which is the address given.

We stayed here for one night for a birthday treat for our son. He loves staying in hotels. We were in the area anyway doing an activity early in the day so it made sense for this to be out chosen hotel. The room was lovely, had a nice view, even though it was the car park, the surrounding buildings made it different. We opted for room only when we booked but added breakfast on later in our stay. We had the option of a room hanger to have breakfast on bed which was a nice touch. Breakfast was served between our specified time and was lovely. The restaurant provided us with to go boxes for the food we couldn't finish during our evening meal. The restaurant staff were lovely too. The shower was nice, but every so often would turn a little cold then extremely hot but otherwise was good. As it was a treat for my son, on booking, it asked if we had any special requests, I mentioned his birthday and they very kindly provided him a birthday treat that was in the room on our arrival. The swimming pool was lovely, had a jacuzzi, steam room and sauna too. Nothing but good things for this hotel. The shower ran cold and too hot at times but otherwise was great.

We got a nice 2 rooms apartment for us and our kids. The place was clean and quiet. We had good breakfast. Staff was very helpful. The place is near the central & busy Taksim place yet it is in a quiet street. There are groceries around opened 24/24 which is very convenient. The transfer from airport to hotel has been dysfunctional and we waited 1 hours at the airport. The transfer from hotel to airport has been seamless.

It was unique, very clean and spacious rooms. The breakfast was so nice every day. Loved the cocoa tea. The set up was wrong, the only pool bar was near the children‚Äôs pool. There were 4 swimming pools but they were all so quiet every day. The sun loungers need shade the damaged ones need to be replaced asap.
very nice and soft beds, the children loved the waffle maker. the corridors towards the rooms looked a bit run down

The apartment is a short walk from the ce tte of town and is very comfortable. The contact with the owners was great. It‚Äôs on the 5th floor with no lift so not ideal for people with very young children.
The kids really enjoyed all the different pools that was available. There were no staff working in the pool area when we had questions about the facilities.

The location of the apartment was absolutely great. A few minutes to a long sandy beach and the night street (strip) too. Convenient place with supermarket, tavernas and Mezes just next door. Studio apartment was Cretan style, clean and comfy with working AC. A kitchenette with fridge and small electric stove with utensils. Bathroom with hair dryer, gel etc. Nice terrace with chairs and table and lot of flowers and greenery around. I liked the fact that every room had a clothes rack.  Fedon is an absolute great host. He is a friendly and helpful guy. Gave us tips &suggestion to visit places in Crete. Catherina, sweet and pleasant who kept the place clean. Fedons son, Andres knew exactly what the guest wanted for breakfast. We truly enjoyed our stay here. I would recommend this place but keep in mind its not a luxury apartment. The swimming pool is not in the premises. It is outside 2-3mins walk, but a public recreational pool. It is meant for small kids. So you don't feel too comfortable. You cannot take your own food there, you have to purchase from the bar inside. And also pay for the slides.   There was a small window in the bathroom which when opened would bring in the gutter smell from outside and fill up the room if it the room was unoccupied. And if we kept it closed, the humidity in the bathroom built up. They should install an exhaust.   Breakfast was the same everyday-bread, boiled eggs, ham, cheese, butter and jam. I wish there was some fresh greek yoghurt with fruits. Although the coffee was great.

Ten of us went to this hotel in Turkey (2 grandparents, 4 parents and 4 grandkids) to stay in three rooms. The reception staff were very helpful at check in to get us three rooms very close together.  The whole hotel was lovely with lots of facilities for all ages, particularly the children.  Food choices were usually good, drinks available whenever we wanted and the evening entertainment usually fine.  Overall all of us were happy with our choice of hotel. There were a few minor issues which could be improved upon:  - the evening meal didn't start until 7:00pm.  This was late for the children and seemingly for most people as the restaurant was rammed from 7 - 8:30.  A 6:30 or earlier would be better  - the evening meal finished at 9:30. If you came in just before that there was food available till 9:30 but then it was all cleared away and the lights were turned off.  This spoiled the evening for those wishing to avoid the early rush and and eat a little later.  - the hotel had stated that everything was open from 1st April.  This was not the case and several bars and speciality restaurants were closed

Bathtub was big and shower was really nice Comfy beds Big rooms for family Sick and refrigerator in room Couch and table Breakfast wasn't the greatest and half was cold To long of lines for breakfast and hardly didn't have much to offer
outstanding location infront of Duomo and at the back of Galleria   very cosy, clean Property the design of the cupboard‚Äôs has a lot of sharp edges which requires some cautious for Infants

Love that the spa was warm enough to be in even on the cold days. Our kids had a ball using the facilities of the park. Everything is easy accessible with a pram so my little one was able to be out with us while we played with our toddler. Loved that our accommodation had a bucket and spade for the kids to take to the beach. I think the office should sell or hire out pool noodles. would be handy for young families.
I had the family room which was excellent, large, comfortable and very clean. the breakfast, all the staff and the service was very good no comments

The breakfast was fine, the coffee could be a bit betterüòÖ the staff was polite and helpful. The hotel was so close to sainsbury and many buses to reach the underground. Bit far from the city centre. Beds comfortable. A few things weren't good, unfortunately. At the arrival, my mum and dad ( they had another room) ended up in a room already occupied by other people, and they had to go down again to have another room. The second room they had it was with 2 single beds instead of a double bed as requested. If they wanted, they could have it, but it was on another floor, but we asked to have close rooms. In the end we quite like the rooms because they were communicating and the girls could go from our room to them all the time. Also the staff was very sorry and they gave us 4 free drinks.Our radiator was broken so it was quite cold also because the little portable radiator was not strong enough.
