Also, plugs were on the only table, so we ended up having the radiator on the table. In my parents' room the light in the toilet wasn't working so they couldn't close the toilet door. Little things, nothing major. We requested a cot for our little baby but the room wasn't big enough so we had to close it away and she slept with us.

The free breakfast buffet was perfect has a little bit of everything. My spouse and I plus our dog üêï, stay in one of the rooms with a spa tub ( Jacuzzi tub ), witch was fantastic.   The room was very clean.   Hotel is child friendly with indoor pools,very friendly staff I will definitely stay here again.  MY FAVORITE PART WERE ALL THE FROGS üê∏ ‚ù§Ô∏è üíô üíñ       My only down side I had->->  Ice machines were all out of service. I have nothing bad say. About this fantastic hotel. My experience with Nest western in Elko NV was fantastic. We will definitely be booking here again.

It was all lovely and clean the beds were comfy and the pool was a good size to for family's The only thing I wasn't happy with was the deking outside as was all over the place and a few nails sticking out

Big 5 bedrooms home great for dual family living. Open plan kitchen/family room. House placed in a nice tropical garden, well maintained. Well appointed kitchen. Good water pressure in the shower. Big terrace and patio with bbq. A second TV in the 5th bedroom would have been nice, away from kids and their parents at night. Also a coffee maker machine would have been appreciated.  The second toilet door was faulty and couldn‚Äôt be closed. Bedroom windows could not be opened to let the fresh air in. Terrace needed a good clean.   No aircon in the bedrooms, only in the living area. The night was very cold, 11 degrees Celsius and we were cold in the bed.

In newly painted and carpeted unit (unit 37) which was comfortable and clean. Kitchen well fitted out with plenty of utensils. Bit cold for swimming but pools looked inviting and other facilities like tennis court, jumping castle would have been fun for kids. Balcony overlooks other balconies- no sitting out in pyjamas. No dedicated car space (even outdoors) so often had to park in visitor parking at end of row.

The large family suites were awesome. The AI assistant was an efficient way to communicate with staff and all requests were answered immediately. Free Wi-Fi Transportation was terrible.  The resort is big enough to provide a better option for guests.  The amount we spent on Uber will keep us from returning.   The restaurants weren‚Äôt great.

Surprisingly good family hotel. Comfortable rooms and with a very interesting design choices. Great breakfast buffet for the whole family where everyone could find something they liked. You wont have better location to visit Liseberg. The food choices outside the breakfast were limited and not that great. Not much international with the "international" lunch buffet. It was not terrible but can be better. Some of the restaurants were also closed and not much information if/when they were supposed to be opened.

The staff are very kind and my family love the breakfast included, buffet style. It‚Äôs not clean. The temperature of the centralized ac is very hot, although it is set on the lowest temp it still very hot inside.
This was our second stay, its a wonderful place! Friendly staff, good size room with enough sleeping space for our family Kids didnt like the loose headboards

We have stayed here a few times now as a break up of a two day journey from Netherlands to Slovakia. it is essentially a truck stop but with canteen and 24 hour shop on site. Large room, full breakfast, kids (6 and 9) were more than happy with it. The only thing that annoyed me is that the shower head does not have a bracket to connect to the wall. It was the same as last year so has not been fixed. That type of shower is quite common in Central and Eastern Europe but still it annoys me.

We booked the 1br apartment. It was spacious and comfortable. Staff unfriendly and not helpful at all. Could barely talk to anyone at the receptkon. Checkin was late. Food average. Very understaffed. Access to our building was not easy at all with stroller etc, had to climb up and down many stairs after climbing up the hill.
Great staff with fast service Excellent family hotel Spacious & comfortable rooms Breakfast options need improvement

Decoration. Space in the room. Rooftop! We thought the night would be calm (view on the tennis courts), but a place for kids is below and open until 23h. The glass-doors giving on the balcony was a bit old and could not be 100% closed

The staff couldn‚Äôt be nicer and more accommodating. The pool is open until 10pm so that helped pass the time when the kids were tired of the rides and the boardwalk. The location is also right down the street from the Friday night fireworks and since I don‚Äôt walk much, that was a big plus. The only thing I didn‚Äôt like is a minor issue, I parked next to the foot shower that people use to wash the sand off their feet and there was a LOT of sand on the ground that I stepped in, the sand ended up in my car‚Äôs carpet ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

friendly staff, lovely pool which is partly covered by a mesh type material so it doesn‚Äôt get too hot. Breakfast included served on the beach was a lovely experience and the outdoor shower was perfect. the only smoking area in the hotel / resort was by the pool, meaning there were often people chain smoking when you were trying to relax by the pool. I feel it would make more sense for customers‚Äô private gardens to be smoking areas.   the booking.com listing stated that they did laundry here, however they did not.   be aware that there are speaker systems which you can hear across the island which goes off for up to an hour at prayer time. not the hotels fault of course, but something to consider if you‚Äôre travelling with children as it often went off at 5am for an hour!

Absolutely fantastic nothing is to much trouble they go above and beyond for you such lovely rooms very comfy beds will definitely be back here again and will be bringing family with us Nothing it was a fantastic stay

Kids pool was good.  A decent room.  The staffs are very helpful and friendly.  Good options of breakfast for the kids. The bathroom had a smell.  The towels were not clean.  Not much of activities can be done in the resort itself.  The aircond was broken.  The ventilation was not good as it gets humid and then the floor gets sticky.
It was the the size for my family Problems to find parking space in the street.

Friendly and welcoming Staff. I also liked the location. It is in close proximity to many locations I have interest in. Great privacy and spacious for my family of 6; Husband, wife, 2 college bound kids and two middle and high school kids. No washer and dryer in the apartment.

Location was 10/10. Room was clean and comfortable. Pillows were not good, a selection/variation would have been appreciated. Luckily we only had hand luggage, there was no space to have suitcases etc. 2 adults, 2 children.
perfect set up for a family or a couple. separate bedroom area, great kitchen facilities and a lovely bar and breakfast the following day. loved it. no bath. but I'm a princess ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

The food and drinks are unlimited. There are facilities for children and clinic inside the resort. The buggy or transport are not always available and you have to walk several meters which is hassle for us with baby and stuffs to carry around.

The Family Two-Bedroom Apartment we stayed in was spacious and clean. Although we did not cook, the kitchen had more than enough appliances and utensils. The beds were comfortable: not too soft and not too firm. We liked that there was a separate bathroom and a toilet, which makes staying easier for a group. The breakfast had enough food to choose from and the two warm meal options were changing every day. The neighbourhood is quiet and picturesque and has a number of bars and cafes. It is a great place to stay on budget and to be not far away from the Old Town and the public transport (metro and tram)! There was no key to lock the door in the bathroom and we did not like the shampoo.  Although the Booking description of the hotel states: "Private parking is possible at a location nearby (reservation is needed) and costs ‚Ç¨ 10 per day.", the hotel, which we had contacted in advance, was able to reserve the parking only for two days and we were told to pay for the rest two days by ourselves, which cost ‚Ç¨ 23,5 per day. Thus, I think the parking information needs to be more specified.

The apartment felt so clean. The kitchen was well equipped with even a dishwasher (the first we've had in Italy)! Easy access to the beach was a highlight for our children. The sand was great for building sand castles, and the water was calm and shallow for small children.  Giuseppe, our host, was friendly, helpful, and quick to respond. There wasn't anything we did not like about this place.

Staff were friendly and helpful and the location was great. Not too far to walk to restaurants etc. The beds were rather uncomfortable, and we had a mould smell in our bathroom that was never fixed when asked.  Also, there is no elevator, so there are lots of steps when you're on the 3rd floor with 3 kids!!

Location was ideal and price for hotel was great staff were friendly. Room was a little small for a family room but was mostly clean there  was alot of  dust on dado rails .bathroom was tiny but did what it needed to do. A bin in the room would of been good .

beach and snorkeling were great  pools were really nice, large and several to choose from  lazy river was really fun  wildlife was plentiful and amusing  property was clean and well maintained  coffee shop was pretty decent  yummy dinner at the El Rancho steak house (although one of our kids got food poisoning) food was okay, sometimes good and sometimes bad  one of our five kids got food poisoning (the rest of us were fine)  restaurants were already booked up by the time we got there, so we were only able to eat at two of them (eating at the same one twice) 3 of the 5 nights and mostly after 7pm  drinks were okay, sometimes good and sometimes bad, generally not much flavor  bed was too soft and sloped to one side  sofa bed didn't stay together  bath tub drain plug didn't plug, also tub had a shower spray wand that leaked and there was water damage in the surrounding walls  shower doors leaked and water would pool in the bathroom floor unless care was taken to not spray near the shower doors  The shows were just okay, and we weren't very impressed

Immaculate gardens.Added beauty as well as a little cover between bungalows. Close to a couple food places and cafe.  Great swimming area nice and deep.  Wonderful friendly staff.  Nothing was too difficult. Very approachable.  In house mopeds for hire.  Great spacious bungalow that was comfortable enough for three people  with an extra cot.  Beautiful breakfast. Nothing , other than it‚Äôs  a good idea to have some form of transport anywhere on the island.

Check-in was easy, Owner Agnes very responsive on the phone.   Breakfast was good.  Facilities were clean. Kids able to play with some board games and toys in the bar area.  Location meant we can leave the car, and walk into York city centre Can't think of any really.

reasonably priced. Breakfast was great .kids enjoyed swimming pool. Noise from next door . basically, we were given one of the interconnecting rooms and could hear noise through the door. so poor soundproofing .
Great location right at the beach. We really enjoyed the property together with our 1 year old son. Breakfast could have a bit more variety

Amazing location for exploring San Juan! walking distance to all the sites but far enough to feel quieter. The room was super clean and breakfast every morning was so so delicious. Eddie was super friendly and he allowed us to leave our luggage there for a few hours after check out with no problems. He also gave us some great restaurant recommendations nearby. Not ideal if you‚Äôre looking to sleep in. Breakfast is 8:30-9:30 and was so delicious that we always got up for it, but we would have loved to sleep in a bit. Noise level is also dependent on the other guests. The walls are well insulated so you won‚Äôt be bothered by any normal talking-level sound but we stayed the same time as some kids whose parents allowed them to run around yelling in the main area at 8am.
Clean & good facilities. Helpfull n friendly staff. Smooth check in A bit far from tourist area, convenience store, family rest
got an upgrade to family room   easy access to all the places , eat outs , supermarkets etcs , minor issues but ok

The lovely welcome provided by everyone at the Temple, the experience of the morning prayer will always be remembered.  We stayed in the Moon Room- on a night it got down to -6 degrees.  The electric blankets and split system heater were fantastic at keeping us warm (there was also another heater that we didn‚Äôt use overnight).  The shared bathroom facility (shared with one other room) was really wonderfully set up and no problem for this family of 4.  We used the kitchen briefly- also we‚Äôll set up.   Other people were staying at the temple, but we didn‚Äôt see them.  The location is close to restaurants and food places and all that Takayama has to offer. Limit of 1 Hour for bathroom booking for a family of 4 per stay felt a bit rushed - esp. given it had a lovely big bath to use. Wasn‚Äôt clear if we could split our time and book a slot in the morning also- which would be handy for those who wanted to freshen up in morning before departure (ie. 40 mins at night, 20 mins in morning) . Notwithstanding, was a great experience we had staying at this wonderful temple.
It was Close to Our Family that was staying at a Nearby Gated Campground. N/A

I didn't eat breakfast although it looked very. I had breakfast plans with family that lived nearby. The room was very clean and comfortable. More than I expected. I can't think of a thing that could have been any better.

The family is absolutely lovely. They will help you with everything. Very social place, full of informations about the local area.  English speaking. Very  basic equipment and not very confortabke sleep. Not very clean either

The staff was very accommodating, professional and helpful. We had 2 connecting rooms with family but preferred singles. The staff accommodated our request after the first night. The breakfast was excellent, especially the ambience and charm of the restaurant and staff. Excellent location to walk the city.  We will definitely stay again. Short walk from the subway/train with our carry on luggage. Felt safe. The pillows were large and thick. I would have preferred a flatter option, however I didn't ask. It would have been nice to have wine glasses in the room's refreshment area, although it did contain a wine opener. We drank out of coffee cups.

Staying at Angelas coach house was perfect for me and my family. The place was extremely cosy, clean and well equipped - we just wish we could have stayed longer. Perfect base for our travels around Bristol/Bath. Thanks Angela for being a great responsive host! Nothing

Everything was absolutely perfect! The hosts are great, always available if you need anything. Breakfast was plenty and diverse. Location is perfect, just a short walk to the beach with pine trees. I would definitely recommend it to my friends and family. I have nothing to complain about.

Friendly staff. Very well equipped rooms and very well presented. Restaurant accommodated one family member with serious food allergy extremely well. We booked three suites, one for 4 days and the others for 2 days.The taxi service prompted and  booked via your web site badly let down some family members. Due to storms, flights were cancelled and an attempt, the DAY before, to change flight number to a new flight one hour later was declined as not being allowed under Booking .com policy . This resulted in a charge of 43 Euros being made which has proved not recoverable from Travel Insurance or the airline.  Strongly advise all travellers to be aware of the risk that they will loose their money if flights cancelled or delayed.
We loved the location just a short bus trip to see my family and a short walk to to all the shops! I didn‚Äôt like not having my own bathroom for what we paid

It was interesting staying in such an old location with a family vibe to those who were serving there.    Breakfast and dinner were included which was very relaxing. There were two groups of fellow travelers which changed the dynamics of the place.  A very loud group of high school male athletes and a band of "Art film"  individuals,  cameras, actors, action,  and 2 little dogs too.    Again the  GPS did not get us here corectly.

Absolutely loved this hotel, three double bedrooms, beautiful, elegant and classical decor. Fantastic facilities fully equipped kitchen to self cater though very close to local bars, restaurants and cultural sites. Staff couldn't do enough to help, nothing was too much trouble. Will definitely recommend to others for a family stay in Madrid üòÄ Nothing to dislike.

Exceptional host Ursula and her sons Lorenzo, and David. We enjoyed every moment of our stay. They are very welcoming and provided us with anything we needed. The elevator was not working the day we checked in, but Lorenzo and David helped us with luggage. Breakfast and snacks were great especially after long hours or flights and travel. They arranged taxis for us whenever we needed. Their hospitality is exceptional. Location of this place is very nice and convenient. Ursula is the Best host you can find in Rome. If we go back, we will definitely request this place to stay. Nothing
Family friendly Nothng

The apartment was clean, comfortable and very well furnished. The bathroom is really good and shower was amazing. It's in a really good ppace to go roaming around and close to the the bar areas, there's a supermarket and a drycleaning right opposite for necessities. All in all a very comfortable stay. The AC wasn't cooling very well, but I think that has something to do with needing to close the doors and letting it cool for a while. If you're a smoker, you'll need to go up and down the stairs to smoke outside(the staircase is a bit tricky, but I think most of the buildings in Portugal are like that) and the floorboards are creaky, so you'll hear the neighbours moving around on top esp if they've got kids but again wasn't too discomforting.
Spacious room for a family of 4. Strong smell from the common room, since there was a cooking class and different kinds of food.

If you come to Bali Asli Lodge you will have a true authentic Balinese experience, immersing yourself in the local culture. Ketut and his family will feel you welcome from the first moment, offering to prepare a delicious dinner for you after a long flight and helping to organize the places to see around Ubud. The rooms have all the basics you need and are cleaned every day. The view towards the jungle makes you feel really in the middle of the tropical nature. Don‚Äôt forget to ask Ketut if he can be your driver if you are planning some tours. He has been an excellent drivers for us, bringing us in different location for 3 days and giving us a lot of info about the local culture. Here you are in contact with the nature, it‚Äôs normal to hear noises of animals and it could be that a couple of bugs enter from the window. If you are looking for extra comfort during a vacation and the noises of the roosters early in the morning bothers you then this might not be the place for you. But you would miss all the rest that a luxury hotel can‚Äôt give you, a true contact with local people in a Balinese family.

I love staying here when I visit Leeds love the interior of the hotel it all looks amazing from the lobby to the bar. My husband and myself stayed in the family room it's lovely and big the beds are so comfy love the decor in the  room and the bathroom. It was the first time eating in the restaurant I can highly recommend it Just one little thing  There was a lovely long light up mirror fixed to the wall  but no socket next to it so couldn't  dry and straighten my hair there,  plenty of other sockets to use but no mirror next to them  But the room it's self was lovely

The hotel is located in the heart of the Cotillo village just a short walk away from the beach and the local restaurants and bars. I loved the rooftop terrace where you can sunbathe by the pool as well as taste some of the local cuisine. The only thing I could complain about (although it wasn't really a problem for us) is that the playground in front of the hotel can get a bit noisy as there's kids playing all day long.

The rooms were very clean. The breakfast was wonderful. I didn't like the fact that soon as breakfast time was finishing up that people were ready to clean all the table before people finished eating and had their children wiping the tables for them. The trash was overflowing both mornings at breakfast.

Villa Sophia is sitated  within meters of the beach which made our stay in Agios Gordios that much more enjoyable.   The sunsets are not to be missed.   I stayed in the family room on the ground floor which had 3 single beds perfect for myself and 2 teenagers. The apartment has aircon, wifi and a mini kitchen, which we varely used as the restaurants around town served delicious affordable meals.  The accommodation was very clean. The owners have created a beautful flower filled garden around the building that was a joy to see.  Beds very comfortable as were the pillows.  We could not have asked for a better holiday apartment and look forward to returning there.  People in the town are so lovely and friendly which made the holidays even lovelier. Nothing. It was much nicer than expected

very nice place and comfortable stay for the family, the owner and staffs are very welcoming and willing to help with your need. we're very pleased to stay here. the internet connection of the upper floor apartment were quite weak while when walk down stairs can have stronger signal.

The staff at check in was awesome!! We were in Ann Arbor for a family member at the UofM Hospital and did even make it to check in until 10 pm. The staff was just so incredibly nice and accommodating. The hotel and the room were just impeccably maintained and clean, we were very impressed. I didn't even realize we received a free breakfast which was a bonus and the ladies that were working the kitchen and breakfast area were just amazing. Staff has the best attitudes and that comes from good leadership! Definitely will recommend! N/A

The location is just fantastic! Rooms very comfortable and service good! Their home made complimentary cookies were the best in town! Loved the availability of apples, water and biscuits ate every floor! Our room view was also great! We were not give the parent's discount for our stay in spite of it being available as a normal practice at the hotel AND informing the reception staff while checking in that our child was studying at Dartmouth.

This was by far the best homestay we have had in all of Vietnam. The hosts are genuinely the most beautiful and caring people. From buying us coffee and tea in the morning because I was feeling sick, to organising our bus to our next destination. They were so helpful and are always so smiley and chatty, we truely felt like we were part of the family here. The free pedal bikes were so handy when getting around Hoi An and they also have a family run tailor business where they give you an affordable price for quality items. The room itself was super clean with perfect aircon, fast wifi and one of the comfiest beds we have slept in for a long time! Not to mention how close its location was to everything. Wish I could give this place more than a 10 rating because it truely deserves it. Thank you again to Love, Water and Green Garden, you ladies are amazing and we will never forget you! Love from Cheese and Mafia ‚ù§Ô∏è We loved everything about this homestay, we just wish we could have stayed longer!

The location which is easy accessible to Myeongdong and Insadong, and free flow of coffee at the lobby. Comfortable bed and the pillows were of the right firmness for me. We stayed in a family room with 1 Queen size bed and 1 single bed. There isn't enough space to hang our clothing, no wardrobe to keep our clothing too.
Very nice place for me I my family. Nice and friendly people. I will come back no

We stayed with our daughter at Riu for 7 nights. Everything was amazing, good food, friendly staff, all areas clean all the time, diverse shows every night. On our last day, we had the flight at 8pm and David from reception gave us a room with shower to use it before the flight and we didn't left the hotel after check out. We highly recommend this hotel and definitely we will be back. Nothing

This was my second stay at Funwhales and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. Audrey and his family are super friendly and welcoming. Breakfast is good and the place is so clean and comfortable. It‚Äôs close to the beach, restaurants and shops. Nothing
A FAMILY RUN HOTEL , WHO COULD NOT DO ENOUGH FOR YOU VERY HELPFUL AND EFFICENT FOUND THE SUNBEDS WERE HARD AS NO MATTRESSES SUPPLIED

The facilities were good for a family trip and the price for their penthouse (2-bedroom suite) was a steal. The inside of the penthouse was not very clean. The furniture was ran down with what seemed to be food spots on it , the penthouse was not ready at check in and the carpets in the penthouse seriously need to be cleaned. Also there are not enough sheets or towels to accommodate the entire hotel.

It gives me great pleasure to write very good opinions when I have the opportunity! Island Bungalow was the perfect choice for us!  We took Villa Kara and also Francipagne the three bedroom chalet for our group of 5 adults.  Villa Kara is perfect for a couple of 2 people and Francipagne with its 3 bedrooms was perfect for the rest of the group.  Francipagne is also very suitable for a family with two children because it offers a large bedroom on the ground floor with its own bathroom and two bedrooms with a shared bathroom upstairs.   On the ground floor there is also an open space with kitchen facilities and a large table where you can eat.  All rooms have AC and the appropriate equipment for high comfort  The staff (Rocky) very pleasant and helpful.  The breakfast, served outside on the terrace, was good and filling. - Our big regret is that we allocated too few days for La Digue. The island deserves a minimum of 3 days to enjoy everything it has to offer!  - The location also offers the possibility of renting bicycles (don't try to do like us and walk on foot!). The bicycles are not top-notch, but they are functional. We also needed a 3-wheel bicycle for my wife which was brought from another place but which was defective and we practically could not use it even though we were charged for it!  - The last part of the road to the location is unpaved and muddy due to the rain, an aspect that could perhaps be adjusted in the future because the location really deserves this effort!

excellent staff, breakfast amazing and a very handy location for the area around us. room was a bit tight with the extra bed for our teenage daughter & dog, however it was very clean and well presented. excellent shower!

Our room was clean and comfortable. Good water pressure and hot water in the shower.The local general store (David's) was charming. We rented the loft/duplex room (#15) for one night.The bathroom light wasn't working on our arrival, but a quick trip to the front desk and they had the problem fixed. There are notes posted above the outlets indicating you can only plug in one appliance at a time. My hairdryer quit halfway through drying my hair the next morning and it was the only appliance plugged into the outlet. We called the desk and left a message, but no one got back to us until we were about to check out at 11.  Also the light above the kitchenette sink didn't work.  The room was quite cold when we arrived because the windows were open. We closed them and tried to start the two fireplaces to take the chilli off, but neither remote would work. We had to use the electric baseboard heaters instead.  The bed on the lower level was firm to the point that our son couldn't sleep on it.   Self-serve breakfast consisted of coffee, stale pastries, toast and peanut butter/jam, packaged oatmeal, cold cereal. No juice, water or other drinks for non coffee/tea drinkers.

Location on the outskirts of the City Centre near the railway and river, City Centre and historical attractions within easy walking distance or otherwise accessible by regular bus routes. Proximity to the river and the Quay, a waterside redevelopment housing cafes and boutiques great option for evening entertainment. Staff very welcoming, family room was clean and though cosy, met all requirements. Buffet style breakfast great value and more than sufficient to feed growing teens. Given the cosiness of the room, provision of space for a proper morning stretch would have been a plus - not a problem in good weather with a short walk to grassed areas and a pair of trainers - on the other hand, there is an adjacent independently owned gym.

Very clean and modern. Very welcoming and knowledgeable hosts, felt like we were staying in a family home (but with a lot of personal space!)  Delicious breakfast! Need to find your own parking on the street (but not difficult as it‚Äôs a quiet side street)

The view and location where incredible! The private natural spring spa was so fun to do as the sunset and the stars came out!  The staff where so friendly and would do anything to help! Lovely family. Nothing

It was clean, and comfortable and location was fantastic. It was myself and my son, I had the main bedroom and he had the couch. If you like it to be quiet then be warned there is a bar down stairs which has loud music till after 3 am in the morning on some days of the week. This is why we were given ear plugs, other than that it was good value for money in Athens. The shower was large and fantastic! The loud music downstairs on some days of the week.
Service was amazing looking forward to stay n refer to my friends n family too All ok
Perfect location as visiting family close by  Spacious apartment  comfortable bed and seating spa pool not working :(

The location is good. My friend and I have stayed there before, and it was very ‚Äòtired‚Äô looking then, but we liked its location and for a 2 night stay, we thought it would be acceptable.  And they did have parking on sight, albeit chargeable. Reception staff, although friendly (ish) didn‚Äôt expand on greetings or farewell e.g.  did you have a nice journey/stay?  Etc.   we just got hello/BYE!  No welcoming chatter.  We had booked an executive twin and ended up with a family room ? Difference in price. We didn‚Äôt question it at the time, it only dawned on us on our last day, so wasn‚Äôt worth the enquiry by then.   Our room had been refurbished‚Ä¶to a point.  The bathroom looked like a white ‚Äòhospital‚Äô bathroom - all the amenities but no comfort.  The toiletries were presented in a gift bag, very odd.  And more importantly, the plug holes gurgled at certain times of day, particularly very early in the morning!   There was a huge lack of plug sockets, none by the beds, so we had to unplug the tv and fridge in order to charge our mobile phones!   We only had one lamp by the double bed and none by the single bed - again that was just one socket for the lamp and not accessible behind the bed!  And as much as you like a room to be warm enough, it was extremely warm and uncomfortable.   We had long windows that we couldn‚Äôt open for air - the bottom had been newly painted and this made the window stick, so we couldn‚Äôt unstick it.  Hence we used the fan provided‚Ä¶.but once again had to unplug something else in order to use it!   Breakfast was ok, had choices, but it was all a bit unfriendly.  I think they were extremely short staffed, and the staff who were there were a little stressed, not helpful and certainly not overly friendly.
Perfectly located on the islands beach. The restaurant is more than adequate and their is a friendly beach bar and small family run restaurant on site also. All good.

For breakfast there was a smorgasbord  offering a wide selection of delicious hot and cold food. It was a relaxing and delicious way to start the day. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is near the Acropolis. It is also very close to the station and my daughter could store her suitcase there for the rest of the day after we had checked out. Nothing

The rooms were nice and clean. The hallways were dated and dingy, but smelled nice. The heated outdoor pool was really nice! Staff seemed overworked, but were very pleasant! We had a king bed, and it would've been a very comfortable bed if it hadn't had such a huge middle sag. If you tried to sleep on either side, you would roll to the center. Looked under the bed and noticed the frame was bent. But in my daughter's king room, the bed was great

The interior decor was great. It‚Äôs a family home so the owners & rhubarb the pointer, and a few family members were about. There is an honesty bar & my Bacardi & digest coke was ¬£8.    The breakfast/dinner room was very nicely decorated in the period & the staff were attentive. Our room was huge with high ceilings & 3 window aspect (the corner room) very comfortable super king bed with a large bathroom attached. Dressing robes were supplied also with named bath products available.   The walk down by the river was enjoyable. There wasn‚Äôt really anything to be honest, but if I was to be a tad picky then it‚Äôd have to be the cobwebs & large spiders. Wasn‚Äôt a problem for us but might be for some.

spacious room for three of us - ground floor family room on split levels. very helpful reception staff. great hot breakfast spread, taste etc including a live eggs counter. very conveniently and centrally located. lighting in the room was quite limited.
The room, the family who owns the place, the location, the bed Nothing

Very well run family hotel . Fantastic rooms . Very clean . The staff is very helpful . Great location close to the Fiumicino airport , but also very convenient to get to Rome with the express train from Fiumicino to Rome : 25 minutes . The hotel also offer a shuttle to the airport . Ask for a suite on a third floor : very large terrasse with seating area and jacuzzi at an additional cost but private and personal . Nice breakfast included in the price . Nothing
Very friendly and helpful family, comfortable bed and room, excellent parking and very central...   Will certainly stay again.. Absolutely nothing to not like...

The breakfast is delicious. The menu slightly changed everyday.  The staffs are all very nice. Spare car park is 2-3 mins walkable distance from hotel. The room design is favourable for storage usage. The location but shuttle bus is offered. It closes to Niseko Family lift. Quality of shampoo and conditioner are below average.

Clean & spacious apartment, well appointed and  very comfortable for our family of 4 (2 adults 2 teens). Location was great, close to everything. Lovely views of mountains from rooms & the two balconies. N/a
Nice-sized rooms, very clean.  Good breakfasts with lots of choice. Too many unruly children, but that's the fault of the parents, not the hotel.

The room n the bed was comfortable.. suit me that bring  my parent n my children.. reasonable for the price.. the location also in strategic .. easy to find the food stall, atm n near to padang kota, mall n komtar..the staff was so friendly, check in process so fast Limited hotel parking.. first come first serve

The rooms were large and felt spacious, with big windows and comfortable beds. There's also a nice little seating area as well as plenty of dresser/counter space.     The breakfast buffet is pretty decent with a wide selection of food options (eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, yogurt, cereal, pastries, etc).     The bar is hit or miss with drinks - the first day they were good but the same drink two days later was undrinkable. The bathroom amenities are pretty basic, with just one combo body wash/shampoo product. There was no conditioner, or body lotion.     Three family members had rooms and they all had some major differences. Only one had proper lighting - two reading lamps, as well as a table lamp and wall lights. One room was missing the wall lights and our room was missing both the wall lights and one of the bedside reading lamps. It made the room very dark and hard to do anything in, even during the middle of the day.     One of the three rooms received a bag of replacement linens, bathroom tissues, etc during the stay (normal cleaning services were suspended over Christmas) but the other two didn't, and even after requesting it from reception it took until the next day to receive it.     Both elevators were not working on the day we checked out. At 6am with very large suitcases, it was extremely difficult to haul them down four flights of stairs.

At first sight, Jacaranda looks like one of many and very typical for Antalya large all-inclusive resorts, particularly positioned in the mid-range segment, but the magic happens once you actually step there.  The excellent sport program is what sets Jacaranda apart (tennis, mounting bike, canoe, sailboard or catamaran (license required) along with volleyball, football and many outdoor fitness activities). Moreover, you can always rely on excellent instructors (e.g. tennis - √ñzg√ºr and Onur, cycling - Ahmet).  Nice and relatively large (130 000 sq. m) territory with very well-thought layout. Relatively new (2014) and very well maintained and clean building along with the surrounding gardens and the large beach with very fine sand. Great and huge outdoor pool under the nicely looking bridges and heated indoor/outdoor pool for swimming/relaxing at the end of the day. Spacious enough (58 sq. m) and comfortable family rooms, the spring mattress beds are hard but I personally liked them, some other people didn't.  Very well organized main restaurant with more than enough food variety and good quality corresponding to the mid-range category/pricing. I really appreciate that they try to offer different theme nights every day of the week. Dublin bar‚Ä¶ a place where you can watch football‚Ä¶ among friends‚Ä¶ on a big screen‚Ä¶ Priceless!  Snacks, street and beach bars all offer good alternatives for lunch and the ‚ÄúWunderbar‚Äù is great for live music events in the evening.  Most of the staff is very nice and helpful and will do anything to make you enjoy every minute of your stay, this is another very strong point of this resort, the staff is great. Magic Life App will help you to organize your day and book most of the activities you want to participate. There is Wi-fi Internet connection everywhere including the beach and is overall usable. No hotel (or anything else) is perfect and there is always room for improvement but out stay in Jacaranda was unexpectedly unforgettable. So, the negatives that I list here are mostly minor complains or are about additional services that didn‚Äôt really affect our holiday, hence the top rating.  All of the rooms have windows in the bathroom which, of course, is pointless. Moreover, the roller blind doesn‚Äôt cover the window completely and the main bedroom gets illuminated at night, so it‚Äôs also stupid. Not to mention that this window is totally out of place in a family room‚Ä¶ The synthetic fiber pillows that you get in the room are probably the cheapest and worst possible pillows which barely offer any support and are all clumped. These pillows have no place in any hotel, ever, anywhere.  The desserts in the main restaurant are often too large, which contributes to unnecessary wasting, and I would rather focus more on the taste than the look as many of the them are way too overdecorated, but no so eatable. This is something that is noticeably worse than other resorts in Antalya. The so-called ‚Äúspecially restaurants‚Äô‚Äô in Jacaranda are a real shame. They don‚Äôt offer anything special as an atmosphere, the menus are very limited and most importantly the food is mediocre and very amateur work, not comparable to the level of the main restaurant. In my opinion, it‚Äôs far better to offer something like Jacaranda Lounge for additional price rather than a number of free restaurants which are complete joke and only spoil the otherwise excellent experience. MAGIC APPetite is actually a great idea where you vote for certain dishes and then you see them as a mini three-course menu at the next dinner. Again, –∞ great idea, but unfortunately killed by very poor and amateur execution.  Aquapark is old with a few slides that won‚Äôt impress anyone, many of the hotels in Antalya already upgraded their waterparks with the modern constructions, which would be a great addition here.

Excellent location and the staff were lovely. The breakfast was well tended and had quite good options, although a bigger selection of fresh fruit would've been nice. The room was quite small for 3 people, and the glass panelled bathroom door was off putting. Especially as the mirror opposite gave a lovely view to anyone on the bed.  The sofa bed was not cleaned from the previous guests and there was no additional towel for our son (we got both issues sorted, but frustrating nonetheless)

We have just spent a lovely night at this hotel!  Gorgeous spacious Family room with two large beds, rather than the usual bed and sofa bed option (which is not great for teens)!   Huge TV with Bluetooth connectivity so you can play your own music.  Very modern rooms with great options for low level or bright lighting.  Complimentary magazines and a comfy high back cuddle chair.  Full length side-lit mirror excellent for applying makeup and checking your outfit before leaving. Large dressing table. large wardrobe with a large safe and plenty of clothes hangers.  Bathroom was great too, with large Shower with regular shower head or rainforest options. Elemis toiletries, scented toilet paper, plenty of fluffy, soft towels for the family.  Beds are super comfy with large feather pillows and high quality bedding.  Good selection of teas and coffee‚Äôs and plenty of milk.  I really can‚Äôt fault this hotel at all. It‚Äôs close proximity to the train station is a real bonus.  Grand Pacific Restaurant and Bar is a perfect partner for this art deco style hotel. the cocktails are first class and the food menu excellent. There is no Children‚Äôs menu here but staff are able to accommodate older children by adapting the menu options to their liking.  all of the staff were friendly and helpful. they made us feel very welcome. it seemed like everyone was happy in their work.  We will certainly coming back to stay at The Queens Hotel! The Fillet Steak at Grand Pacific Restaurant was not great but staff dealt with the problem really well.
Awesome Experience, property is recently renovated. Rooms, Location and Hospitality from family-run staff are wonderful. They deserve 10 rating, Value for Money. Nothing

Great location for our trip to Wells Grey. Nice room layout (family room), clean and comfy - great value for money Wifi cut in and out, as did the satellite tv. No breakfast (one site said breakfast was included, though our booking said ‚Äúbreakfast not available‚Äù.

The staff are fantastic and friendly and the location is nice and close to family The mattress was lumpy enough to feel the springs and there was not enough pillows and the room could do with a small fridge, also needed more coffee tea and milk

Everything is excellent. Spacious, clean, and super close to the station. Breakfast is great - be sure to try the pancakes. Sound proofing could be an issue if you get noisy neighbours. On our first night there, the family next door was really loud. Once they check-out everything is great.

The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. We were only there to sleep. I was dropping my son off to the coast guard station. I didn‚Äôt have enough time to really explore but would definitely stay again while visiting my son! That I didn‚Äôt stay longer

A wonderful family run guest house-spotlessly clean, superb breakfast, and a great location.   It was a real pleasure to stay at this place and made my time in Bhukara a real joy. The family went above and beyond to make my stay special. They are beautiful people. A top sheet for the bed would have been nice as it was too hot for the blanket but too cold for nothing

It was a great location and the perfect size for our family of 3. Not too much extra space. The Master bedroom pillows didn‚Äôt give support. It would be nice to have the option of a more firm pillow.

The room is well equipped, even if it is used for transit, close to the airport. We only slept there for 3 hours, because we had the transfer in the morning and the plane was 3 hours late, but it was a good rest. The pleasant surprise was the coffee machine and the biscuits and croissant that were a very good breakfast for me and my daughter. A bit stressful to look for the accommodation at 2 am, but the directions they gave were very clear and we managed.

The collection of keys was easy and an excellent system.  The apartment was spacious and bigger than anticipated.  There was ample space for a family of 4.  The location was excellent - within close proximity to places to eat and small supermarkets.  There were two tube stations located not far away and also visitor attractions close by - Tower of London and London Bridge.  The bathroom was modern and spacious. There wasn't anything we didn't like, however, the bed in the main bedroom was very hard, so much so that it was quite uncomfortable to sleep on.  The kitchen and drawers in the main bedroom looked a little dated and could do with some modernisation (they are perfectly functional - just outdated).  The curtains were good and kept out most of the light however there was still light able to get through in the main bedroom.  Perhaps a blind on the inside of the window may help with this.  The curtains in the living area were fine and blocked out the light.
great location, wonderful staffers.  easy access from the parking lot. the toilet and sink (due to the historical building) are very low from the floor, like in a kid level.
Proximity to amenities is a huge plus.nagoya station, restaurants 7 eleven family mart.staff is super friendly and helpful.very clean place Nothing negative

We loved our family stay at Cae Cwnws. It was a wonderful base from which to explore the local area and a lovely homely and cosy bolt-hole for us to return to at the end of the day. We enjoyed cooking in the well equipped kitchen, chilling in the snug lounge with the fire going and playing games at the kitchen table. The beds were really comfy too so we all slept really well. Mum, who has limited mobility, was pleased to have everything she needed in the downstairs bedroom.  Daughter was delighted to have horses as our neighbours. We were all sad to leave and would certainly return next time we're holidaying in the area. Thanks for providing such a great holiday home, Owen! Nothing really. Mum only commented that she would have appreciated a handrail for the steps from the conservatory to the front door area due to her mobility but she used the wall for support and it really wasn't a big problem. Just worth considering if any of your party struggles with steps.
The room was clean, warm, and comfortable. The ensuite bathroom was a selling point for my son and me. Parking

It was so lovely and the front of staff at check in me in we're a absolutely fantastic. I was up with my nice  who was going in to pasily maternity to have her baby. Used the right up to dinner time and bye the our meal was out this world. So didn't get to use the room at night or the next day. It was just one  of these things baby Lewis came quickly. I can't answer this question because we both had a lovely afternoon at holiday Inn, all staff were lovely. Even the night staff were lovely. Absolutely fantastic meal. Close to the metro and supermarket, great atmosphere and interiors, amazing feel and experience to stay here. Lovely team but again the Language is a big problem as it's very difficult to communicate with the staff in hotels of Thailand. It's the same everywhere in Thailand, but still they made us feel comfortable and even upgraded us to a suit without any charge. The hotel is new , modern and really clean. I will be coming back for sure Strange position of sink in the room, very small toilet with very Little space. No use of the mirrors in the room. Didn't understand the use of the mirror near the mini bar. Very small gym. Too many children all the time at the pool made the experience little unromantic.

I thoroughly enjoyed the hospitality of the people running the hotel, which has been extraordinary, in particular Adem's, the manager. Throughout the journey, he made sure that every request I had was sorted out and helped with recommendations for the city. The hotel is clean and provides everything you would want on your trip. A simple yet varied breakfast, a quiet authentic Turkish closed street and a comfortable room. The staff try their utmost to keep the place a quiet and family-friendly place, which makes a huge difference. The area is very much a typical busy Istanbul street - where you can find an open market, street vendors, shops and the like, all intermingled in one big melting pot. While the side street the hotel is on is very quiet, you might found some of the surroundings a bit of a sensory overload. If you're not looking for something authentic, this might not be the place for you.
I like it alot , my family had a great time we thank Dania for her attitude and support she makes our vacation epic Nothing

Our stay at CIK‚Äôs Guest House was simply amazing. Our room and bathroom was spotlessly clean and smelt lovely. The bed was very spacious and sooo comfy. We had such peaceful nights sleeps here. The balcony area overlooks the beautiful scenery and is so peaceful to have your breakfast and tea / coffee. Nyoman‚Äôs (sorry for the spelling) banana pancakes are sooo delicious - I highly recommend! The location is perfect, just a short walk away from the main area of Ubud and within beautiful traditional Balinese architecture. I can‚Äôt recommend enough, we will definitely stay again! Thanks so much Eka, Nyoman and your lovely family :) Nothing!

The location is so good! The courtyard suite was perfect for our family of 4. We never used our car because everything was so walkable. Lance at desk was very kind and even made sure things were to our liking after we settled in. Full kitchen. 2 entrances. Updated decor and furniture. Much better value than the tall motel 2 doors down! Great coffee. Small bathroom. No AC.

Very large bedroom with air conditioning. Modern facilities. The housekeeper was very accommodating although there was a language barrier (particularly when it comes to money) as he doesn't speak English so we spoke via Google translate. They did my laundry on request. Muhamad and his sons own the hotel and Muhamad was very welcoming, he knocked on my door on the morning after my arrival and took me on a full day private tour of Egypt at an additional cost of $250 USD (not including tips). A simple continental breakfast is provided at a time you request (bread, cheese, ham, a boiled egg). Nice balcony view of the garden. Very peaceful place as it's in a private compound away from the streets. It is not a hotel but rather a guarded compound whereby you stay in a house with other guests and a housekeeper and you get your own private bedroom and ensuite which is lockable (the rest of the house is shared living space). There is no reception and the housekeeper takes photos of your passport on his phone (for security purposes) on arrival, which gets sent to all of the hotel owners' phones (not an overly secure form of storing people's information). From a cleanliness point of view I could see other people's hairs in the bed linen and the fridge had small spots of mould so I didn't use it. The shower is in a tall bath with no shower screen, so water floods the tiles and it is quite slippery (would be dangerous for people with mobility issues). Need to catch taxi's/private transport to get anywhere as the inn is in a more secluded area of Egypt away from the city and it is a 1 hour drive to the airport. No swimming pool. If you want to be left alone to do your own thing then this is probably not the place for you as Muhamad and the housekeeper will knock on your door regularly to ask you what you want to do/where you want to go/what you need.

Our stay at Pergeri was absolutely perfect.  The place is amazing and the family took care of all our needs and requests.  Our flight was delayed and we arrived late but was welcomed immediately with patience and understanding.  Our experience was just perfect, the breakfasts was delicious and the family was informative, answering to all of our questions.  I recommend it and definitely will come back.  Thank you Everything was perfect.

The location was great, the front gate made you feel very safe, included breakfast was nice, the junior suite was very nice and comfortable, air conditioning was perfect for august. The hospitality area was very nice with the gym and the changing rooms. We did not like that you could not use the pool in the other two hotels. The all inclusive was just buffets and not good, the restaurants were expensive, the pools were boiling hot, kids were in the adult only area, there is beach access but the beach was not pleasant- rocks in front of the hotel.

What a wonderful place. It's right down in the Historic District. You won't need your car for visiting the historic district if you can walk a little. My son and I really enjoyed being in the middle of it. We had just come from visiting historic Charleston and we found this to be much nicer and more to do. The property itself is a restored 1800's building that was done well. The fixtures are not period but they function well and are comfortable and cozy. The rooms are large and give you plenty of room to sit and enjoy some rest time from all the local attractions. If you can't find good food here you would starve in a grocery store, lol. Historic Savannah  is right outside your door with tons of attractions, architecture, restaurants, tours and parks. We parked our car in the free onsite parking lot and never went back till it was time to leave. Every two blocks in any direction is a wonderful city square. The staff at the hotel is very approachable and friendly, a cooked breakfast awaits you each morning, not the standard plastic egg bar. Both my son and I where very satisfied with our time there and will be returning. Having to leave.

The family are wonderfully welcoming and accommodating. They cannot do enough to help.  The food is excellent and the breakfast very substantial.  The view and location are fabulous. You can sip a glass of wine on the terrace while watching beautiful sunsets and the birds on the lake. Very peaceful and relaxing but close enough to drive or cycle to interesting sites.  There is a lovely restaurant in a rustic and tastefully decorated building. Just a few minor adjustments. Shower head needs replacing and a mat for the floor in the bathroom as the shower leaves the floor wet. The room is a little dark and painting the ceiling white would improve this.  These are a very minor things for such a wonderful place.

Arlene treated us like family from before we even met for the first time at the airport. She genuinely seems to love what she does. The suite was lovely and comfortable. We loved the view of the mountains and enjoyed her garden with pool. And those breakfasts!!! They were always creative and delicious. If you enjoy feeling well taken care of and comfortable, this is the place for you. Nothing.
Accessible to where we are heading, worth the value and clean. Staff were friendly. Could have 2chairs so we can eat properly with my son.

The facilities were beautiful and in a great location. We booked a king room with a sofa bed for our daughter. I loved how it was separated from us. She had her own TV and a little privacy.  Will definitely stay here next time we are in town. The only thing I can find wrong was the pillows. They were a little uncomfortable, and we needed a couple more. I'm sure if I had asked, they would have gladly given us more.

Fantastic off street parking, close to the o2 venue and restaurants, helpful family run business. Clean comfortable bedroom and small bathroom, but just what we expected for the price, would definitely stay again. Maybe tea making facilities in the bedrooms instead of downstairs but other than that nothing, we had a lovely nights stay and a good sleep. Have already recommended to friends and family

Great family run establishment, clean, tidy, great amenities and location. Plus cracking breakfast. Couldn‚Äôt ask for more. Location to town and shops ideal. The seagull chorus at 5 am lol but that wasn‚Äôt the hotel problem
Location was great on the beachside at Platanias.  Family run accommodation property with pool, restaurant, and close to everything in Platanias nothing

Love everything about this place, the clean space the staff, most especially the staff, they make you feel like family, and it‚Äôs very family friendly! Panos at the reception was extraordinary, and the driver Charming Nikos and George. So happy to stay in this resort, will definitely come back (Without the kids lol) The breakfast wasn‚Äôt that great.

Breakfast was excellent. Julia made fresh multi grain bread rolls and we each had a freshly fried egg. There was a lovely selection of jams and cheese to choose from. One of the best brekkys we had included in the very reasonable nightly tariff.  As we had our own vehicle the house was easy to reach. The road in has a few pot holes so just take it easy. A little out from Selfoss but so quiet and homely, suited us perfectly. Julia is a delightful, helpful host. She has a house and garden filled with cats, chickens and ducks. They are all very domesticated and just gorgeous to cuddle. If you don't love animals, choose somewhere else to stay as Julias pets are part of the family. We Love Animals!!! Nothing, we highly recommend Julias and would stay there again!!
Really convenient location, nice staff. Very decent breakfast, cool price A bit noisy with kids in the room upstairs. Some problems to get hot water in the shower
Great location and comfy bed The children upstairs were loud from quite early in the morning
Family Suite Set up & breakfast Long walk to our room

The location was amazing - Paddington Station 4 minutes away....Hyde Park a few minutes walk away and about a 20 - 25 minute walk to Buckingham Palace. Our room was small, but perfect for me and my daughter. We had everything we needed. There wasn't anything I didn't like.

Great location for exploring the city. Staff are professional and friendly and sorted an issue that we raised to their attention almost immediately.  Rooms are clean and big enough to accommodate a family of 4. Great shower with very hot water.  As usual for Holiday Inn, the breakfast is spot on; there is a variety of cooked breakfast as well as milk/vegan options,yoghurt, cereals, pastry, hot drinks, etc. There was a bit of a poor organisation at breakfast time. I am assuming the busy Bank Holiday morning played a big part in exceeding the capacity of the restaurant. Hence, people had to wait to wait for a short time to get seated.  Not a big deal, though, and staff were trying their best to accommodate everyone.

Very convenient location next to the railway station, where the family room for 4 was by far the most reasonable deal we could get on a short notice booking for a Wengen Saturday night during top season! The room was perfectly designed to fit 4, excellent shower, free minibar! It may make sense (for a top destination in Switzerland) to pay 28 CHF for breakfast - if you're planning to eat all what you can, American style, in that morning. If you're happy with a few tasty pastries and a coffee-to-go, try the bakery a few blocks away - we had, for 30 CHF,  more than enough  for all the four of us!

Le Panier Enchant√© is located in the middle of Le Panier neighborhood, an artistic, local & alternative area of Marseille: one can find very nice shops & restaurants, this is also super close to Mucem (10min walk) and the Vieux Port  Otherwise, the suite is well furnished & equipped, it is spacious and light This is contextual but the family present on the last floor was noisy especially in the morning when one wants to sleep & relax  Panier is not the safest place at night - prefer the Uber / taxi solution

It was our babymoon and they thought of everything! Made my wife feel very special and cared for, they did a wonderful job and the place is Stunning.   The water park and huge play areas were an excellent bonus for our toddler! The only thing we weren‚Äôt very impressed by was the food; had room service and frangipani for dinner and both could be improved.  its quite expensive and wasn‚Äôt very good. Breakfast was FANTASTIC tho!

First of all, the resort seems to be located in a garden, full of banana trees, lemon trees, etc. It is quiet and relaxing...you could spend all day long in the pools. The beach is clean and big enough, it ensures sunbeds and umbrellas for free (included in the cost of the room - short comment: height of the umbrellas could be adjusted at minimum 1.80 from the ground...not 1.50m as they are...). Daily cleaning of the room. Underground free parking for cars. High appreciation for all taste and thank you for the cake the pastry chef made for my daughter's birthday! Good free wi-fi on the location! When we booked the resort, we were almost convinced that the quality/variety of food should be at high standards. Big disappointment: in 8 days we spent here (with two exceptions: the Greek evening and the BBQ evening) there was the same menu... 2, 3 different dishes with chicken, 1-2 pork, 1 fish, pizza, spaghetti, some sauces, various salads, 1 maximum 2 types of cakes, fruits. We have a Romanian wording ‚Äù√Æmpinge tava‚Äù  = ‚Äùpush the tray‚Äù for the usual daily menu we can get at all bistro...any menu was much better than what we have got in the resort... Quantity of food insufficient, it happened many times to go there, no matter if 19.30 or 20.30, to find that the pots for food were empty...and it took 15-30 minutes until they have been re-filled...if they have... Within the first 2-3 days of staying when we asked for a drink during the dinner we were told to pay cash because ‚Äùthe system‚Äù = pay on the room was not working... Not sufficient people on the main restaurant to prepare tables/to clean, but too many to smile when you get into the main restaurant or to do things which could be resolved in a far better manner: instead of asking the room number every evening, to find out if we have half board, all inclusive or else, they can give you a bracelet on different colors to separate... Water temperature was incredible low for the beginning of July, maximum 23-24 degrees. I understood that this was the result of continuous rain in May and half of June and it not happened within the last 50 years (no complain, just a remark...). For a ‚Äùblue flag‚Äù beach, as the resort has, you expect to receive more written information about environment, keeping clean... Anyhow, the beach is sandy, also the entrance on the see but there are pebbles and rocks within the first 10m...after 10m the water depth is more than 2m...

Amazing building, great customer service, happy to go the extra mile. Clean, comfortable hotel in lovely grounds in which we actually saw deer running one early evening. Good location being a short walk to station, town & promenade. The food was gorgeous, maybe a little dear but it was top quality. Buffet breakfast but efforts were made to ensure available food was at its hottest & freshest. Everything to high standard. The room allocated was not the room booked, disappointing as it felt we were a bit dumped in it, especially as we'd booked well in advance. Family room with single bed that had a towelling cover, like an old worn comfort blanket. Totally out of character with the rest of the room/hotel. Lack of natural light at one end of the room but lighting was spot on when you needed it. Not the comfiest bed we've had either.
Everything- ambience, host and the room. This is definitely an amazing place for a family retreat. nothing
Lovely large en suite room. Superb breakfast and lovely hosts. Nothing to dislike. Great value family run B+B. So much better than a chain hotel.

We booked for two nights, for a family trip to London, quite late on: the hotel had some availability and previous reviews were positive. We too were very happy with our choice. It is well located, just a few minutes' walk from Hammersmith Underground and shops, and an easy stroll down to the Thames for riverside walks. Although it is by a main road, it is set back and we weren't affected by noise; and the area is pleasant and feels safe. The room was a good size, the bathroom was fine and there was sufficient storage space. It felt clean and tidy (and it was cleaned and re-stocked for the second day). Friendly reception staff and a good ambience: we thought it was a really good find. All was fine. The small room safe had been left locked so we couldn't have used it (but didn't want to) and our belongings were safe in the room.

Overall, I enjoyed the stay. So did my family members. Te views are great, the apartment was very clean and had all the necessary elementa for a pleasant stay. It is a bit far from the city center and it is hard to get to the center as the city is really crowded. If you plan to visit Istanbul and spend time on the other side of the Bosphorus bridges, I would recommend another stay. But this one is close to the airport so I guess it depends on traveler‚Äôs necessities.

When you book here, you get access to the private island where the flamingos live. Tickets there for non guests are around $135? So if you utilize going to this beautiful island, you get your money's worth from this hotel. I highly recommend doing it!   The hotel had a lot of shopping, dining, casino, and access to 3 pools. We stayed at the adults only section of the hotel, and the pool was nice but much smaller than the one at the family-friendly one. The family-friendly one had a swim up bar, so be sure to go there as well.  The hotels are in the heart of Orjanstead, so you can easily walk to other restaurants and bars. The hotel is expensive, in my opinion, if you don't utilize the island option. The room is small (but modern), and the breakfast included was very mediocre. I've stayed at other Renaissance Hotels worldwide, and they've done better with the rooms and breakfasts. We had some great experiences with some staff half the time, while the other half of the time, the staff seemed stressed/too busy.

Mark the owner had everything covered, on arrival he made sure there was a parking space sorted. The room well wow!. Very clean and all the little extras like fridge,iron,kettle and sundries. The shower was fab,one you can actually move around in. Shower gell and air freshener. Plenty of loo roll. Mark also made sure the room was replenished daily and the towels smelt amazing!..Also the room had plenty of electric sockets and a big TV. Me and my autistic daughter will certainly be returning. There was only one but this wasn't really a pain but there's no lift facility if you're not very good with steps.

Family owned and family run. Attentive to all guests and the location ideal. No need to rent a car. Pools on site, Beach across the street and numerous restaurants and bars all within walking distance A bit outdated but functional and clean.

Hey there,    I just wanted to say that my stay at Dar Annasr was amazing! The people who work there, especially the owner, were super nice and even gave us rides to the city center for free.    The furniture in the hotel is really nice and everything looks brand new. The breakfast was delicious, and it felt like being at home because it's run by a friendly family.    Thanks for such a great experience! Can't wait to come back. Everything was perfect

We chose a one bedroom apartment and it was great; confortable, new, fully furnished, nice views to the surrounding mountings etc.. The staff (family own) is extremely kind and helpful. Breakfast is good too. We had a very pleasant stay. Everything was ok. But maybe the parking capacity could be improved or managed differently.

The room was spacious and good having a ground floor room with only one door to go thru with having someone with me who is a wheelchair user ,thanks to calum that worked in the restaurant for going above and beyond to make something for my disabled daughter to eat that wasn't on the menu I thank him for that üòä That the bed cover had a dirty mark on it and the bathroom smelt moldy, that the restaurant never had any weetabix or flavoured yougurt for the younger visitors

Very clean and close to restaurants and the Parks. Not the hotels fault but the ppl staying there were super loud especially the pool area. Had kids running up and down the hall ways screaming at 11pm and knocking on our door lost.

The staff were all friendly and professional.  Our room was spacious and clean and the breakfast was excellent!  A wonderful location close to downtown and a beautiful park right behind the property.  My family loved our visit and look forward to our return! No complaints.

The beds were comfortable, the room was quiet, stylish and well-equipped. Even though it was small, it was very efficient and fit our family of three well. The staff are friendly, and have helped us by storing and receiving luggage. Instructions somewhere for the climate control would have been helpful. It was sweltering without air circulation, which we finally figured out in the morning.

Everything about this place is amazing. I am here with husband son and daughter in law and we all feel the same.Everyone who works here is kind helpful and always smiling.it gives the feel to a beautiful traditional Bali with exceptional service , wonderful setting and swimming pools .Highly recommend the massage, absolutely wonderful. There is nothing I would change . I wish we could stay forever Nothing to be improved on. Stay exactly as you are

As we were travelling into Heathrow late I loved how easy it was to get to this hotel via bus service!! 1.75 pound a lot more appealing compared to 30-40pound for a taxi!! Good place for a sleep, shower and go!!! When my daughter and I checked in, key did not work first time when we went to our room no. 25, guy at reception apologied and reset key card.. Second time we tried to enter the room there were other residents already in the room.  We Went back to reception, guy apologised profusely and seemed genuine and understandably may have been distracted as it was really busy, Our room number was actually no. 24!!  Beds were very comfortable however there were blood stains on sheets but it was obvious sheets were washed. My advice to service staff to double check bedding when dressing beds as its not a good site.
location, across from coco ichibanya/restaurants, family mart nearby n/a
Didn't have breakfast as visiting family Nothing could be done better
Clean place and close to restaurants and wineries. Best of all I love the lotion, soap and shampoo dispensers. Upstairs children running up and down
It was kid friendly N/A
Great location to the Old City, friendly and helpful staff, big family room (slept 6 comfortably) WiFi wasn't strong, kept dropping the connection

The rooms are very small especially for families Not A family friendly hotel rooms were not deeply Cleaned full of dust Not enough storage in rooms   Location of the hotel People working at the reception
N A  2 min walk to london eye Westminster south bank waterloo station Had a lovely room which accommodated us as a family of 3 perfectly Breakfast was great too
The single bed put in for our son was very poor collapsed under him very hard mattress G  Location was excellent bed was very comfortable
rooms are to small Refrigerator very small no micro stayed with kids needed for there food   great location

I booked the room through Booking com however when we arrived at the property the receptionist told us that there is no spare bed for my 10 yrs old child and were told that the hotel doesn t take responsibility The guy said that the hotel wouldn t take responsibility for an error made by Booking com  No Positive
Pillows weren t great  Great room for a family as 2nd bed is tucked away

No Negative  Location is excellent metro station is 2 minutes walk and very close to attractions by metro Staff was super nice and helpful also as we were traveling with a child gave us a bigger room which was very understanding
Room is quite basic Pull out couch for my daughter not very comfortable   Location was excellent for West End access to tube station across from quiet park
Since we had a stroller the front door staris were very uncomfortable and we had to carry the stroller all the way  The staff were very friendly and breakfast was awsome
Booking com didn t inform the hotel that there would be 2 adults and a child staying They accommodated us but it was a bit disappointing from Booking com   Third time we ve stayed here Fabulous hotel
Family Room is too small just a standard size twin room No Positive
Only shampoo no conditioner   Great location with super friendly staff The croissants at breakfast were to die for I would stay here again and definitely recommend it to friends and family

the hotel has a few minor flaws in the tiling in the bathroom and some finishes which are worn this didn t effect my stay but I had a good rate at full price this would have disappointed me   loved the location the staff room size was big great for family fridge in room and complimentary soft drinks

There was nothing about the hotel that I didn t like The staff were all very friendly   The hotel was convenient for a family occasion and close to our relatives in Chiswick Transport and underground made it easy to get around
No Negative  The family room was huge we loved it the beds were really comfy and the facilities were excellent

Wifi worked poorly in the room The choice of food for breakfast was the same every day There s no entrance for baby strollers and wheel chairs only the steps   The location was comfortable 15 20 minutes to the city center on foot The room was clean bathroom spacious
Check in our times  Room wasn t ready for check in when we arrived which with a family was a nightmare

One of the steps felt a bit rickety on the way down The bathroom was small but the water pressure in the shower was good and so were the toiletries   Very happy in room 18 it was in the basement so just one flight of steps to navigate The room was spacious had air conditioning and a fridge king size bed cot and seating area Great news for us when we had a baby and it was so hot outside We were visiting the US Embassy so had to check out at 7am so couldn t have breakfast but the staff kindly allowed us to leave our suitcase for a couple of hours until after our appointment which saved us a lot of trouble

I can t find any faults   This is the third time we stayed at this hotel It is simply great Perfect location and the staff is lovely Definitely recommend it to anyone who is visiting Paris This time I was traveling as family and they gave us a lovely family room on the 7th floor The view was absolutely superb

The Superior room vary in size and you cannot quarantee which room size is allicated to you I reserved two rooms one superior double for myself and one superior twin for my kids The superior twins was so small and basically we cant open our luggage on the floor We then go and requested gor a change in room and they could only change for us in the second night Anyway the staff are helpful and answer your request at their very best effort   Excellent location friendly and helpful staff Each room is a bit different in design Very nice

Breakfast buffet good staff service excellent However overall the food was only just warm on the hot buffet service Some drinks tepid and had to be returned  Staff were attentive and helpful we were a party of 2 adults and 4 children Housekeeping services of a good standard Breakfast service good The staff group overall are the jewel in the crown
Like to have twin bedrooms for the children   Excellent breakast Very good location close to underground
No Negative  Hotel right in the center but very quiet inside Really friendly staff Swimming pool was also really fun for the kids Cosy Area at the swimming pool
No Negative  Great room for 2 adults and infant Big bed good amenities really nothing I could complain about we had a couple of great days in BCN

Hotel room is so humble cannot be matched to 4 stars hotel They couldn t find my reservation on their system took so many times to check in I booked 2 rooms for my family but they gave us one in 4th floor and other one in 5th floor   Location was not bad Close to the Waterloo bridge and Trafalgar square

Just one small and slow elevator The elevator goes down to the basement for breakfast but you can not go up from there You need to climb stairs to Ground floor and take the elevator from there The storage wardrobe space is limited but it is business oriented and we managed   LOCATION VERY CLEAN All new renovated We took 2 interconnected rooms very nice feature and the kids had their own facilities like TV bathroom safe refrigerator etc and we had our own Rooms are small but cozy We used the AC on warm days The lights in the room can be fully controlled also from the beds All lights are Led and not warming The mirror in the bathroom is heated and no steam is created during shower Good wifi service if idle for aprox half an hour it will disconnect and need to login again not a big deal We had the continental breakfast and it was good enough Ordered once the English breakfast Silent closing system for drawers and even for the toilet seat Lot of connectivity build in panel options business for wall USB charging Iphone as well no need for external charger laptop connection to TV Thanks a LOT

Wish bit more clean bed and room   Like every minute there very happy good place handy for every thing love to stay again food was amazing near to tube station and local shop wish bit more clean but still happy to stay kids enjoyed there breakfast and also stay

Nothing all were over expectation  The front desk Marija and her supervisor upgraded us from double room to suit so we could all fit comfortably Daniel at the concierge was full of information our children loved him location was a Jackpot couldnt get any better definitely would visit again Our warm wishes to all the team
nothing just parking not near apartement was hard with baggage  loved the whol resort feel safe family great facilities and clean
No Negative  Our room have kitchen very good and staff very nice lovely hotel Our child very like it
