Great Toy - Dog Loves It: My boxer-pointer mix loves this squirrel. Somehow we have kept him from destroying it though the tail is easily and quickly "de-furred". I kept finding tufts of squirrel tail all over the house. Once we got that under control, toy has held up nicely.

Doesn't live up to expectations.: Doesn't really provide the kind of warmth you would expect. It definately does not give anywhere close to 12 hours. I doubt any outdoor pet would derive much comfort from this product.
watch the complete series of 24, watch West Wing, and watch chicago fire all while curling up with the dog

Very small dog easily broke it: I put this up in a doorway to keep my 12-pound Cairn terrier in one room. When I got home from work, he'd completely ripped the wire mesh from its wooden frame, and bent the mesh beyond repair. He's a small dog, so the mesh couldn't have been attached very well. Disappointed.
Loved it: Great product but the glue with it does not stick so i had to use another glue. It took my parrot a while to stop being afraid from it. Its good, huge and works fine for my two cockatiels.

I have used it for over 25 years: I am only writing this because another person wrote a slanderous review. I have used this guy's methods since 1972, when I got my first dog as a young adult and had to train it myself. I did what he recommended, and it worked. There is nothing in there recommending harming a dog - it all makes sense.I had a Golden Retriever - in a city (Boston), and the lessons she (and I) learned from the methods in the book - quite literally - saved her life. I could send her on the dead run, and stop her with a command; she would walk next to me - in traffic - and stay in a "heel" position; when I went to graduate school, she would stay in a "down" position on the steps of the Library for an hour.Great Book

Okay but....: These sheets are fairly thick and soft, but after just a few washings, they have the dreaded little "balls" all over them. The other thing is that they attract & trap every stray piece of anything---lint, pet hair, human hair. Washing doesn't do much to get hair or other debris off these sheets once it gets on there. I wouldn't recommend them to anybody with pets or anyone who doesn't like the discomfort of pilled bedding.
Great kitten food: My cats just love this kitten food. It doesn't upset their bellies and has all of the nutrition they need for a good price.
good medicine: Worked from first day application cured mite problem on dogs snout, easy to apply and long lasting, would purchase again and again
Squeakin' eggs: Perfect size for small dogs-I have three dogs and they all play non-stop with these! The squeaker lasts as long as the eggs, which is forever.

It really works: This product really worked. I had my cat fixed, moved into a new home, new furniture and all in the same day. Not to mention added a dog to the mix and he HATES dogs. I pluged the comfort zone in about 3 hrs before I brought him home and he's been even happier and better behaved than he was before. We even had a baby shower a few weeks after with lots of strangers, which he doesn't like, and although he did hide from ppl he didn't scratch or pee on anything like he had done in the past after just one person came over. I intend to never not have one of these things plugged in. It was a god send for my kitty. He's just so happy and in love with everything. Its like the world is in catnip to him. He's much better behaved and even plays with t

Not Free SF Reader: Catseye is another book based in and around the Dipple slum settlement/camp, or whatever you want to call it. There are only a few options open to those that live here. In Judgement on Janus, the main character there chose one, the young man in this book chooses another, taking temporary jobs to try and get by.He lands what is basically a pet shop job dealing with exotic animals, who turn out to be far more than they seem. This leads to a dog and his boy sort of escapades, or the other way around.
Travel  Cat Shows  Shopping
On Talking Terms with Dogs: Calming Signals: The subject matter was interesting however it was more like a pamphlet than a book, but it had a book price! Buyer beware!

Chew Mice: My cat loved these, especially when she was a kitten. Now, she's hooked on Zany mice, mostly, but she still plays with these here and there. Since she's not a catnip lover, that is saying a lot. She likes the design of these mice, and when she gets into her chewing stages, she "chewses" these mice!! I love the look of them, and all the Pet Stages fabric toys. They make such cool looking toys for cats.

Omega Paw Couch Protector: This cat scratch post was flimsy. It did not stand up by itself; I had to pick up the chair it was supposed to protect and put a leg down on the base of the scratch post. When my cats stood up to scratch on it, the thing still bent over. My chair has become the preferred object to scratch. I got rid of this scratch post.

huh?: I didn't grasp this toy neither did my cats they looked at me like, Why did you waste your money on this piece of cardboard? Happy that I didn't pay to much for it, but was still to much since I threw it away. Maybe for kittens it'll work and you have the time to play all day to get them interested in this toy. Your cat will probably have more fun with an empty tissue roller, it's made from the same material it looks like.
skiing dog sleding hockey

Good Vacuum.......When it works: Just purchased the Twister in December. My wife and I have four cats and one dog so I needed one that works well for pet hair. I was very happy with the suction power of the vacuum. It worked well on the carpets and tile floor. The turbo brush attachment worked great on getting pet hair off the furniture. This past week it started having electrical problems. The motor will stop while vacuuming, but the light stays on. I called the company and they said that my only option was to ship the vacuum back to them and they will fix or replace it. I was told this would take 6 to 8 weeks. It seems I'm not the first person to have electrical problems with this vacuum. I would not recommend this vacuum to anyone.

Not even a little durable: Within ten minutes of playing fetch with my small dog, this ball was coming apart. Under the felt, there are two halves of a hollow ball and they started coming apart at the seam, tearing the felt. Definitely not worth it.My dog wasn't even chewing on it and it started coming apart; I would not recommend for a chewer.I'm still looking for a solid ball that won't come apart so quickly.

beware of vendor issue: The "rabbit" version of JS Spanish is only available from one vendor, which apparently is in the habit of shipping the "dog" version/"classical" version, which they sell in another listing for $8 less as a "value line", rather than the version ordered.

DEAD BATTERIES: I ordered these batteries with great anticipation to continue my dog training. Upon arrival, BOTH BATTERIES WERE DEAD! Went onto amazon to look for a place to return these dead things, and low and behold, you can't return batteries. So, now I am out the money. What a joke.

My DOG doesn't like it: This was yet another of many attempts to get my medium-sized dog to stop pulling. He absolutely hated it and refused to go anywhere. It was like an episode of crocodile hunters- he was on the ground spinning and tangling in it to get it off. The part that goes over his muzzle was irritating his skin as well. I went with another no-pull leash-- the one with the hook on the chest and one strap goes under the front legs. That one works WONDERS if you can find it. This one is too difficult to get adjusted to.
stupiddddd: If I could I would give this cd no stars. It sounded like a bunch of dogs howling all the time .You know how some peaple say my ears almost melted?,well now I know how that feels.
Stinky dog slicker: This dog rain coat is good for the fit, however, it has a very chemical odor to it. My dog only wore it once. He even had the chemical odor on his coat after wearing it.

You get what you pay for: I bought these as an easy slip-on boot to take my puppy out (quite frequently). Perhaps it's the rubber or lining, but these are the foulest smelling boots I have ever owned. They smelled like musty mildew right out of the box. Leaving them on the screen porch and using odor neutralizer does no good. I attempted to wear them outside while shoveling snow - my feet were cold within an hour, and I had ski socks on. Perhaps the puppy can cut her teeth on them.

Not so durable!: I ordered this Kong Teddy bear toy based on reviews I read here. My dog is only 15 lbs but he loves to chew and destroy. I needed a toy that can keep him occupied and would be durable enough for him not to tear holes through. I have been satisfied with the rubber Kong toys so I figured I would give the cute teddy a try. My dog loved the toy however it was chewed through in about 2 days. I liked the removable squeaker feature however my dog was able to create a big hole in the face and body that having the feature doesn't really matter. He was able to chew through the ears, legs and arms the first day. By the 2nd day he was able to get to the squeaker. So,....my two cents,...Kong rubber toys are great but these soft plush ones are not anywh

Perfect: This item was perfect and easy to use. I purchased this item to give my cat an escape from my roomates dog. The gate was easy to secure to the doorway of my bedroom. The cat can easily hop it and it keeps the dog out. The single page that comes with it is easy to follow. One may want to mark the notch that is used for the doorway so that when you remove it, you can use it again.
Didn't even interest my pups, scared my sister's dog: My pups were not even interested in this toy. My sister's dog was actually scared of this toy.
It's just bad.: It does make a good place to train you dog and/or cat.Also some of the pictures are in color.

Multipet curly dog toy monkey: I bought this for my 8 month old Labarador PUPPY. It's hard to find toys that he doesn't destroy in the first 5 minutes. This one has lasted so far for a few weeks, so I couldn't be happier. I don't expect chew toys to last very long, and this one has lasted longer than I expected.
Pet Cemetary (Collector's Edition): Don't let Children watch it. My nine year old grandson watched it and couldn't sleep for a month. Very scary.
Product as promised: The sporn halter was as promised. Less expensive than in the stores and it works -- it keeps my dog from pulling. I recommend it.

Terribly Disappointed!: What a rip off. I bought the Infinity Upright Vacuum Cleaner with Pet Care System about six months ago. No problems at all for the first 2 months, but about a month later my husband had to take the Infinity to the repair stop to have it unclogged. Did I mention that only the sleeping quarters of the home has carpeting, and that we have no pets? So what's with the Infinity clogging so fast? What a waste of my money and a total disappointment. I guess it just goes to show you that you can't judge a book by it's pretty little cover now can you? Again, a waste of money and a waste of time!

they work fine: I have a small dog that is house broken but if I'm away or if she needs to pee in the middle of the night she goes on it.as for someone remarking about scent ? I never needed to scent it or buy anything scented since she got the idea that on the pad was the place for her to go.It works fine ... it's not meant to hold alot of wee.the only problem I have is the cat ... who when she spies it then tries to cover it up !

Great guide on Springers: The English Springer Spaniel is my second favorite spaniel.. the first one being the COCKER SPANIEL. It helps you a lot about your Springer, and it has nice pics on products, dogs, and many more! I like the glossy pictures and this is a must for any Springer owner.
yea right: i decided to buy this because of the great reviews but i got fooled this product was awfull it was a pillow for a pet rather then someone expecting i hated it...

Wallows in the bodily functions and urges that are inherent to dog-ness: This movie is often praised for following the book in not avoiding the bodily functions and urges that are inherent to dog-ness. I'd say the movie doesn't just "not avoid" them, it wallows in them - to the detriment of the more meaningful and insightful story.

Gentle Leader: This is a great product! We have five dogs, well more like 4 1/4, I don't consider the Chihuahua a full dog,LOL. I bought four gentle leader and it works well. Walking four full sized dog can be though, especially when they see something that intrigues them and they just want to investigate (i.e. another dog). We are able to control them just fine. The collar is made to bring their nose down which doesn't allow them to keep forward and be fixated. The collar also aids from pulling, but I believe that's more on the training end of things. My girlfriend is 100 lbs and she is able to walk all the dogs at the same time thanks to the gentle leader.

This collar is great!: This collar is absolutely fantastic! As long as you follow the instructions, fitting the collar was relatively easy. After one walk, my dog is hardly pulling at all! She now walks on a loose leash. I will be interested to see how she does when I walk her with my other dog. She is still pawing at the collar a little, but I have a feeling this behavior will disappear once she gets used to it. This is a fantastic collar that wasn't very expensive at all.

Not as you would expect...: We had received a lambskin for our newborn and he loves it so much, we decided to order a spare. This was a poor choice. I was lured by the price, but you get what you pay for. The fur is straight, not curly and soft, and it really looks like a dog pelt. And that's just too creepy.

The newest adventure for King-Street Kennels!: Tuff's Luck was a fairly good book with plenty of excitment. Neil Parker (who LOVES dogs) falls in love with a bouncey Jack Russel Terrier at a nearby farm. Tuff has lots of energy, but starts acting weird about the nearby woods. Then Mick, an older dog on the farm, get caught in a poacher's trap. Things start getting weirder. Then Neil and Chris see a ghost! Who knows what is going on in the woods? Will a mystireous little dog called Bramble that was found in a tangle in the woods spill the secret...
watching tv, computers, my dog

I made a reservation for a pet from New York JFK to Baku via Istanbul. I was advised by Turkish Airlines representatives to make a reservation for the cat on the flight with Jet Blue. However, when I called Jet Blue to make a reservation for my pet from Sacramento to JFK, I was told that the airlines never does this. And it is not allowed. Turkish Airlines representatives should have this information for travelers, as it is very difficult in the first place to make a pet reservation on Turkish Airlines. I called the Call center, and was told by a representative how to change my reservation. I did this, but there was an error in the booking that could not be changed, and I no longer had a booking for this flight, even though I was not offered any refund or further help. I was told that this case would be reported to customer service, and was given a number. I called the customer service back, and was not helped at all. I also emailed several offices, in both San Francisco and New York, and received no response whatsoever. After one week, I was told that they would put my case on priority status, that it would be handed within 48 hours. After 9 days, Turkish airlines has failed To address this situation. And this mistake - which their representatives created - has not been addressed or rectified. This is the worst service I have ever received from any airline that √É¬¨ have ever made a reservation with. I am extremely dissatisfied, as I have no longer have any way to reserve any ticket for myself and a pet in cabin on the airline.

Qatar Airways has always gone above and beyond in service but this time I was traveling with my pet. They handled the paperwork for at customs for me. I was given updates during the flight and even during my layover in the lounge, she was cared for - crate cleaned out, fresh water, treats given and she played. The process was smooth at my destination and my flight attendants even came to check on her in baggage claim. The flight attendants give excellent service and have great attention to detail. This is my favorite airline and each step of travel is pleasant due to amazing staff in every area of the journey.

Worst airline ever. I booked a flight with them for my whole family. I also booked my dog. 1 week before the flight they changed the aeroplane size and they told me I can√¢¬Ä¬ôt fly my dog anymore. I was so upset but I decided to find another airline and when I asked for my money back they told me they can√¢¬Ä¬ôt give me it all back and kept $1300 for penalties. It wasn√¢¬Ä¬ôt my fault they booked me with my dog then decided to change the aeroplane. They are horrible stealing from people when it√¢¬Ä¬ôs their fault they changed the aeroplane size and now left me with -1300 on my card and having to find a new aeroplane in a week that would take my dog. Shame on you doing this to travellers. They lost a forever client.

I called Turkish Airlines office in Toronto to make reservation for my dog to fly with us to Istanbul. She was very professional, answered every question I had, complete the reservation explaining to me all the details. She also helped with Miles & Smiles. I am a frequent flyer with Turkish Airlines and will continue so. Service is great, staff always smile and enjoy serving us, food is number one in the world and unlimited drinks. I recommend everyone to experience exceptional service with Turkish Airlines.

My journey with Qatar was an adventure. I was flying out with my dog, a native Sri Lankan dog (breed was mixed/mongrel) and it was a nightmare to book. To be fair, it wasn't bad the first time - mixed breed was okay. Unfortunately I had to change the date of my flight and rebook my dog onto the flight, and that's where the nightmare began. The staff wanted to know what breed my dog was, despite my dog not having a breed at all. I called them on a Friday about the dog, they said I would hear from them within 48 hours. That following Wednesday I had to call them because I hadn't heard anything yet, only to find out they never processed the dog in the first place and my flight was that Sunday! Despite not having any problems with "mixed breed" the first time, I had loads of problems now. Mixed breed wasn't okay, despite stating it definitely wasn't one of the dogs not allowed to fly. Mongrel wasn't okay either. I eventually got approved just over a day before the flight. It was an absolute nightmare to deal with - but from others I heard that Qatar was one of the easiest airlines to deal with for pet transport, and no one had any problems so far (there have been hundreds of Sri Lankan dogs transported with Qatar before this problem). The flight itself wasn't bad. We departed Colombo on time, staff were great during check in and checking my and my dog's documents was really easy - the manager was even excited to see my dog, and her and another staff member dedicated their time to me, in my own queue. The staff on the plane were nice too, both from Colombo-Doha and Doha-Amsterdam and assured me my dog was okay, even checking with the pilot to make sure the dog was on the flight and the pilot was aware of the dog. The flight itself was comfortable, good movie selections too. The only thing that bothered me was a lack of legroom on my Doha-Amsterdam flight, because the row in front of us had 4 seats and our row had 3 seats, leaving less space for me because of the seat in front of me. Me and the dog arrived safely and they even changed the dog's bedding during the layover, so I'm happy about that. If it wasn't for the nightmare of booking my dog onto the flight, it would've been great.

Qatar Business Class Quality Service in Economy.  A number of friends recommended Qatar to us as we have never flown them before and departing from the Philippines our options were limited. To make matters harder we traveled with 2 rescue cats who are daughters rescued pre Covid, but they were unable to return to pick them up, so my wife and I flew them with us to the USA.  Outstanding. From Check-in in Manila the entire staff were fantastic, they genuinely cared, a special thanks to Angelika. Due to a hernia, I needed wheelchair assistance and the staff looked after me as if I was their own father. Food onboard great, service great from Manila to Doha. Then the long sector Doha to Miami, again excellent and more praise for flight attendant Ben. He immediately saw I had an injury and moved forward to assist with bags and that my wife and I were comfortable. During the long flight he checked we were ok. A top man and a genuine person. Thank you, Ben. And Oh yes, the kitty cats were well looked after, given fresh water and food in Doha, and are happy reunited with their mummy in the USA

Toronto to Tehran via Istanbul. The most disrespectful customer service.  I have been a miles and smiles member for many years and I always book my flight business class. This is the second year i have booked to travel with my service dog and it has been 2 month and my file is still pending. When I contacted the customer service department every time they do not give me a right answer and tell me to call back later. On this ticket i have also a flight with Lufthansa and they were to approve my service dog within the first 24 hours and for Turkish Airlines it has been 2 months and they still have not given me an answer. Stay away from Turkish Airlines.

Hong Kong to M√É¬°laga via Istanbul. Be aware of this airline, these days they just cancel flights for no reason and last minute. They cancelled 2 times of my flight ticket HK - Istanbul- M√É¬°laga. You don't want this for you, especially during a pandemic situation, while everything is changing, all you want is a reliable airline that take you to your destination as planned. I changed everything (hotels, rentals and even with my dog) The experience for booking ticket for my dog traveling along wasn√¢¬Ä¬ôt nice either. The way to book is to call their call center, where they only know how to keep seat but no idea in regards to the process sending and picking up dog at both airports, you have to call local sales team for it. But for my case the HK local team has no responding for 2 weeks and still hasn√¢¬Ä¬ôt replied a proper answer.

Okinawa to Tokyo. My daughter and I just took a mini vacation to Tokyo  we flew on Japan airlines. After we arrived in Tokyo my daughter was informed that her dog was in the hospital and very sick. She tried with many different employees of Japan Airlines to change our flights to fly back earlier but they refused because she bought the tickets from Expedia. Well these two customers will never fly Japan Airlines again.

Breakfast was great ... good choice, we were later going in and they replenished the cooked food with fresh.  Everything is to hand and easy and our little dog loves walking round the golf course paths first thing.  Staff were really helpful and friendly. We will go back again. Thank you. Nothing.

Swimming pool, restaurant, and dog friendly. Disappointed with the criteria of hotel guests allowed to stay ... i.e., tradesmen (young lads)  - drunk and rowdy - their behaviour in the swimming pool was intimidating and disrespectful.

The hotel staff is really nice and helpful, the hotel is very well kept and the rooms were perfectly clean, good coffee at breakfast. Confortable and practical rooms. Excellent value overall and pets are welcome! Hard to find something to complain about. If anything the mattress could have been better but still wasn't bad and still slept well.

The rooms we booked had lovely views. Very comfortable stay, plenty of room for our dog too. The pub was a lovely friendly place with delicious food. A lovely relaxing weekend had by all, would certainly return some day. A bit of a trek to get to our car to get bags to/from  room - a bit of a hill back to car  Would have  been handy if the pub had some sort of trolley for guests to use perhaps.

Friendly welcome. Dog friendly breakfast was good  only criticism was salt in the pepper pot disaster averted. Garden pleasant and hotel in good location.  Room comfortable and bonus of additional loo next door.. We had friends join us in the bar on Saturday night but no bar staff available and we nearly went back to their hotel. Found a girl in the kitchen who served till bar was attended. Forgot to book Sunday evening meal by 5pm so went elsewhere

Nice location on the high street.  Seems to have been recently refurbished, very tastefully done old school chic, loads of wood and velvet.  Super friendly staff.  Very good breakfast.  And very, very dog-friendly: never seen more of all shapes and sizes under a single roof, including ours. Room not very big with 2 adults and a large dog in it, also seemed to be above the kitchen so quite warm and with rumbling noises underneath.  Shower cubicle not big enough for someone over 6ft with wingspan to match: I think there was enough floorspace to fit a bigger tray and enclosure, shame they didn't.  But none of these were major issues on a one-night getaway tbh, with minimal time spent in the room.

Very Good Location, Quiet, Comfortable, Clean lovely friendly Staff, excellent freshly cooked English Breakfast, fantastic, and rather different to the rest a real Country House Experience, but only about 15 minutes drive to Norwich City Centre, a hidden gem! Would highly recommended it. Not that keen on Dogs in the Restaurant, but it is a Dog friendly country Hotel so it's fair enough really. I To be fair to the owners they were very well behaved.

Breakfast was good!  There‚Äôs a restaurant within! Food was very good!  There is a safe in the room for valuables! For the price we paid, we shouldn‚Äôt have had to pay extra for our dogs (small breed)!

BREAKFAST was awsome, the pool really nice and quiet, the rooms were confortable, the stuff really friendly. Restaurant was tasty, Location was ok if you get there by car, very functional the direct access to the shopping mall. There was a really famous restourant just across the street (flor 40 th) but we didnt go there because we where travelling with small kids, but people really recomended it. Pets are allowed, we took out dog, 10/10 to this hotel. everything was ok, maybe the room service menu could be better.

Right in the center. Pleasant lobby. Staff were easygoing and friendly. I was traveling with my dog and as the hotel is pet friendly and right next to the big park in the center of town,  it was a nice place. The room I got had two single separate beds and while the mattress was very comfortable, it sunk in a little to below the woodline.

The staff was very kind and helpful, the gardens were gorgeous and the views beautiful. They had several seating areas by the water and a fire pit as well. The rooms were spacious and all of the linens were crisp and clean. They had plenty of coffee in the room and any type of glasswear needed. They were very dog friendly, and everyone's pets were well behaved. We didn't hear a peep out of anyone else's dog the entire time. Kid friendly, dog friendly and a beautiful location! If you are traveling with family or with a dog, it's a great place to stay and feel welcomed. The stairs have gaps where you can see down which was scary for our young child and dog- we had to carry the dog down the stairs because she refused to go down. The carpet on the balcony was a bit odd and weathered. These are by far not big deal items in the long run and I'd definitely stay again.
The hotel is pet friendly. The rooms were clean and updated. The location is close to stores and restaurants. Not applicable.

We chose this hotel due to its free shuttle and location close to the airport.  The shuttle even picked us up at the airport when we returned the car three days prior to flying.  The other PLUS was its location close to a Metro station...2 blocks and there was an elevator.  It was about 10+ stops to arrive in the city center.  We did not eat in the restaurant but did eat in the smaller cafe - the food was good and the staff was attentive and friendly.  The room was clean and the minibar was handy.  The area is very nice and quiet; there was a dog park across the street for those with pets.  The front desk staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly, too.  We will definitely stay here again. Nothing
Nicely refurbished room and bathroom. Dog friendly. Good value for money. Friendly staff. Location is tricky to get to when you are travelling from north to south.

VERY CLEAN. Modern, stylish interior. An option to regulate the temperature in the room. Nice bathroom, so fresh towels. QUIETNESS. Great territory behind the hotel to walk the dogs. The underground parking was full, we didn‚Äôt get a place, had to go the the last free spot on a public parking nearby.

excellent staff, breakfast amazing and a very handy location for the area around us. room was a bit tight with the extra bed for our teenage daughter & dog, however it was very clean and well presented. excellent shower!

You can‚Äôt have a hotel more centrally located than this. So great location, nice lobby and cozy rooms. Super comfy beds! The breakfast buffet had a lot of varieties and are clearly marked what allergens they contain, which is great. Nice, accommodating staff. Dog friendly! You need a parking ticket to the garage from the front desk but it is quite tricky to park just outside to run in and get a ticket. Had to stand askew on the curb while my husband ran inside‚Ä¶  We brougt our dogs which they charge extra for. Nothing wrong with that, but most dog friendly hotels lend you a water bowl and even a bed during your stay, but when we asked for a simple water bowl they replied ‚ÄùWe don‚Äôt have any, so we suggest you go and ask in a restaurant.‚Äù ?? Very strange for a hotel that claims to be dog friendly‚Ä¶
Was great, clean, pet friendly but air conditioner made too much noise kept my partner awake. Love the chairs to watch tv Air conditioning needs to be looked at way too noisy

Perfect location, room with a view and ideal for a shortbreak in Stockholm. Easy to walk the dog on the island. We will definitely recommend to our guests at N√•s Camping that often ask for nice spots-to-be in Stockholm. Pity we could just spend 1 day in Stockholm....
very comfortable, clean and serene , it was lovely to let the dog off to play with the dogs there , Debbie and Pete were great hosts . N/A

Wow what‚Äôs not to like! Free parking, friendly staff, dog friendly, extremely clean. The food was absolutely stunning‚Ä¶.exceptional, quality, and very cheap!!! The breakfast was unbelievable too!!! Nothing!

They had a great area for my dogs to play and use the bathroom in.. and the staff was very nice.. really good breakfest,loved the motorcycles there as well.. The room was a little bit small.. but still fine.
Location was perfect for our stopover and sightseeing for our short stay over. Staff were exceptional.   Very dog friendly. Would have been nice to have dinner as an option.

Friendly, clean, washer and dryer available, across the street from a very good Mexican restaurant, and 5 min from grocery store and everything else. I made the trip to visit my mom and was very glad that i did thank you. I was charged extra for pet daily. it adds up especially. when you're a long way from home.

Charlotte's Staff was really friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and clean. West Hampstead is the perfect place to stay. We had housekeeping everyday. We also loved breakfast at Lola's bakery. As a lot of flats in London, rooms were not really well isolated but guests took good care of trying to be quiet. We would love to come back with our dog but unfortunately not allowed...
Very safe area close to restaurants; convenient parking, comfy beds, clean and very pet friendly. overpriced breakfast. $4 muffin.
Convenient location  Comfortable beds Clean Allowed our cat ! The cost

Beautiful surroundings, immediate access to the forest and climbing sites. We have got a very big and comfortable room with a direct access to the garden which was very convenient with our dog. The breakfast was good with a decent variety of savoury and sweet food. The hotel has an indoor swimming pool which is a big plus. The renovations are planned in early 2024 so we are looking forward to stay there again and see the new swimming pool area. It‚Äôs a great place for a family weekend. Drinks at the bar are too expensive.

The terrace was nice. The room was clean. The staff were friendly. Breakfast was good, but not as great as in other German hotels. There's a small drinks/snack room based on honor system. Guests have access to a small common space and the backyard. Plenty of free parking. It's quiet. Dog friendly (with a fee). It was just a bit too expensive for a one night stay.

Pet friendly.  Even gave us a little toy for our little one.  We were allowed to leave the pet in the hotel while walking around the city, if well behaved obviously.   Near parks where you walk the dog easily.   Great location.   Nice staff, and welcoming.   Good room and hotel and clean. Only one person at reception during the night in the hotel - we asked for an extra pillow on the first night, as I'm pregnant, and we were told no, because the person in reception couldn't leave her station. However the next day in the morning, they gave us an extra pillow with no issue at all.  The parking is very tight and hard to get in. We have a small crossover , with a larger car would have been impossible.

Location is perfect, next to the main square and on pedestrian street. Hosts are nice and helpful. We were able to stay with our cats, which is a rare opportunity. Room itself is good, there were washer-dryer, mixer, all you need The shower might need some repair, sometimes the water was leaking outside of the cabin

- Very quiet convenient location - super close to the main road but you can't hear it all   - reception staff were nice  - good sized room  - breakfast was pleasant    Overall I'd stay here again but only in cooler months! - No air con - this made for a seriously uncomfortable night's sleep in the middle of July - bring a fan!   - the pillows were rubbish - like bits of cotton wool in a pillowcase  - it's quite dated inside - I know it was built in the 90s, and it's very cheap, so the decor didn't bother me  - quite a high surcharge for bringing a pet, with no amenities for pets (eg food/water bowls)

Good location, we got a 10% discount to a restaurant next to the hotel - Buffalo Grill Not even a small fridge in the room, couldn‚Äôt store the food we had for our dog, the shower curtain was moldy, the cleaning lady knocked and tried to get to our room at 9:00 while we were sleeping even though check-out is at 12:00, had to wait for 20 minutes at the reception for someone to come to do our check-in, but the girl was very nice and friendly

The motel itself is beautiful, quaint and nicely decorated with a beach theme. The location is excellent, close to downtown shops and the walking distance to the Embarcadero. There are several good restaurants nearby as well, all within walking distance. It was quiet and peaceful with great views from the upper floors. This place is also pet friendly, although there is a small fee for pets. We will be staying here again on our next trip! Everything was great! One of the better places we have stayed in on our travels!

Excellent property. Modern and attractive public areas. Room was spacious and comfortable. Warm welcoming staff.  Breakfast was impressive. The pet fee of $50 seems excessive and out of line with comparable travel hotels.

Brilliant location and very dog friendly. Nice room and good food. Quite tired and in need of a good clean. The surcharge for having a dog was supposed to come with some treats/bowls etc but we didn‚Äôt get these.
Elegant and eclectic, great breakfast and staff- they went out of their way for us. Also pet friendly which is rare for a historic property. Loved it all!

Everything! The apartment  is absolutely  new! Very clean! Ver cozy place with beautiful furniture .The host is very hospitable, answered all questions instantly, helped in many ways! We were with the dog, they provided bowls and a mat for the dog to sleep, it's wonderful. We stayed for only 2 nights, but there is a great desire to come back and stay for more nights. Thank you very much, we will be happy to return to this apartment. -

Great beds, friendly and welcoming staff, great pool and a variety of restaurants nearby It was pet friendly and there where some people with dogs that made their dogs leave their ‚Äúleftovers‚Äù right where you had to walk to get to the pool ü´£

The Room was well appointed. Facilities for the pet was great. Parking was a breeze. Hotel is close to the tram stop too, getting to city center using public transport is very easy. There were very few vegetarian options for dinner.

Portstewart. Good access to other areas.  Shops were good and very good dining options. Apartment was dog friendly as with almost all shops. Good walks in area. The views are stunning. Car parking initially a challenge but got used to limit on hours. Had potential to be very noisy particularly when windows open which was necessary in sunshine and heat.

Very pleasantly surprised how good our stay was due to price paid and age of hotel,  Room was clean and warm and everything was in good condition. Beds were very comfortable  Ample car parking available, and a bonus to be able to take our little dog.  We did not have breakfast at hotel, but view was lovely of Bristol channel.  Reception staff are lovely and very amenable if you have an issue. We ate in Terrace bar in evening, unfortunately my sister in laws sandwich had to be returned, but we were not charged.  However it was Valentines night in main restaurant and so staff were very busy.

When I got into the room, there was a little surprise for my dog! They prepared his stay as well, with a bed, 2 bowls, water and some snacks! But what I liked more was that there was some papers with additional information about pets in the city (e.g, poop laws, leash, hospital, pet center, and so on). This was amazing for me traveling with my dog!  The breakfast was very good, with lots of different food, and very delicious!  The entire staff was very friendly! They even get me some tips of where to go dinner!  Definitely worth it! The fitness area needs some attention, as there was no internet connectivity (mobile or wifi).  Becuase the fitness area is underground, there is not mobile reception, so it was to imagine that there was at least wifi connection, but to my surprise I had the most boring cardio so far! Watching the trendmil screen...

The staff were friendly and welcoming and nothing was too much trouble for them. Even our wee dog got a lovely welcome with his own biscuit on arrival and a sausage for breakfast! The beds were too hard and uncomfortable. There was a bump in the bed where the beds were joined together as well which didn't add to the comfort.
A beautiful and stylish cottage in a quiet rural location. Parking and wi-fi available. Good walks for the dog.   An absolute delight all round. Loved it. It was all first class.

It was easy to find. The room was a nice size.  Having a refrigerator was great.  The bed was comfortable and the pillows we good. No shortage of hot water. The staff were friendly and efficient There is no clock in the room.  And even though it is a dog friendly place, there is no grass, only rock area for the dogs to go. It is nice you provide bags, that‚Äôs why I knew this area was for the dogs

Room was great. Pet friendly.(was my dogs 1st stay at a hotel)  Air conditioner worked very well which is a must for me. Elevator was very sketchy and scared the life out of me so had to use the stairs for the remainder of my stay.

The free breakfast buffet was perfect has a little bit of everything. My spouse and I plus our dog üêï, stay in one of the rooms with a spa tub ( Jacuzzi tub ), witch was fantastic.   The room was very clean.   Hotel is child friendly with indoor pools,very friendly staff I will definitely stay here again.  MY FAVORITE PART WERE ALL THE FROGS üê∏ ‚ù§Ô∏è üíô üíñ       My only down side I had->->  Ice machines were all out of service. I have nothing bad say. About this fantastic hotel. My experience with Nest western in Elko NV was fantastic. We will definitely be booking here again.
Very friendly in a lovely location, helpful staff & lovely food.  Very dog friendly Nothing, everything was as expected

Very beautiful accommodation on the edge of Metsovo, with a great view.  Extremely friendly and welcoming staff, who made us feel at home (2 adults + 2 dogs).  Breakfast has a variety of choices of delicious local products.  We did the winery tour which we really liked.  At the store we had the opportunity to buy our favorite wines.  See you soon again Katogi Averoff. If something can be optimised is the internet connection.

Friendly folks, great price and location! Felt very safe, the room was spacious. All I gotta say is that for a dog friendly hotel, there is not any grass on the grounds for dog walking; you can cross the (rather busy) street, or there's a small strip behind the building next door. We travel with our senior dog, she was not a fan of the hike to the small grass patch.

Great location, clean rooms with nice decor, friendly staff and it's pet friendly. The only thing that was a small disappointment was the pool and hot tub being closed for repairs, but I totally understand.

Location is excellent for us, close to the old town, restaurants and shops and also close to a big park for the dogs could use a shelf or something in the bathroom, no place to put my cosmetics when I'm putting on makeup

Great location, loved having convenient bite to eat in the morning.  Appreciate they allow dogs.  Gave us extra towels on request. We paid extra to have our dog with us and would have liked to have the room vacuumed at least once during our 4 day stay.

There was a pet blanket and treats waiting for us (we had a pet room). Bed was comfortable. Food at the restaurant was tasty... friendly service.    Got tips on places to explore. The meals at the restaurant were pricey.  Ice cream machine was down.
Friendly staff, good breakfast and pet friendly. Pool/ hot tub closed

Hosts Nikki and Pete were lovely. The guest house is beyond dog friendly- it‚Äôs dog focused, which is rare, and made our stay and Bolt‚Äôs, really special. There are thoughtful touches - homemade biscuits and Dorset apple cake, as well as dog bowls, dog towel, dog biscuits, and the offer of a dog bed. Our room was large, clean and bed very comfortable. There was a good choice of breakfast options, and breakfast was delicious. The information pack was really helpful, giving lots of recommendations for eateries and activities. The hosts local knowledge was good, with recommendations for walks and places to visit. The location is very central, with a very short walk to the beach, town and harbour.  We will definitely stay at Stone‚Äôs Throw again. Everything was to good standard. There was nothing we did not like.
Our hosts went out of their way to be extremely helpful during our stay. The house was super clean and totally met expectations. The garden was secure and ideal for our dog. Liked it all.
Spacious, clean room and a quirky hotel. Very pet friendly. Subsidised parking next door. TV link to phone for Netflix was disabled. Food in hotel poor quality, but lots of options nearby.

Everything!! Lovely guest house, warm friendly helpful staff, the attic room was very cozy with plenty of space for us both plus our two dogs üôÇ full English bfast sets you up for the day ahead, we took a 2hr stroll over the hills n dales to Bowness where there's plenty of pubs to enjoy a well earned drink. The Watermill pub along the road serves great food, with a nice relaxing atmosphere too...and there's a garage with a well stocked shop for nighttime snacks next to the guest house. We definitely plan to return. Shame about the weather!! üòï

Always, I stay in that property is close to airport and easy way to get out of ATL if you are traveling , breakfast is good, pet friendly and  rooms are  very spacious , parking is free and check in/out process and employers is nice and quick , main and important is nobody nock in your door before 12 to check out, I stay 5 stars hotel and 9 am, I got disturb even check out is 11 ou 12, for traveling looking for nice stay I hight recommend . Everything was good

The room was very attractive looking and clean. The bathroom was excellent with a very large shower cubicle. Our cavalier king Clcharles spaniel was also accommodated, with treats left in the room by hotel staff and easy access to a large garden. The hotel was also less than a 30 minute walk from the lakes and town centres. The room was smaller than expected. Due to the layout of the furniture and small room size, it was quite cramped. We paid ¬£250 for a standard room, which I thought was quite pricey for the size of the room. Also, the hotel is advertised as accommodating small dogs, but there was no mention (at least that I saw) for there being an extra ¬£30 charge for it. Just an extra cost to be mindful of if you're on a budget.

Spatious rooms/apartments, clean for swiss standards and the location is convenient with the tram stop just outside the hotel. Not a double bed but 2 separate matrasses, despite the online checkin it was still very slow to check in, 15 CHF to have a dog with you and 25 CHF for the parking.

Great hotel. Pet friendly which is a massive plus. Decent continental breakfast included and hot tub, sauna and tennis court a plus. Rooms are a decent size and the bed and pillows were super comfortable. Will definitely return. Not much.
Allows my dog. Possible to drive up to your door. No carpet. Clean. Comfortable bed. No bottom floors available, but we got there late.

Check in was easy, very friendly welcome from Tom.  Room excellent.  Bar and restaurant areas very nice and welcoming.  Our dog was very warmly welcomed and had a great time. Food portions on the small side.  Had a mixed grill with 'half a roast chicken' which was actually a small piece of chicken breast.  Steak pie  portion also very small.  Nice food but portions need to be a bit bigger.

Great B&B immediately met by the owner with a friendly greeting, she couldn't do enough for us and gave us lots of information about dog friendly pubs, cafes etc. Spotlessly clean, and a fabulous full English breakfast. It was all exceptional

The hotel is very comfortable and cozy. We choose apartment room - it was big enough with two rooms, everything was clean. I should point out courtesy of staff - everyone are polite and want to help you. Moreover, hotel is pet friendly. There were life music in the restaurant on Thursday in the evening, and it could be heard from the room.
Perfect first floor room for dog owners. Clean, nice place just off the 5. Mr Shasta City is a nice little town. NADA

The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and professional. The service at the breakfast and dinner was always very courteous and quick and the room and decor in hotel were lovely. It was advertised as dogs allowed in bar area but sadly they actually are only permitted at one desk at reception. The hotel has three bar areas so one of them could be dog friendly surely? The room was a tad small too...
Comfortable and spacious room, dog friendly which was much appreciated. Bar prices are a little steeper than average. More info (meal times, spa location etc) on arrival would be helpful

Fair 2 stars Hotel, nothing to write home about, nothing to complain.... Good value for money. Location in lido is perfect if you have a car. Late checkout pet friendly. Would stay again.... Definitely needs some refreshing.....

The staff were so friendly and professional. Colours and decor just right. Superb shower. Warm. Good varied menu. Nothing negative. an extra touch appreciated in other hotels that accept pets , is to have a collection of old towels at the entrance to accommodation. I had old towels in the room ready but too late as dog brushed past bed before I was ready, so sorry R&C.
The bed was comfortable. there was a warm welcome for my dog and the staff were friendly. Placement of mirror with socket for hair dryer. Slippery floor outside shower.
Rooms lovely and clean. The reception staff very helpful when we needed to sit opposite the reception as we had the dog Cooked breakfast not good. We came down at 9am and it was all dried up.
Clean comfortable pet friendly room at an excellent rate. Parking lot needs to be resurfaced.
The location was excellent, so close to the beach! And the gardens around the property were lovely. The chalet living area was very small for 2 adults, 2 teens and a dog‚Ä¶
We travel with our dog and stayed in one of the pet friendly rooms which was modest but very clean and comfortable- very much met our needs and expectations. Thx Nothing

In short, it's the best hotel of Tarapith as per value for money.  The foods are really tasty,  rooms are good and clean. It's a pet friendly hotel. And I we really loved the pool. There's no such thing of discomfort.

Very friendly staff, superb location and parking availability, whole venue was nice and clean, dog friendly and room was very spacious with great amount of amenities available. For someone slightly taller than your average person, I found the bed quite small/short which led me to have my feet hanging off which was rather uncomfortable. Other than that, it was the most perfect stay.

My partner and I enjoyed the stay, the environment you could breathe in. Walking diatance to shops, corner coffee shop, the beach.  Close to the hot Springs. And Gunnamatta horse trails.   Bed was comfy, pillows too.   Also upon arrangement/ request I was allowed to stay back another 2 hrs past check out, without paying extra due to I didn't know the area, I had my dog with me, and I suffer chronic pain illness, and partner was onna fishing charter till close till 3pm.  Which was very generous !   Mostly in particular our Kelpie was allowed on the property. (Pets are allowed) Showers don't last anymore than 3mins or less for one person. (May need to get the tank. Water line. checked out)   Toilet blocked upon arrival, took 40 mins to unblock before my partner could use it. (May need a plumber to check it out)   - Villa 30.   I know we can't remove them but those DAMN POSSUMS Miss Heidi thought she was tough barking behind blinds whilst this possum is growling loudly at 2 or 3am.   OVERALL this property is convenient for holiday makers, solo (one night stays), couples, families. it's cute, situated in a  quiet area.  People whom live there long-term are very friendly.  (Walking around with their dogs, and coffees in hand.)

Apartment clean and everything you could need. The hosts had left extras, bread milk eggs butter, and tea/coffee tray with biscuits. There were four adults and two dogs, plenty of room, not falling over each other. Bedrooms spacious and a large bathroom with walk-in shower and a bath, shower gels left as well. Ideal place situated in a small village, which was quiet.  All shops within walking distance, Tesco, co-op, butchers, bakers, places to eat, from English to Turkish.There is no parking at the apartment. However, free parking 2 minutes away. It's pretty central for sightseeing as well. Will definitely be going back. To be honest, there wasn't anything I didn't like.. I'm sure some might not like certain things, each to there own

The hotel itself felt grand and spacious and was clean and tastefully decorated.i was a HUGE fan of the Breakfast area, and loved the arched windows and the seating area got lots of sun. There were great options for Breakfast-although I would have preferred bacon over sausage, but that's just me.  The staff was polite, and check-in was easy. The rooms themselves were tidy and very well presented, and I liked the quality bath/shower products that were in the room. (Dove shampoo/conditioner & lotion). It was a thoughtful extra.   I was happy with the pet friendly accommodations and the pet fee was reasonable. Nice location, overall great experience. I wish the fountain feature in the lobby was working, and I wish there was a hot tub or sauna.
Great value for money, dog friendly, really easy to get to from the train and also to the town center. Had everything we needed Nothing

Ideal for 2 people and a dog Compact but lots of little extras like salt and pepper grinders,small bottle of milk in the fridge,selection of sauces as well as teas and coffee  All very modern and immaculately clean and very quiet  Lovely comfortable bed Nothing it was all very good  Would definitely return
Nice room with a balcony & good parking. 25 minute walk downhill into the centre. Pet friendly No tea/coffee making facilities in the room or at reception.
Location excellent. Value for money. Staff accommodating & friendly. Quiet and great place if you have a dog. Nothing

Was clean, comfortable, and affordable.  We were able to bring our dog with us. Was central to everywhere we needed to go. They were doing some remodeling and didn't say anything.  We were not bothered by any loud noises, but sometimes, there were some smells.

we could walk into town and there was a super park for walking the dog breakfast was great coffee shop across the road and a fish and chip shop and a boots the chemist bus stop just outside the Ascot House great. Could not fault anything.

Location was fantastic. Dog friendly,plenty of walks close to hotel  Food very good and staff pleasant and helpful. Mattress needs to be updated in room we had room 2,it was thin and had no proper support.probably poorest night's sleep for a long time . Furniture was functional but dated and a bit too much squeezed in.   Water very hot in taps ,but in the shower could not get it above warm. Bathroom however was large and warm.

We always have the same pet friendly room. The food is not great but the staff very good. However the room floor is EXTREMELY DIRTY. I‚Äôm sure it has been cleaned but hall and bathroom were terrible and that is because the door is in poor repair so debris blows in. See above
Excellent location, easy parking and dog friendly. Pleasant front desk staff. A bit outdated, mildew in bathroom and limited breakfast items.

The recent renovation is really appreciated. The kitchenette was perfectly outfitted and the room/bathroom was comfortable and very clean. They really do an outstanding job of cleaning. Pets are permitted for a fee. Coffee makers in the room and free coffee in the lobby. Well situated near shopping and restaurants. Excellent value. The bed had a slight dip on the side I slept on; the mattress could stand to be turned. I would prefer a small round table and chair for dining as opposed to a big lounge chair and small computer table as there is also a desk. The clock hadn‚Äôt been changed for DST and I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to do it. The freezer ice maker was very loud so I turned it off for the night.

Expedition Lodge is staffed by very friendly knowledgeable people and their breakfast was fantastic filled with lots of good and unexpected choices (including a Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwhich and whole grain waffles). Location was perfect. Easy walking distance to coffee, shopping and restaurants. There is also decent parking even for a truck and trailer. Dogs are welcome. Retro design was cool. The rooms are a bit dated (older furniture, coffee set up, etc.) but this didn't bother us. It's retro afterall.

Incredibly central, very friendly lady on the desk who pointed me to the Sunday craft market which was a lot of fun. Older building but very very clean and comfortable. A great place to stay with the dogs. n/a

Friendly staff. Friendly chatty customers like ourselves. Relaxed atmosphere and able to take our dog with us (pet friendly). Good parking facilities. Very good meals and portion sizes The smell in the room we were in (room 18). Smelled damp and really unpleasant. Room didn't have any bedside tables. Lights above the bed were much too bright
Nice big dog friendly cottage room off the car park.   Plenty of parking.  Really nice breakfasts  Very friendly staff  Evening meals from restaurant were really good. Nothing really

Really good facilities, great room, the location was great. Good check-out time (12 pm rather than 11 am as in many hotels). Our dog got a special little gift from the staff! Our room had a door to an adjoining room, and we had a really rough night sleeping because the people next door were up all night, and we could hear everything.

Nice hotel.  Pet friendly.  Food was good, however the poor waitress was on her own taking care of the bar and food orders.  We weren't in a rush, but had we been it would have been a problem.  She was wonderful despite being under terrible stress. I didn't like having to pay extra for my pets.  There was really no reason for it.
New property, very clean and comfortable. Love the kitchenette and it is pet friendly. Beds were very comfortable and staff were friendly and helpful. No pool or exercise facilities.

Great hosts. Very accommodating of us being vegan and bringing our three dogs. Lovely food-breakfast and dinner. Relaxing and homely vibe in the cafe/bar. Great location for walks and exploring nearby beaches and very close to the seal trips. We would love to return. An en suite would have been great but we were well aware that the bathroom was separate when we booked and it was just across from our room, so wasn‚Äôt inconvenient at all. We understand that many of the rooms are en-suite-we just booked last minute!
location on route to the Highlands was ideal for a stopover, with easy access to the property and doorstep parking. Rooms well appointed and very comfortable meeting our needs and that of our dog.
The room was clean and spacious.  They allowed our dog with no extra fees. The room was a little dated.

-clean, pleasant overnight stay.  -free parking -dogs accepted  -location just next to the highway , so if travelling by car and passing through this is super convenient. -the town was actually quite a lovely discovery. super maintained, found great food without any recommendations and the people were extremely nice wouldn‚Äôt book it for a vacation per say
Polite and helpful service, clean and functional rooms, and also pet rooms!! No issues

Nicely located in a corn field. Less than 10 mints walk to the Mestre Ospedale train station. We traveled with our dog and everyone was very pet-friendly.  There is also a restaurant on site next to the pool which serves amazing food, you will just need a reservation beforehand. Some little things inside the apartment need attention to detail or fixing such as the toilet seat, door handles, and shower accessories.

The 1 bedroom apartment at 4th floor was very nice, clean, big and had all we needed. We had free parking on site which was very convenient. We recommend this hotel. I found the tax for our small dog a bit high.  Also the options for breakfast could be improved. For instance there was just one type of jus (cherries) and there were no fruits at all. The ham was not the best either.
Very convenient location, staffs are friendly and helpful. Pet friendly. Nothing - perhaps have a big pot will be great, as we enjoy cooking.
great location, romantic decor with rose placed in bed, great for a couple, a super sweet cat,  friendly and helpful host  hot tub after a long day of travelling! n/a

A beautiful hostel in heart of Old City Udaipur. Hardly 2 minutes walk from Jagdish Mandir, Gangaur Ghat, Bagour ki Haveli & many other monuments. The Staff was amazing, they helped us with curated itinerary and tailored recommendations. It's a beautiful property with amazing vibe. The dorms are 4 bedded but still enough luggage storage. All washrooms attached. The common area is aesthetically beautiful and can fill your Gram with crazy backdrops. The rooftop is just amazing. The best sunset view it gives in town as it's on height and whole property is built on elevated ground. You'll meet 2 beautiful pets Bruno(Pug) and Dadu (African Grey Parrot).  This place definitely going to be my home in udaipur and I'll keep visiting. I didn't like leaving from this place, the heavy heart while saying goodbye to the family I made here. I'll surely come back here üòä

Keith at front desk was excellent. Recommended restaurants, found room that did NOT have pets recently. I have allergies and have difficulty finding lodging that doesn't t give me a reaction. Rooms are nice but a bit tight.

The bed and breakfast had the historic architecture with modern amenities. It is so close to all the attractions and very quiet. Breakfast was fresh and delicious and the host were absolutely the best every. They are full of knowledge of not only Puerto Rico but all of the construction and amenities they provided. Also there is a friendly little dog named Oreo - you have to say hello. I don‚Äôt really have any complaints. It was a wonderful place to stay and the hosts were so accommodating and friendly. I would have asked for the the two story room for a little more romantic atmosphere but our room was spectacular.

Everything was great. Wooden chaltes were very comfortable. My 6 year old loved the location so much that we extended our stay for one more day. Their dog simba is love. Must visit place. Nothing as such.
spacious clean rooms. great games room for the kids. dinner and breakfast were both very good. would prefer if it wasn‚Äôt pet friendly. as have allergies but appreciate that is personal.

The owners and their two dogs were so lovely. The pool was a great addition and needed at times to escape the heat! The accommodation is cleaned daily and kept to a high standard. The location in town was perfect, not in the thick of all the restaurants but very close by to the main road. The beds were really comfortable too. We had a lot of mosquitoes in our room when we first arrived but that can‚Äôt be helped when the room was empty!

The location is perfect for walking, dining, cycling and the bonus was the Saturday Farmer‚Äôs Market right outside the front door! Staff is very team-oriented and friendly. Planters in the front were so beautiful and welcoming. The waiver coupon for cleaning. The following are only observations for improvement‚Ä¶.our stay was near to perfect. A guest left their dog (obviously unattended), barking and crying in their room and patio late in the evening and it was very upsetting. It went on for a long time. The $15 a day parking charge. The baked goods in the coffee bar, need an upgrade. They did not look appetizing.

The property backs onto the Galloping Goose trail and looks over the water so a gorgeous view and lovely walks right out of our patio door. We were able to have a delicious meal within 10 minutes walk down the trail, again right on the water.  The breakfast is simple but nutritious and tasty, delivered to your door the night before. The hot tub was fun. It was just a short drive to the Sooke Potholes park and Whiffen Spit for walks and other places for meals. The owners and manager were very helpful and obliging. And Jaxx, the dog, is gorgeous! It wasn't a big problem, but just a note that the property is right on the number 14 highway so you have to slow down and take care to turn into the parking area at the front of the property. Having said that there is a bus stop right near the house for buses to and from Victoria. So the property is even good for those reliant on public transport.

The property and the surrounding area was nice as it was more isolated and surrounded by trees. We could see and hear macaques, squirrels, and various birds. The room was small, but it was cozy. We booked the double room for the shared kitchen but it felt more like a private kitchen, which was huge plus. We had a kettle, drinking water, fridge, and they even provided free coffee and noodles. A lot of cute cats as well. The location may be a bit isolated for some people, but was no problem for us since we had a scooter. They were renovating the pool at the time we were there, so it was a bit noisy during the day.
Breakfast was great. Room good, friendly staff.  Didn't appreciate the barking dog across the hall. Why don't they puty all the dogs in one section of the motel ?

room cleanliness of hallway, stairs smelled really bad between rainy weather with dog poop in stairway- told management and crew several times how to fix the issue.  We had stayed here before years ago and this situation made it to where my husband didn't want to stay there anymore.

The hospitality was exceptional, lovely interactive and friendly hosts who are passionate about what they do. Nice to have hosts who take the time to get to know you.  I thought it was competitively priced and the beds were comfy. The twin room had a lovely new bathroom. There were teas, water, drinks and biscuits waiting. They had friendly dogs the chooks provided us with tasty breakfast eggs. Happy with our stay, we took two rooms so had the floor to ourselves. It‚Äôs not super fancy furniture but it‚Äôs super comfy.
Location and friendliness of staff. Breakfast fabulous. Gorgeous well behaved hotel dog. Could have used a little more shelf space/ hooks in bathroom.

Near the lake. A quiet old hotel with a good location near the lake but there was a very noisy area behind the hotel I could not rest at the night time specially with the dogs .. the breakfast was normal and there was no air condition.

Everything was amazing. Perfect garden getaway, a short drive/ bus ride outside of Florence city centre. We roamed the property gardens every night with a bottle of wine restocked by staff. Anything we wanted and needed - we got. Breakfast in the morning was the perfect way to start the day and the staff were so sweet. Biggest thanks to Angelo, Lisa and Becky the cat (who visited us every morning and stayed for us as we lounged during the day). Great recommendations from staff and so so peaceful. Will definitely be back and will tell our friends hunting for the perfect Florence stay! Thank you!!! It had some mosquitoes but those are unavoidable in Italy.

Good room service, good service at reception.  Possibility to store lagguages last day after check-out. Goog location close to Metro. A barking dog around 1 a.m. in the morning almost every day. Confused receptionist about in advanced payment via Booking. But it was quite soon explained.

I had a fabulous and very comfortable four poster bed, the separate bathroom was huge and had a bath which was much needed.  The lounge was also really comfortable.  Beautiful house, lovely furniture and interesting items all around.  Breakfast was perfect and Anne was a lovely host.  I loved the dog too.  I‚Äôd definitely stay here again. Nothing it was fantastic

Breakfast was excellent. Julia made fresh multi grain bread rolls and we each had a freshly fried egg. There was a lovely selection of jams and cheese to choose from. One of the best brekkys we had included in the very reasonable nightly tariff.  As we had our own vehicle the house was easy to reach. The road in has a few pot holes so just take it easy. A little out from Selfoss but so quiet and homely, suited us perfectly. Julia is a delightful, helpful host. She has a house and garden filled with cats, chickens and ducks. They are all very domesticated and just gorgeous to cuddle. If you don't love animals, choose somewhere else to stay as Julias pets are part of the family. We Love Animals!!! Nothing, we highly recommend Julias and would stay there again!!

The place is wonderful, our deluxe room had a really beautiful view of the ocean and it was next level of what we have experienced previously in Zanzibar. Traditional rooms, but with nice facilities. We appreciated the small details, toiletries, coffee machine with everything needed and the most important for Zanzibar, the water and the fridge.   Everyday there was someone coming with a bugspray for avoiding mosquitos, but I think in Africa is hard to avoid all the bugs in the room. The restaurant was very nice and the drinks&food great, the only downside was that sometimes was cooked in a way, other time in another way, but delicious. There‚Äôs private beach with few sunbeds and chairs and our dog friend Kongo, who enjoys swimming in the ocean waves. Local people were often meeting for the fish market on the beach in front of the restaurant and you could take part of an interesting custom of theirs.  If we return to Zanzibar, we would totally come back to Hebe Bungalows. The drainage system in the bathroom was clogged and bugs were sometimes coming in from the pipes after the water was slowly draining (it‚Äôs understandable for Africa, but worth taking a look into this). Also we didn‚Äôt get the breakfast to go in our last day as the owner arranged because the chef forgot about it, not uncommon for staff around Zanzibar to forget to take care of the customers.  Just a thing that might make the place perfect would be a pool - maybe in the future - as sometimes the ocean is going far on low tide and it would be wonderful to have a place to relax in the meantime.
simple motel in Coffs Harbour to break up or journey North to Qld Dogs in next room barking.

Very beautiful & peaceful place, neat & tidy location. Chalet location is very good nearby beach & highstreet .. easy to buy everything üôè Double & single Mattress not comfortable at all also when we arrive the sofa bed full of some puppy hair I vacuum myself because my nephew is allergy with that, but rest of the chalet is neat & clean üíô

Oh my goodness this PLACE. A five minute downhill stroll to have Loch Ness essentially to yourself! The rooms are so warm and cosy and Jane and Gill couldn't have been nicer. We had dinner with them and the food was spectacular. Proper home cooked food. We were lucky enough to befriend their pack of incredible pooches and, at our request, spent dinner and breakfast with two of them. Tyler, Freddie, smudge and lily you stole our hearts! üòä  The reviews you're reading are all accurate-this was a huge highlight of our trip. If you're a dog lover(and even if you're not-they're kept away from guests unless requested!) you'll love it even more. They wouldn't let us steal a dog üòÇ Joking aside, there was nothing we didn't love. This place is a gem.

Beautiful period building plenty of history. IT‚Äôs location is perfect. Rooms were lovely and clean and had all you need. Only thing would be the smell. But as it is a dog friendly hotel it‚Äôs to be expected.

I enjoyed the view from the property and the general comfort and cleanliness of the rooms. I also enjoyed meeting the friendly dogs. As quite a short person I found that I could not reach the top shelves of the kitchen cupboards. I wonder if it would be possible to have a step stool for others of my height or even shorter. [I am 5ft 2in]  I was quite nervous when reversing out of the parking spot because of the drop down which I could not see from inside the car.

I really enjoyed the cleanliness, the comfort of the bed, the cozy ambiance and the responsiveness of the staff. It is a very cute place overall and has very relaxing vibes. the dog was barking a bit in the morning and it woke me up.  I would‚Äôve like the bed‚Äôs curtains to cover the entire bed all the way.

Nice pool area, water was nicely warm :)  Personnel with attention to the guest‚Äôs needs Nice ocean vibe in room Close to the beach, +- 3 min by walk  Two lovely cats next to reception room :) The bathroom was really small

Laghetto Moinhos beautifully combines a vintage facade with a contemporary interior. The hotel exudes a cozy and clean atmosphere, making it a visually appealing and comfortable stay. The significant downside of Laghetto Moinhos is its poor sound insulation. The noise from adjoining rooms and the presence of pets, especially barking dogs, can be quite disruptive, affecting the overall tranquility of the stay.
Good location and staff. Blackpool standard rooms but with better bar and breakfast room than the rest Owners dogs were a real nuisance

The Poolhouse was very quickly, clean and tidy. we loved the fact we could fit the whole family of 5 in it. It was such good value for money. The only negative was that is was pet friendly and I have a slight dog allergy so struggled a tiny bit (but that was my fault when booking, I obviously missed it in booking.com

The rooms were dated but well equipped with good TVs, lots of space, and very comfortable beds. Bathrooms in serious need of modernisation, and the carpets were old fashioned - signs of dog hair here and there but that's inevitable in a dog friendly hotel I guess. The restaurant is great - really quick service, some talented chefs working away behind the scenes for sure. Breakfast had loads to choose from, and when something ran out it was quickly restocked. The hotel shows wear and tear, but you can tell they are gradually trying to update the place where they can. Only being given 1 key per room wasn't ideal, but manageable, and I like that they were electronic key cards that actually worked first try!
Location, intimate, secure, comfortable! Barking Dogs during evening and into the night! Caretaker was not available for questions and assistance after check in and at check out!

Room was big. Shower was clean. Hot. AC. Fridge and MWave good. Safe location. Easy. The garage parking was great. THANK YOU The cat was noisy outside. Very early. . Feed it OR give it away to a happy home.

Location, availability through whatsapp, services and ammenities, the visit of a cat during the night through the balcony the walls are very slim, we can listen what is happening in the corridor and in the room next door

The breakfast was included and very tasty: a good variety of food (toast, cheese, fruits, crudit√©s, eggs, even local Albanian homemade pastry). The location is perfect, the kitchen is spacious which makes it super enjoyable to cook. Also a great place for digital nomads to work.  Big special mention to their team of volunteers: Fernanda, Eduardo and the girl from Argentina. They were all so lovely. It's been my favourite hostel of my Balkan roadtrip.  Last but not least one of their cat was adorable ü•∞ My eight bed dorms didn't have a lot of plugs to charge off phones. We managed though but could be a little improvement.

Very close to the bus stop which takes you to Venice centrale. Very good breakfast. l Lovely staff that helped for our bikes (garage and cleaning wipes when we asked). Adorable cat. You can hear the neighbouring rooms so the noise insulation isn‚Äôt the best.

Really nothing to find fault with  Excellent service and friendly staff Felt under no pressure to tip but really pleased to Personal touch of desk manager who showed us to our room Throughout the stay he remembered my name If I had wanted to take the dog they have an open minded policy and would accept if well behaved and not too large

A new employer unable to do her job at the reception was nasty to me It was the days of the terror and I asked if the trains were leaving to Italy or not cause they said frontiers were going to be closed She answered to me that she was busy hotel was in fact empty cause all afraid they left and that it was not her business to phone or find a solution for me I never found a concierge like this and I have travelled for more thans 20 years She even said that dogs are not welcomee there and that I cannot come back with them So I called the other genius employer named Moussa in his day off and he helped me in every one of my doubts and solved all the problems this unpolite inefficient unprofessional caused   All is fantastic in this hotel They are very gentle I am a recurrent guest for many years now I even come with three little dogs and they are well accepted The clenaing with alina was perfect in my room in spite of dogs Only at breakfast is fruit is missing and also a fridge in the room would be perfect
When we arrived they said they were not pet friendly   Great value

If you are travelling with pet the staff might stress you out i payed 20 euros for my dog a really tiny dog and first they told me im not allowed to leave my dog alone in the room after trying to explain i ve booked some tickets to some museums they said i have to keep my dog in a cage and that also applies to when we go for breakfast very dissapointed abou the pet policy rooms are very small comparing to what i ve booked on Booking the room is not part of a 4star hotel Rather a 2 3 star hotel  It is very close to everything 20 min walk and you are in the centre of the city
The hotel is pet friendly and in the case of dogs there isn t any areas to walk them If they have suggested walking areas for dogs that would be great  No Positive

Price for pets are way overrated 20 per night Same for the breakfast 17 50 per person Across the street you can have breakfast for 9 p p Beds are not comfortable for long people 192 cm   Perfect location to discover Paris Down the street you can find several restaurants cafe s and stores The entrance for the subway and bicycle center are nearby Nice swimming pool and steam bath
The carpet of the room was very dirty and the room was quite small   Very pet friendly excellent location and amazing breakfast
No Negative  next time I will bring my dog as she would love it everyone was so friendly

Sadly too expensive to frequent other than for very special occasions However worth saving up for I do prefer a kettle to the capsule coffee machines which wasn t one of the best   The staff were all really genuinely friendly I loved the fact that this five star hotel is pet friendly and has its own two year old golden retriever Food and service all excellent The displays of fresh flowers all over the hotel are magnificent

There is a lot of automobile traffic in Milan Our room was on the second floor with a street side window and the traffic noise was quite a lot at times Wifi one device at a time with repeated login  The room was adequate in size and clean A public parking garage was just around the corner The metro station was a few blocks away as well a a grocery store We were traveling with a pet and the staff were able to accommodate us with a room with out carpeting
Additional payment for pet 15 Euro  Big and comfortable room Very cozy bed

everything was great in my opinion the pool is more suitable for winter since the pool area is very humid   very lovely international hotel in the breakfast room you could hear almost all dialects of the Arabic language some Korean Japanese and Chinese the food was great much better than other hotels the stuff was charming all of them and especially Stefano best thing they allow dogs which makes them number one on my future list when I come with my family one last thing room was beautiful and clean
Nothing really   Great Location Very nice location Pet friendly
