Unfortunately I had hurt my back whilst in Phuket which meant I couldn't walk very far, at Phuket airport I requested wheelchair assistance and Qatar staff came into their own and provided a wonderful service, through customs and security, into the the lounge and a couple of hours later to the aircraft. The same on transiting Doha and final arrival in Manchester. Will now always fly Qatar as the long haul option.

I had booked return flights with wheelchair service for my 60 year old Mom for AMD to DFW and back. The flight schedule was changed and instead of 3 hours bearable lay-over, now there was a 11 hour lay-over. They gave hotel accommodation but I was still worried due to my mother√¢¬Ä¬ôs health and age.  While returning from DFW and reaching DXB, they told my mother that she doesn√¢¬Ä¬ôt have wheelchair booked. Due to less passengers, upon asking for help, they agreed to provide her wheelchair but what if the flight was packed? Strike 3: I talked to customer service about their initial refusal to provide a wheelchair and they had no answer but √¢¬Ä¬úHer wheelchair is booked√¢¬Ä¬ù. So I asked customer service for the instructions that my mother should follow to get back to the airport from hotel and again the only answer to all my questions was √¢¬Ä¬úOur staff will be there to assist her everywhere√¢¬Ä¬ù. After her hotel stay, my mother was dropped at the road-side of the airport with nobody to help. She asked questions to the passing-by people and thank God she was able to find her way into the airport wheelchair counter. I genuinely liked Emirates but this is very disappointing and inconvenient especially given that mother is a senior citizen. I√¢¬Ä¬ôll never fly emirates again.

First of all, the ground staff at Karachi International Airport was so rude, requested a wheelchair for my wife as she is pregnant and due to some medical condition she is not allowed to walk too long causing Edema, though wheelchair was free the staff asked for money. when we arrived in Istanbul we have requested a wheelchair again and the staff told me to take your baby and handbags with you for the boarding and we will bring your wife later, she waited for a wheelchair for 30 minutes and when she saw the last call message on flight board she picked up stuff and walked for around over a kilometre to reach the boarding gate and when I complained about it they simply ignored it. In-flight entertainment was dated and they served cold food in a box that included a tiny pouch of water, kids juice, a cold bun with cheese and a small piece of dry cake. when I have asked why not serving hot food they said due to the covid 19 we are not serving hot food but you can sit next to other passengers, the plane was packed without following SOPs. Do not recommend anyone this airline.

Istanbul to London. My comment is really on the ground experience rather than the flight itself. There is no transport from the lounge to the gate for lesser abled people. All they offer is booking a wheelchair. How are you supposed to push somebody in a wheelchair while also carrying two handbags, a trolley and a guitar. Other airports/airlines have buggies at their disposal. Considering that some gates are 15 minutes walk, this is pretty poor. When flying from an apron gate (7xx e.g. 700), there are no business class buses for business class travelers and you're expected to stand in the bus for 20 minutes or so while it fills up until people step onto each others toes and everybody is squashed in. When questioning the ground staff on why there is no business class bus unlike like we were told at check-in, they said 'economics' and that business class buses are only available for incoming and domestic flights - very poor show. My overall rating of 6 explained: - on-board service & food: 8 - on-board cleanliness of toilets: 5 (floor's often wet) - lounge services & food: 8 - male lounge staff: 5 (often loud or shouting across the room) - female lounge staff: 9 - ground services (bus/transport): 0

Mumbai to Sydney via Singapore. I was travelling with my father in law and he was travelling outside India for the first time. I had requested for wheel chair assistance, but was hesitant about the extent of assistance provided and feasible. I was so pleasantly surprised to see that all my worries  were reduced to nothing with the extent of co-operation, understanding and courteousness displayed by the staff. Hereon, I will be suggesting Singapore Airlines to everybody who asks me. A big thank you to the flight crew and ground staff for SQ 423 and SQ211 on 18th and 19th of May. Keep up the good work guys.

Most staff are attentive and helpful except the cabin crew that I flew from Houston to Dubai, she refused to assist me with my luggage although she noticed I had some disability. My best experience was at KLIA Airport,  staff assist me, transport me with wheelchair until I complete all the screening process. He was professional, polite and caring, and patiently helped me until I was transfered to Quarantine Hotel. I was exhausted traveling almost 48 hours.

We had a flight from Tehran to Auckland via Dubai in January 2020. Due to the Ukrainian flight crash, our flight was rescheduled twice by Emirates, which means we had to have 20.5 hr of stop in Dubai. We called the airline office in Tehran to see our options of accommodation in Dubai. They said yes due to a stop longer than 13 hrs the airline must provide accommodation for you but they didn√¢¬Ä¬ôt have access to the hotel booking system and asked us to address this issue in emirates airline counter in Dubai airport. We arrived in Dubai and asked about the hotel booking option. Surprisingly they said we cannot have any accommodation provided by airline, and it is not their problem! We had arguments about the airline policy and they were refusing to show us the policy and just giving us some wrong information that it is in their policy and they cannot provide accommodation. After 2 hrs of discussion and argument, they finally provided a twin room for three people. We were really disappointed. I had a surgery on my neck about two weeks before the flight which and had to ask the cabin crew to open the head locker for me. I asked one of the crews for the first time, he opened the head locker for me and said √¢¬Ä¬údon√¢¬Ä¬ôt ask me again to do that for you, I√¢¬Ä¬ôve got back pain!√¢¬Ä¬ù. I won√¢¬Ä¬ôt fly with Emirates anymore.

Hong Kong to Singapore. A much older plane with very old 2-3-2 seating layout, it didn√¢¬Ä¬ôt help with my osteoarthritis and over an hour delay compounded the condition service was friendly, the entertainment system was good I watched a few classic episodes of Frasier, the food was tasty.

Philadelphia to Hyderabad  via Doha. I am a 70+ old lady with walking disability and was travelling alone from USA to India. Qatar Airways service was excellent and stayed at the airport during my break of journey. The service was excellent and a model for other airport hotels and airlines. This service is a great business model for old people travelling between India and USA. Special Thanks to Qatar Airways staff of QR 728 for calming me down and professionally accommodating me and understanding our situation. Kudos to the whole team for such an excellent performance.

Flew London to Tokyo. This is the first time that I am writing a review here but I had to write a review for ANA. I am a disabled person, with a hearing impairment and ANA offered me excellent support and assistance on the ground level and also on board the aircraft. Their Customer service was excellent, so kind, polite and very helpful. I flew Economy, I was a little worried as I am 5ft 10in and I know sometimes the seat space can be a challenge but I had nothing to worry about. I found the seats comfortable. The food served was delicious, I was really impressed with the food selection on offer. I can definitely recommend traveling with this Airline.

My daughter has travelled with Emirates a couple of times and had excellent experiences and hence recommended me to take Emirates to fly back to India from the US. I was travelling alone and my daughter had booked wheelchair assistance for my entire itinerary. I suffer from varicose veins and also had recently injured my knee, both added up causing unbearable pain. I was offered wheelchair assistance at DTW (Michigan) airport where I boarded the flight and my daughter went home relieved that I would be provided wheelchair assistance for the rest of my itinerary. However, I was left in the lurch when I arrived in Boston airport to board flight to Bangalore via Dubai. I had very little time left to board the flight and had to push myself to walk fast with the unbearable pain. This continued in Dubai airport as once again there was no wheelchair assistance provided in Dubai. I somehow managed this time as I had two hours twenty minutes to board the next flight. This left me wondering why I was promised wheelchair assistance if the airline was not able to provide the promised service. I was totally disappointed as to how a passenger could be left unattended to by a reputed airline in spite of the request for wheelchair assistance/help.

I had been hearing many favourable reviews of Qatar Airways so I took advantage of a great low fare (bit over $1k) and gave them a try, and was not disappointed for my flights from Washington Dulles to Singapore via Doha. Clean comfortable passenger cabins with some of the best leg-room and seat-room I've experienced in tourist class, plus decent food and drinks, and very friendly and responsive staff who really proved their mettle on the last of the four flights I took (Doha - Washington Dulles). It was a full flight with many elderly passengers (apparently travelling as a group), some two dozen of whom required wheelchairs, and departure was delayed somewhat, but through boarding and the flight itself the cabin crew proved more than equal to the challenge, with requests handled quickly (even a couple of toilet-roll-outage situations were remedied promptly once passengers made crew members aware of them) and a friendly, congenial air retained throughout. This is an airline much honoured for the quality of its inflight service, and on the four flights I took they were definitely on 5-star form.

Other than horrible seating for anyone with the slightest back problems or other problems which I might not be familiar with, the food is definitely not for most people√¢¬Ä¬ôs taste. I√¢¬Ä¬ôm not even going to elaborate on customer service. My luggage didn√¢¬Ä¬ôt make it to the flight. Why? Answer: √¢¬Ä¬úyou only had 1 hr and 15 mins before flights. This was my first time flying with Air France. I have another trip planned, which I hope to cancel. My delayed luggage was supposed to arrive 2 days later than my initial flight. (15th of August) it√¢¬Ä¬ôs now 17th of August and no trace of baggage. I called and emailed several times. This morning I√¢¬Ä¬ôve been told there√¢¬Ä¬ôs a car dropping off my suitcase at 1-2 pm. No action has been taken. They√¢¬Ä¬ôve stopped answering my calls and emails. It√¢¬Ä¬ôs the time of a global pandemic and us, travelers, have to quarantine. I was left in a cold room. You guessed it, not a hotel; not any other place I√¢¬Ä¬ôm familiar with. I have nothing. I don√¢¬Ä¬ôt have my medicine, warm clothes, a blanket, the necessities. I can√¢¬Ä¬ôt go out to buy stuff anymore. I filed a compensation form, too. They replied, asking for flight details and pictures, which I provided. It is now days later and I still don√¢¬Ä¬ôt have answers. Phone lines not picking up. Horrible customer service. The worst experience ever and I√¢¬Ä¬ôm not a stranger to flying different distances.

On a recent √¢¬Ä¬òround-trip√¢¬Ä¬ô experience, Denpasar - Budapest, I found myself in multiple disappointing (borderline traumatic) situations with Turkish Airlines. When checking in on my return flight in Budapest in May, 2018, I was told that my return ticket had been cancelled. As a result, I was forced to pay an additional $1,600 to purchase a new one-way ticket on the same flight. Below is a description of what had happened. In April, on the third leg of my flight from Denpasar to Budapest, I missed the flight in Istanbul due to confusion at the gate - poor communication and gate location (ie. heavy traffic surrounding this specific gate, the sitting area hosted multiple flights, unclear instructions and lack of announcements, etc). I had been sitting at the gate for an hour when they started boarding, but was only alerted when priority boarding started --- no more announcements or callouts were made thereafter. When the line began to peter out I started to get a bit concerned, but because there were still so many people sitting around me, which I had presumed they were waiting for the same plane, and no final announcements or staff had called out, I didn√¢¬Ä¬ôt move forward. However, at that time I did ask the people around me what flight they were waiting for, but they just shook their heads and said they did not speak English. At this point I was growing quite concerned and so I ran to the closest Turkish Airlines staff I could find, at a nearby counter. When I showed him my ticket, he began shouting (actually) at me and said that the gate was now closed and I had to go downstairs to the transfers desk. This was only a minute or two after the gate had been closed. I ran downstairs, showed them my ticket and asked what could be done. They said that I had to purchase a new ticket - no alternative was given. To do so, they ordered me to purchase a visa and exit through customs. When outside, I first rushed to ticketing at Turkish Airlines where an employee stated that I had to purchase a new ticket, but that he could not do anything for me and to go see the Turkish Airlines check-in desk. I then proceeded to the check-in desk at Turkish Airlines and they said that I had to purchase a new ticket. At no time I was told that this would render my return flight invalid, and no other information was given. I tried the help-phone for Turkish Airlines as well, but there was no dial tone and no-one was in the area to provide assistance. I finally had to purchase a one way ticket from Istanbul to Budapest for 200 Euros for a flight later that day. To add insult to injury, the Turkish Airlines staff was appalling - I was yelled at and belittled on numerous occasions. I've read other reviews and some have said that Turkish Airlines employees are inhumane, and to be honest, I agree - note: this is specific to the Istanbul Airport staff. My original ticket was over $1,400, and this whole ordeal has cost me an additional $2000. I reached out to Turkish Airlines and although they responded in a timely fashion, they were unhelpful and clearly had not read my story. Furthermore, the avenue of communication they use - feedback forms only, make it very difficult to communicate with them. I suppose that is what they want!

Managed my booking 48 hours before my departure. However, on my way to the airport, I checked my booking again just to be sure only to find out that my AKL-HKG flight will be delayed for 45 minutes so it meant that I will miss my quick connecting flight from HKG-MNL. They transferred me to the earliest next day flight. My AKL-HKG was delayed for 2 hours instead of just 45 mins. Food was great as usual. Cabin crews were cheerful and always ready to help. With Cathay, you can be assured that you will be well fed. I was given a free over night accommodation and free breakfast in Hong Kong Airport Hotel. The things that I didn't like with this flight were the unorganized boarding at Hong Kong Cathay's failure to notify me with the changes on my flight sched and disabled IFE on the economy class in HKG-MNL leg while the Business and PE classes can access them.

I had chosen my seat in advance so I would have a comfortable seat and leg room for the duration of my long flight. When I got to the airport to check in, they had screwed up my seat preference and assigned a regular seat for my first flight from Toronto to Istanbul. I was extremely upset, everyone boarded and they had me waiting, no one had any idea how or why my seat preference was changed. They knew I had paid extra but they didn√¢¬Ä¬ôt know why it was changed. They told me some how they had me listed as wheelchairs accessible person, which I am not and perfectly capable of doing anything on my own. They couldn√¢¬Ä¬ôt solve my problem and ended up taking a regular seat. Then in Istanbul again they had assigned my preferred seat to someone else due to overbooking. I was extremely upset and disappointed. Again I ended up leaving with a regular seat.  Not even once they apologized.

What a pity this well funded airline is so poorly managed. Food is very mediocre (chicken tikka masala with rice on both legs of my journey inbound and outbound!) and planes are tired. The food service comes on a night flight after 3 hours when people are asleep. Today I have been waiting for over 2.5 hours for luggage in Heathrow london. These glitches can happen but there is not a representative in sight. Customer service needs some retraining. Passenger in wheelchairs, kids all falling asleep on the halted conveyor belt, and still no help from Emirates.

Dubai to Houston. I have never experienced such a complete & total lack of professionalism, by any airline. Travelers can encounter a problem on any airline, but it is how an airline handles a problem that is most important. This experience on EK was a "case study in abject incompetence". The flight was boarded on time, but departure time came & went, & passengers were left sitting, with zero flight deck contact for almost 1.5 hours before the 1st contact by The Captain. There had been a problem with a smoke detector in the crew's sleeping cabin, but it would soon be fixed & we would be "on our way in about 15 minutes". Yet again, we sat with no update k for over another hour, by which time the flight was 2.5 hours late. The Captain then made a 2nd announcement that it had taken longer to fix the problem than anticipated, but we would "now depart in about 10-15 minutes". However, for a 3rd time, passengers were left sitting another 1+ hour with no flight deck contact. What kind of flight crew training does EK provide, where a Captain thinks it is OK to let passengers sit in silence on a flight delayed 3+ hours, yet make only 2 incorrect announcements? After sitting for 3.5 hours the Captain direct all passengers to collect their belongings & deplane. So 100's of passengers deplane, but those in 1st & Business Class on the upper deck had another surprise waiting. Neither the Captain, or the flight crew had alerted ground staff that upper deck passengers had been directed to deplane. As a result, all 1st & Business Class passengers were crammed at the end of the jetway in front of the 2nd floor elevators, with no place to go! Passengers could enter the elevators, but security had disabled the floor selection buttons after the plane had originally boarded. Passengers started to bang on the glass walls to try & get the attention of security staff who could be seen in the distance, but unable to hear through the heavy glass walls. Passengers finally returned to the plane to tell the "totally clueless" flight crew, there was no place to go & passengers were trapped in the small  2nd floor area. Security personnel finally noticed passengers banging on the wall & 1 unlocked a 5th floor door & came to the 2nd level via stairwell, since they also could not operate the elevators. This employee then directed all 1st & Business Class passengers to carry all their belongings up 6 flights to the 5th floor Business Class Lounge! What a fiasco of total incompetence. The flight ended up being 5.5 hours late, but once airborne, passengers quickly learned that even though the plane had sat at the gate for almost 6 hours, it had not been re-catered, so the flight was serving a "breakfast" menu, even though the flight departed at almost 4:00PM. No dinner would be served, but rather a light snack, since the menu was still for the "original" flight times. After flying for 25 years, I have never experienced a more incompetent flight operation. Not 1 EK employee mentioned any compensation, even though  passengers should have received some type of compensation!

Bodrum to Istanbul. While the ground staff at the Domestic IST CIP terminal are great in reserving front rows or exit seats for their premium Miles&Smiles members, unfortunately, the TGS ground staff in BJV are the opposite. When I asked politely if I could have a window seat towards the front of the cabin I was handed a boarding card with a seat in the last row with a grin. I then asked if I could do a last minute mileage upgrade. Was first told that it was no problem, then the counter agent contacted her supervisor/colleague which first said that there was availability and that she could process my request but then strangely asked for my name, I could hear the whole conversation over the radio. I guess unless you are a local VIP your commercial value is of little importance. Then suddenly a barrage of invalid excuses followed. First she suggested that my fare class did not allow a last minute upgrade, when I pointed out that was untrue, it was unavailabllity bucket class C, which is also untrue according to M&S rules, finally she said there was a problem with their system, a TGS classic, I was handed out a seat in 6A and did not pursue the matter any further as a line began to form behind me. Not that of a big problem for a 50 minute flight but having had worse problems before, I was reminded once more how TK's ground services and customer service attitude on the ground, bar TK Do&Co, is a total mess. The flights to BJV and to IST were excellent in the air. On time, friendly and attentive cabin crew and detailed flight deck announcements. I wish it was good on the ground as it is in the air.

Dreadful experience. Orly airport is unusable. Long connection transferred from CDG to Orly with heavy bags on packed bus. Got to Orly, have to wait three hours to check in, no free seats, sat on floor and Air France staff are rude to me. Ordered to sit in a disabled reserved seat. Have had some good experiences in the past but good memories with Air France are becoming a distant memory...

Turkish Airlines profited from my fathers death on their plane. My parents were travelling from Istanbul to Sydney with a stopover in Malaysia KL. For unknown (according to Thailand Doctors) reason my father died on the plane and the plane made an emergency landing in Phuket Thailand. They sent my dead father and mother to the hospital by ambulance even though he was dead for a couple of hours. We received one phone call by the hostess to say they were being taken to hospital and confirming my father had died already even though Turkish airlines have in their reports that he died in hospital. I'm guessing to avoid any responsibility. For the next several hours, every family member including grandkids were calling Phuket hospitals trying to find my mother. Imagine your 72 year old mother who has severe asthma, Crohn's disease and has had triple heart by-pass surgery stuck in a foreign country with high humidity with limited English. No thanks to Turkish airlines we tracked down my parents to a hospital ourselves. We are grateful for the Thai people whom were very nice to my mother. They police took her to the hotel across the road which was kind of them. However, my mother who had just lost her husband of nearly 55 years, in complete numbness and shock had to stay 3 nights in Thailand until a negative Covid test came back. That was the earliest I was able to get my mother out of there. Costs - Hotel & food about $300, Covid test $200, Compulsory Insurance during the brief stay $300. Now comes to my father, I received an invoice to the amount around $5,760 which around $2,500 was to go to Turkish Airlines fees to repatriate my father back to Turkey. We asked Turkish airlines to take some responsibility and at least waive their fees. They said no. So family members chipped in and paid the total bill. And even though Turkish airlines is profiting by $2,500, they have not apologised and accepted any responsibility in the way my mother was dumped and treated, not to mention keeping family members in the dark. Believe it or not they are still reviewing whether they get a refund for the unused tickets form KL to Sydney. Currently my father's repatriation flight was due to leave last night but was cancelled apparently due to "mechanical issues" so my fathers body is stuck in limbo unknown when next flight will be, even though we had made all the bookings on the receiving end. The costs keep growing and yet no apology from Turkish airlines still.

The Fayrouz has always been a favourite of ours and has maintained high standards changing to owners JAZ. WIFI is now FREE ( a little weak in rooms)  BTW this is still advertised as $15/day on your website. Grounds are immaculate - rooms are large, clean and comfortable, all with a roomy terrace- Restaurants are excellent - the beach is the best with choices of water sports, trips and wonderful snorkelling - the staff are friendly and can't do enough to help you. My walking is not good - the attention and help I received was excellent I struggled a little with the slippy floor in the bathroom - there are no support handles near the bath.    Getting about the staff helped me on occasion with a wheelchair - however they were quite old and worn, very uncomfortable. I would definitely upgrade these items.  I wish I could have had my favourite room as requested but was unavailable due to renovations scheduled

Location was a little hard to get to. Had to drive 2 blocks & turn around as there is an island on Union. Room was good sized & decently lit. Large bathroom. Had a handicap accessible room & expected a walk in shower, as depicted, but had to contend with a tub. Was a problem due to recent knee surgery, which was why requested handicap room.

A great stay in a perfect location with everything within walking distance! The walk from the train station to the apartment was only about 10 mins. Upon arrival, just had to press the button for reception which I was let into the building and check in through the monitor (there's no one there but check in is straightforward - have your QR code ready).    Entering the apartment was a surprise as everything was clean and well equipped! You have Cowshed products everywhere and even small things which a woman always has to pack like cotton pads and buds.  Tesco and Sainsbury's is literally below or across the way so getting supplies was super easy.  Staff were super helpful as we didn't know the extractor fan for cooking slides out haha. They were quick to respond and helped us out.  Definitely a great and comfortable stay for a weekend in Bath. There is no lift in the building so for those who have mobility issues, this would be a problem.  I would enquire with Hiding Space on which of their other buildings would be best to stay in.  Someone in another post did mention the early morning noise from Tesco as they bring their stock in, so it can disturb the morning sleep which didn't bother me and my partner so much as we just closed the window and it was less noisy.   I wish there was a small cabinet of drawers to place clothes in temporarily as there was only hangers.

Wonderful location. Easy off and on the highway. Quiet location. Lots of restaurants and stores nearby.. Amazing HOT breakfast with many choices. The bed is comfortable, and sheets are very nice . Great valve for the money.. We got handicap bathroom
The location was great  good breakfast each day The couch bed was a little uncomfortable, but the kitchenette was very useful. Good bathroom facilities for our disabled companion.

The staff was really nice, they tried to make us as comfortable as possible and were very friendly. Also the room had a great size, it was cleaned everyday and the location of the hotel couldn‚Äôt be more perfect. Is literally next to the main attractions in Seville and has lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel overall is really great, but the only thing that might be an issue is that we got an accessible room cause I drive a mobility scooter and at the entrance of the lobby, there was a few steps. There is an  accessible platform, but it‚Äôs old and kinda tricky to use. I can walk a few steps and my friend helped me lifting the scooter so it wasn‚Äôt a huge problem but if you have more severing mobility issues it might be something to consider before booking your stay. But overwall everything was really good and the staff was always really friendly and helpful, I would definitely stayed there again.

Very pleased with the accommodation, the cabins were comfortable and well equipped. Breakfast was very good. and served in a large room with large picture windows overlooking the garden and country views in the distance. Parking was offsite, which could be a problem if you had a disability.
Very good access for the wheelchair The room was very clean beds very comfortable

The staff was helpful and super accommodating. They provided a wheel chair to assist my disabled, 86 year-old sister in getting around town, and they relocated me to a different room when my TV wouldn't work. The fried eggs and bacon breakfast on the second day was not very appetizing.

Courteous staff, wine & cheese evening buffet, warm cookies & milk at night, great breakfast, historic decor & warm atmosphere. Difficulty entering with luggage due to multi brick steps.Consider ramp.  Hotel has joiner heat which made room chilly in winter.

The room had an amazing view of the sunrise (we checked in late and missed the sunset), the breakfast buffet was also good. My mother uses a wheelchair and the staffs were very accommodating despite us not being able to book an accessible room. ‚ùóÔ∏èDO NOT ORDER ROOM SERVICE‚ùóÔ∏è, despite saying they will 'take into account' the feedbacks here, it did not improve one bit. It took 2 hours for the food to arrive and it was cold. After 1 hour, tried calling them to ask where the food was and room service kept purposely not pick up the phone. The time they actually did, said the food was otw but only arrived 40minutes after. Steak became too gummy, especially the fatty side, to become edible. Just eat out, or order food panda as there're a lot of places to eat nearby. Ps. Got flies but it's at sea so make sense, and it wasn't to the point of too much. Only some flies, make sure don't open door too long.

It‚Äôs a beautiful old hotel with lovely paintings and furniture. The staff helped us with questions and there was a wheel chair that I was able to borrow. Excellent breakfast buffet. Our room was large and had balconies, but it had no decoration-no paintings and the furniture was plain, and a little worn.

Clean, spacious, excellent kitchen facilities. Compares very favourably with higher-rated accommodation. Walking distance CBD. The entrance steps to villas are too high. would be difficult for disabled and elderly.

We loved absolutely everything about this place. The hospitality, the cleanliness, the location, the beds, the size of rooms, the breakfast, the view, Lana and Anna. Two of the girls working there...  want them as life long friends. Beautiful, helpful, kind people. Everything. They have a roof to terrace. Great spot, great view. The location is just outside of Old Quarter, in a local neighbourhood. Make sure you take time to wander the streets near the hotel. It's also close to the river. Perfect location.   The location is just off a highway. I was worried when we pulled up. Be reminded that Vietnam is busy, there's a lot of people there. There will be some residual background noise, but you'll get that wherever you sleep in Vietnam. Still book this hotel. The only strange thing about our room - it had a tub and it was really high off the ground - "difficult" to get in and out of. It was slippery, we had to lay a towel down, and there was no curtain or door, so water went everywhere. That's it. If you have mobility issues - make sure you get a room without a tub (assuming all the tub layouts are the same).

Lovely hotel with a very nice bar and restaurant overlooking the ocean and city. Great location near bars, galleries and restaurants. Would recommend to stay there as i would also return any time Nothing negative to say abou the stay. Was not a problem for us personally but for people who have  trouble walking/ mobility issues  i would not recommend the hotel as you need to be able to climb stairs

The location was very close to the train station and only a 10 minute walk to the centre of the city.   From the train station turn left and cross the road head for the Grand Hotel entrance and pass through to Toft Green then turn right - the hotel is about 20 yards away.  There are a few steps down from the street to the entrance and also a ramp , which we used.  Lifts to all floors.  Breakfast was excellent with hot bacon, sausage, hash browns, beans, grilled tomato and egg....(only scrambled).   Toast, croissants and bagels etc and all cereals, fruit, yoghurt etc. but we only had hot breakfast and pastries.    Our room was excellent with really good air conditioning, tea and coffee making facilities and all that was necessary including a safe.  Spotlessly clean and the twin beds were really comfy.  The bathroom was well laid out with good complementary toiletries and an excellent height adjustable walk in shower.  Hot water was available at all hours.    We slept well and didn't hear any noise.    We loved the large wide full length mirror at the hall area of the room and the one over the desk was also a very good size.  The wardrobe chad plenty of normal wooden coat hangers and there was also an iron and ironing board (we didn't use this!) and a hairdryer - I used my own.     We arrived early at 1.30pm but we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel until 3pm check in.  We returned after 4pm to find reception very busy and there was a bit of a mix up with our room; however, Caitlin dealt with this admirably and professionally and we were happily in our room within ten minutes.  On leaving we also were able to leave our luggage after checking out as our train wasn't for another 5 hours.  All staff were friendly, helpful and kind. The power point for use of hair appliances at the desk was very close to the kettle which was a little tricky and maybe not too safe as the appliance cord somtimes touched the kettle.    A coat hook or two on the wall near the door would be helpful for hanging outdoor clothing, hat etc. especially if the weather was bad!

The beds were comfortable.  The towels and garbage were emptied every day. The parking lot was small.  It was hard to park.  The back door, you had to use a card to get in.  In theory, it is a good idea, but even the counter person said not all the cards worked.  The room for a handicap accessible was small.  On checked out, we could not get a receipt..  He said that because we went through Booking.com, he could not get us one.  Every other hotel has given one.

lovely and central.   car park magic    get a bus to anywhere just across the road  in Union Square. it would be handy for people with a disability to enter in the back from car park.   but it just as easy taking your car to the front to let passenger off

disabled access .shower with extra length carer spray and free standing seat so could position as required..not to much wayer egress. helpful  courteous pleasant helpful staff .comfortable bed and furnishings .immaculately clean .beautiful evening meal and nice breakfast .room was lovely the main access ramp is steep and wooden  but .staff happy to help if needed and although it wasn't a problem for us maybe for others

We were given a free room upgrade to an Accessible room. It was enormous and very comfortable. Thank you.  The location for visiting the attractions of Chicago was great. Loved it. The adjoining Noodle Bar opened and closed at will. There was no rhyme or reason to their opening hours. We called in to ask the opening times, after finding it closed the evening before, to be assured that they would be open, Great! That is until we called and were told that we couldn't dine in because that part was closed. Really???  While La Quinta are not responsible for Noodles and Company, at least I don't think they are, the adjoining door to the hotel does seem to imply some sort of affiliation, rightly or wrongly. Not sure what can be done about this.

The original room was in a bad location for me to get back & forth the restaurant & pool due to handicap and the staff patiently accommodated me and got me to a room that was perfect which this made my experience although short but rememberable in a positive way and made everything else while I was there nicer from my pov. N/A

THE ONLY SETBACK WAS TO GET BREAKFAST ESPECIALLY MAMAK, MOST OF THE SHOPS SERVES CHINESE FOOD.   OTHERWISE THE REST ARE ALRIGHT, AS THE AMENITIES ARE NEARBY. WILL DEFINITELY STAY AT THIS PLACE AGAIN. MY WIFE HAD TO USE THE WHEELCHAIR TO GET TO THE UNIT, UNFORTUNATELY THE DOOR ON THE GROUNDFLOOR HEADING TO THE ELEVATOR WAS TOO SMALL FOR HER TO GET THROUGH. HOPEFULLY THE DOOR CAN BE OPENED BOTH SIDES TO ACCESS.

The accommodation was a lovely place!  Central, two minute walk to the main bus stops and the beach!  5 minutes to the Old Town!  Lovely place, with good facilities too and right in the main shopping area and near a good supermarket It is on the 3rd floor with no lift but it isn‚Äôt a difficult walk. You should just know in case you have mobility issues

The staff were absolutely beautiful, great vibe all round and the adjoining cafe/bar is a gorgeous sanctuary located perfectly for accessibility to transport and Bris hot spots. The only downfall is it is not accessible for our wheelchair community members.

Hotspring inside the room was good, water fills up fast and is hot. Location is alright, lots of food around the area. Toilet door cannot be locked, curtains are placed outside the toilet which kids can open if they are playing outside while someone is showering inside. Design overall is not very young children or wheelchair friendly

We loved our family stay at Cae Cwnws. It was a wonderful base from which to explore the local area and a lovely homely and cosy bolt-hole for us to return to at the end of the day. We enjoyed cooking in the well equipped kitchen, chilling in the snug lounge with the fire going and playing games at the kitchen table. The beds were really comfy too so we all slept really well. Mum, who has limited mobility, was pleased to have everything she needed in the downstairs bedroom.  Daughter was delighted to have horses as our neighbours. We were all sad to leave and would certainly return next time we're holidaying in the area. Thanks for providing such a great holiday home, Owen! Nothing really. Mum only commented that she would have appreciated a handrail for the steps from the conservatory to the front door area due to her mobility but she used the wall for support and it really wasn't a big problem. Just worth considering if any of your party struggles with steps.

Booked an accessible room, which was great. Size was good for a standard room, bed comfortable. Bathroom catered well for accessible needs,  The addition of 2 welcome drinks in the bar was a nice surprise.   Perfectly located on Eton High street and a short stroll to busier Windsor [should you want to go)   Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast room was up a very large step. This would be impossible for a wheelchair and was very difficult for my mum (on crutches).

Best breakfast we had during our trip to the UK. The breakfast dishes can be ordered from a menu and are prepared to ones liking. The staff is very friendly. Bude beach is walkable distance from the hotel and one can have dinner at the pub in the hotel which serves great food but needs reservation. The room was wheelchair accessible, but the shower difficult to use.

Located close to Las Ramblas, Bario Gotti and Eixample. Staff was great. Good places to eat nearby and several convenience stores for snacks. Room was very clean with updated accessible bathroom. Elevator is tiny so we had to go up individually. Buffet breakfast was varied and good. Loved that this is an older hotel (1951) with painted ceilings and antiques which we prefer to a chain hotel. Taxis were easy to call and arrived within minutes. Nothing really.

Very large bedroom with air conditioning. Modern facilities. The housekeeper was very accommodating although there was a language barrier (particularly when it comes to money) as he doesn't speak English so we spoke via Google translate. They did my laundry on request. Muhamad and his sons own the hotel and Muhamad was very welcoming, he knocked on my door on the morning after my arrival and took me on a full day private tour of Egypt at an additional cost of $250 USD (not including tips). A simple continental breakfast is provided at a time you request (bread, cheese, ham, a boiled egg). Nice balcony view of the garden. Very peaceful place as it's in a private compound away from the streets. It is not a hotel but rather a guarded compound whereby you stay in a house with other guests and a housekeeper and you get your own private bedroom and ensuite which is lockable (the rest of the house is shared living space). There is no reception and the housekeeper takes photos of your passport on his phone (for security purposes) on arrival, which gets sent to all of the hotel owners' phones (not an overly secure form of storing people's information). From a cleanliness point of view I could see other people's hairs in the bed linen and the fridge had small spots of mould so I didn't use it. The shower is in a tall bath with no shower screen, so water floods the tiles and it is quite slippery (would be dangerous for people with mobility issues). Need to catch taxi's/private transport to get anywhere as the inn is in a more secluded area of Egypt away from the city and it is a 1 hour drive to the airport. No swimming pool. If you want to be left alone to do your own thing then this is probably not the place for you as Muhamad and the housekeeper will knock on your door regularly to ask you what you want to do/where you want to go/what you need.

friendly staff, comfortable facilities especially the restaurant bar. I was not warned about all the stairs to get to room, and especially the stairs within the room to reach the bathroom. I have arthritis and found this difficult even though I am not disabled.

Fantastic location with access to central Lisbon and just a short walk from a metro station. Room was great (good shower and air conditioning) and very clean. Nothing other than to warn future customers with mobility issues that there are a LOT of steps from the main square to reach the property. There is a lift at the property.

Great Location, clean and spacious room  . The property didnt have a lift, so we had to tow our luggage to our room, which was on the second floor & there were more rooms above... So it is certainly not suited for seniors or invalid. There was a digital lock which was cumbersome to use, and there was no one around to assist with opening. we got locked out because of no internet late one night and had to make international call to get help .

They food was delicious and reasonably priced, their facilities were a little more than expected the big lovely pool for example. Staff was very kind and helpful especially when we had challenges. We were checked into the 1st floor and they didn't have an elevator but in order to get to 1st flopr there is two flights if stairs. My husband had a disability so that was terrible. However the receptionist who checked us in organised for someone to take our luggage to our room.
Location on hillside a little difficult for disabled but otherwise excellent location. Better if no bike races or street closures
it was so modern and just felt comfortable. it was enough to be in a good location where we needed to go not being able to get in from the ramp

Great location and beach view.  Spacious. Bed was so hard I had to sleep on couch, which was just a little bit better.  Shower door would not latch.  Sink needs nice vanity.  Large bathroom with no place for toiletries. Light floods room all night through Lhasa unneeded windows.  Need grab bar near toilet. Plenty of room for privacy wall, too.
It was clean and comfortable room. I did not like climbing stairs as I have had recent surgeries.

The hotel was excellently located for getting around by foot.  In the heart of it all.  The room was clean and had everything we needed.  Modern and spots out front to unload luggage before heading off to park my vehicle. We were travelling with someone using a wheelchair.  We had to use a side entrance that was locked, so had to get let in each time we went out in the evening.  It is central, which means it comes with a lot of outside noise.  Great singers and live music in the street...but if you are an early to bed person, just bring earplugs.  It is also a Tourist Centre in the daytime, so lots of people around.
I really like the location. So close to the water and the property also had pool open in the end of october There was no ramp for a heavier luggage to push to the smaller building

location, clean, complimentary breakfast I requested a walk in shower which we got however it was no use the room 114 was said to be for disabled but it was not. only thing was it was on the ground floor. the room has two doors before you open your room door it‚Äôs so awkward to negotiate with a wheelchair. it would be beneficial if they put in a wet room floor, with handrails and a seat. the room was very small. there are steps into the hotel non negotiable with a wheelchair however the staff always helped with a ramp.
Breakfast not the best stall bread, tiny plate of fruit, only full cream milk. Bed was horrible not good for people with back problems
Friendly helpful staff. Clean and comfortable accommodation. Not a dislike but some of the doorways a struggle for a wheelchair user

Good location in city centre with all main tourist sites within walking distance (I am 78 and have some arthritis!). We stayed 5 nights and the room was a bit tight - a smaller bed would have created more space. Excellent cleaner, good breakfast selection, pleasant staff. We chose the hotel for the roof pool knowing that we can only manage sightsseeing for the mornings (1000 - 1400) and could relax outdoors in the afternoon. This worked well though the "pool" is a large plunge bath and swimming impossible. There was only room for 3 couples to lie on loungers in the shade.

Mark the owner had everything covered, on arrival he made sure there was a parking space sorted. The room well wow!. Very clean and all the little extras like fridge,iron,kettle and sundries. The shower was fab,one you can actually move around in. Shower gell and air freshener. Plenty of loo roll. Mark also made sure the room was replenished daily and the towels smelt amazing!..Also the room had plenty of electric sockets and a big TV. Me and my autistic daughter will certainly be returning. There was only one but this wasn't really a pain but there's no lift facility if you're not very good with steps.

looks beautiful and luxurious   We had an enormous bed which was not 2 singles pushed together. rooms were clean and bathroom quite high spec. no toilets around pool. had to walk up to reception or along a back wall down 2 lots of steps and back on ourselves inside the hotel to get to loos. lifts were available for disabled and ramps however it would take an age for anyone in a wheelchair ti get to the loos. This was my main complaint. I am fit and healthy and it really bugged me.

The room was spacious and good having a ground floor room with only one door to go thru with having someone with me who is a wheelchair user ,thanks to calum that worked in the restaurant for going above and beyond to make something for my disabled daughter to eat that wasn't on the menu I thank him for that üòä That the bed cover had a dirty mark on it and the bathroom smelt moldy, that the restaurant never had any weetabix or flavoured yougurt for the younger visitors

Great as long as you don't have a car or mobility issues. Calling this a hotel is an exaggeration - it's a collection of very nice, clean rental rooms spread over four buildings in a pedestrian only area of the old town. it's a beautiful location IF you can walk and don't have a car or don't mind hauling luggage from a public parking garage several blocks and up flights of stairs. It's very close to the castle and the rooms were charming and clean. So a good value as long as you're mobile, don't have to deal with a car and don't need info, or a place to store luggage before or after checkout. Perfect for backpackers traveling by train. As a family with a car, luggage and sciatica, it was not ideal. There was a coffee machine, electric kettle and a miniature refrigerator in the room. that was nice. Lots of little restaurants and bars nearby, including in the ground floor of the building we were in. Surprisingly though, we couldn't hear it, so that was good too. You get the key behind the counter at a restaurant. On the reservation it says "check in at 3 pm." that's because there's literally nowhere to check into before 3. Everything is locked and empty. There is no concierge to ask questions, nowhere to leave luggage, no usual "hotel" type amenities. Parking is in the public city lots which range from 1 block to 6 blocks away depending on which building you're in, and which can be expensive. Also, you're not guaranteed a spot. We got one in the lot by the cable car, but on busy days you might not. You technically, legally, cannot even drive up to some of the buildings to drop off passengers or luggage, so just be sure you can walk. Also, the bed was extremely soft. Which I hate, but isn't necessarily bad for everyone.

It is so grand and beautiful grounds.  Very near the town.  Booked a small room but it was a good size.  It was so nice sat outside overlooking the grounds with a nice drink from the bar. Very quiet in the room I phoned the hotel to ask for am  upgrade to a particular room. The guy promised to ring  back with any update. Otherwise, he would give me the room I requested.   He didn't ring but  when we arrived the hotel didn't do the change. And by then other rooms weren't available.  Sadly, our allocated  room was as far away from the lift as it was possible to get, and several steps without handrails.  I struggled  physically . but not the fault of the hotel as I hadn't mentioned disability because I thought we were in the requested room.   Access to electic sockets was really difficult   having said that I would go again but discuss mobility problems with the hotel before.

The hotel was wheelchair accessible. The room and bathroom had much space and were clean The toilet was to low tot get up and off from a wheelchair. The carpet was heavy to ride on with a wheelchair.   It was very busy at breakfast time. Whe had tot wait in line.

Wonderful decor. Not your modern European style.  Lovely views of sea (if you get an ocean  view room) and rainforest. Staff were top class.  So friendly and helpful.  The waterfall at the swimming pool so good as were sauna and jacuzzi.  The jets on the latter gave a wonderful massage.  Food was good and of generous size and inexpensive by resort standards. On site massage excellent and reasonably priced.  I got the feeling that the hotel is more interested in providing good value for the consumer than profit for itself.  Really enjoyed our four days here. I hate to make a negative comment because this hotel really is lovely but will do so to help those reading this.  Only two tea bags per day.  But they provided more when we asked.  It's a very steep climb up from the beach which you would have to factor in according to your fitness levels.  A twice daily shuttle is available however.   Mattress is of typical Asian hardness which didn't suit my back issues.
The room was quiet. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was excellent. Climbing two flights of stairs with an arthritic hip.

My husband is disabled and the accessible room was on the first floor near to the entrance.  Bathroom was spacious has he uses a wheelchair chair and hand grip near toilet,sink,and bath. The only thing we were disappointed with which didn't affect our stay was the the bathroom bin hadn't been emptied,it was full for tampons and wet wipes.  I reported this to the reception on leaving and she apologized,she was lovely.

Location.  Good room for me as being semi disabled.  But - no bars, grab handles, or any other aids.  Putting a ramp from the carp park to  the level of the rooms isn't enough! The receptionist on arrival was brilliant.  The one when we left clearly either didn't like English people, or didn't want to be there! There are no longer tea/coffee facilities in the room.  The place needs redecorating.  Only one pillow each?  Standards have dropped dramatically of the ten years we have been using it.

The owners couldn't be nicer! . The location is a little bit away from the main town and shops. We were given a lift to the nearest market to do a grocery shop on the first day which was very helpful. Milk, bread and fruit were left out for us in the apartment. Boris also kindly dropped us to the ferry on our last day as it was raining quite heavily. We loved our stay here and would definitely book again Might not suit people with mobility issues.

The location was wonderful. The staff couldn‚Äôt go out of their way enough. So very helpful In all Aspects. The buffet breakfast was the best we‚Äôve ever had in a hotel. There wasn‚Äôt a thing missing. We were in a handicapped room. Really needed to be bigger to Get a mobility scooter in and out easily. The hallway was too narrow. The fire door would get in the way of getting in and out. There were no shelves in the bathroom. Plenty of grab bars. Excellent shower but you had to bring your cosmetics etc in and out since there were no shelves.  I would have liked to have a small Snack section where you could buy a snack if you didn‚Äôt want to go out as there was nothing really close by. The steakhouse is expensive and the restaurant next door closes very early.
Breakfast room.  The lovely decoratuions and Preston's help in getting our luggage upstairs. Needed AN ELEVATOR for the elderly, and handicap height toilets.

The welcome, an upgrade to sea view lodge as due to disability we'd booked a 2 beds lodge.   It was superb, very clean, spacious and staff so nice, friendly and helpful.  We had some necessities left in basket to settle in well, bread, milk, juice, butter & jams with selection of normal tea & coffee.    Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was excellent, plentiful, hot and with array of choices.  The surroundings in beautiful gardens was quiet & peaceful, early morning saw pheasants strolling around the lodge garden.    Due to our own issues we didn't use the pool or spa facilities how I wish we could have, it looked very inviting.   We will be hopefully rebooking a stay in same lodge for the Spring.    Thank you to all staff who made our stay a very pleasant one. üòä Nothing, everything was to our satisfaction from start to finish with help from an abundance of well trained staff
Everything , meal was good, rooms lovely. Highlight though were the staff especially receptionist who was really helpful and friendly and brilliant with our disabled family member Nothing

The entire staff was excellent, welcoming and polite, and very helpful! The room was comfortable, and the location is very good in terms of East London & Shoreditch. 1. You very much feel it's a very big hotel - the hallways feel a bit like holiday-inn and I got lost all the time.  2. The room had no window really, a tiny one only, that doesn't open, which is weird. There was another one that had milk-shade glass, so there was light but it didn't help with the feeling of lack of a window.  3. when I checked in I initially got a wheelchair-accessible room, including an accessible toilet and shower. it's great that you have them and I was very impressed - I don't think I should get such a room without it being ok-ed with me (it felt like a hospital room, which is a different discussion on design for accessibility). However, they did change my room on the spot with no problem.

I like that it's close to the onomochi port and right by the shopping arcade. Host was friendly and helpful. Able to drop off luggage before check in time. Traditional Japan house means very narrow and tight stairways. might not be suitable for people with mobility issues. Only one washroom and one bathroom for the entire guest house.

Friendly staff on reception.   Room was reasonable size for Central London  Very well connected with public transport and much of the centre was within walking distance  Private bathroom included in the price. Room was small for a couple bur then it is London!  Ditto for the bathroom  Staircase very narrow and winding would make it difficult for those with mobility issues.

My mum is 93 and uses a Rollator.  Room No 6 was perfect for her as it is on the Ground Level and although compact there was enough room to move around in. Easy access to Restaurant & Bar facilities on the same level.  If you want a walk in shower though this is not the room for you as the shower is over the bath but we did not have that requirement so that was fine.  Water pressure was great.  Small table and chairs outside room perfect for morning coffee and biscuits from coffee making facilities in the room. Room was also very quiet.  Wi-Fi excellent which was important for me as I had a Zoom webinar to attend whilst there. Food was excellent pub food and we ate there every night during our 3 night stay.  NB you need to order your food by 8pm.  All staff brilliant, welcoming and very hard working despite having a well earned day off at the Ripon races. Blackout linings would have been a good idea as room got very light in morning.  Take an eye mask if this concerns you.

Breakfast was fair but not enough. Elevators NOT working at all!  I booked a room for my disabled brother and I.  They didn't have availability and gave us a room downstairs.  Awful coffee and service.

It does not include breakfast but does provide facilities including refrigerator, kettle and nespresso machine.  The general decor was impressively stylish and the range of interesting books is amazing. Considerable thought and care has gone into the apartment's design. Three flights of stairs (becasuse of personal disabilities) - will be my first choice next time but will book early to see if I can get the lower room.

Nice clean comfortable hotel nice position friendly staff, car parking on ground floor but extra charge, nice comfortable bed really comfortable pillows Narrow spaces for car parking and disabled facilities really Narrow not enough space to use wheelchair walking aid

Location of the hotel is right in the center, convenient to get around.  Breakfast choices are good and sufficient.  Staffs at breakfast room are gentle.  We also like the hotel lobby. We had the suite in another building.  To get to that building , there are stairs ( 3 rather high steps). And to get into our suite, we need to climb another stair with 3 high steps again.  We enjoyed the room but wish there were ramp instead of stairs.

It was ideal for a couple of night's stay visiting my daughter in Liverpool, close to everything. I loved that there were tea making facilities in the room. The reception staff were really lovely and welcoming and it was surprisingly quiet! Only a minor thing, but I did struggle with the mattress a little, but that's likely to be a me thing as I have disabilities that mean I need a supportive mattress. But honestly, value for money, it's a minor mention.
Very close to the main tourist attractions of the city. The apartment Bouchers 61 is lovely! Personally, I was not very happy with the bed because I have back problems.

Buffet breakfast is good  and at a reasonable price, staff are v welcoming, always clean towels in the room. , location is good with public transport few yards away, easy to hail a taxi, the maid was warm, efficient and friendly. The only problem for us was that there is NO walk-in shower, the rain shower itself was great but have to climb into bath first, which was extremely difficult and dangerous for us.   DO NOT recommend for disabled people
Breakfast and location was excellent Had a disabled badge holder with us and couldn't get parked on disabled bay because of none badge holders parking in them

Everything it was a wonderful stay.. We are from here and my daughter who is autistic loves to stay in motels and swimming, so that is what she wanted for Christmas üéÑ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm so glad we picked here!!!!! Staff wonderful and it was clean‚Ä¶ We even got a stocking Christmas morning‚Ä¶ The pool was great and warm besides some rude guests I would stay again!!!!! The pool area with the random rude people and people just dropping their kids off.

Location was great. Check in was easy. Staff friendly Food on floor in room. Bathroom was cold. Only had 2 towels in room trash was never taken out of room in 4 days I stayed there  parking stinks. Trucks with trailers taking 2 spots in front. Non handicapped parking in handicapped spots

Good location and price. Elevator down when arrived. Had handicap people in my group. Pool closed, had to use pool next door. Had problems with people next door drinking and making false accusations that got a handicapped family member removed from pool. Phone number to the hotel provided by booking. Com didn‚Äôt work or no one would answer it.
Friendly, helpful staff. Beach across the road,  restaurants that were nearby, public transport outside hotel. Room was really spacious. Lack of ramp leading to reception.

The room was super clean, big & spacious, bathrooms are modern & neat. We had a beautiful view of the garden from our balcony to wake up to. The most we loved about this property was the service. 11/10. The receptionist was super sweet, kind and polite. He was a ray of sunshine, always there to help and made our stay comfortable as possible. The breakfast was perfect, we had pancakes, string hoppers, coconut roti, English breakfast & milk rice and all of them tasted excellent. The table set for the meals were so classy and simple, the atmosphere is just lovely and warm. The lobby of our bedroom was so peaceful, we had tea and read there in the evening with their fairy lights. the garden is so well maintained and beautiful. And their hot chocolate is just WOW. So affordable and high quality. I loved this stay and the next time we come to nuwara eliya, we‚Äôre staying here again. The ratings arent high for no reason. If you are disabled or have back/ leg issues then you might have to think before choosing here to stay because there‚Äôs no elevator and you can only access the stairs, it‚Äôs small steps and lot to walk which I didn‚Äôt mind because i loved burning calories so I enjoyed it.  But if you don‚Äôt enjoy walking or tiring then think twice.

We stayed for five nights at Ponte Boutique and it was a perfect stay for this length of time. Staff were very warm and welcoming, happy to assist with anything we needed üòÅ  - bed was comfortable and the room was very clean and tidy  - kitchenette was handy to have, whilst it didn‚Äôt come equipped with cooking utensils, staff were happy to provide whatever we required when requested eg. Pans, cutlery, plates and pot  - hiring a scooter directly from the property was an easy and affordable process, 150k per day  - They were kind enough to cover the cost of our laundry as we stayed for five nights, which was lovely!  - great location close to the beach   Highly recommend!!! N/A

Plaka‚Äôs Heart is located in a perfect position to explore Athens not only for cultural but also for the food Greece has to offer. The accommodation is located on the third floor easily accessible by a lift & to an upstairs common roof top, which could use an upgrade of furniture. The fridge was laden with some goodies, which was appreciated. Nothing

Excellent breakfast Comfortable room (though cold) Great location Friendly staff Cleanliness Koukash retaurant food very poor (had to send food back as it was inedible). Range of drinks available was shockingly bad. Only 1 draft beer and no brandy (we went next door to the Sir Thomas which had an excellent bar!).  Our request for a walk in shower (because of mobility issues) was met however, we had to negotiate too many stairs to get to our room (room 619). No maps of city available in reception. Tourist information literature was non existant.
Staff were great, scooter hire great & comfortable rooms with great pool Nothing

A wonderful resort, surrounded by nature, trees, flowers. Just a few minutes walk to a very nice beach. Hotel restaurant on the sea shore, very tasty food, a large selection. The hotel room was clean and tidy. Hotel location. It's quite a drive to the city center of the island. It is necessary to rent a scooter, without it, it is like having no hands on the island. Since Tuk Tuk doesn't run, you won't be able to call anyone with GRAB either. Another minus is that one of the employees at the registration hardly speaks English, it was difficult to communicate, but her other colleague knew English very well.

Check in was smooth and I was upgraded from standard room to executive room, the room was a good size, clean and comfortable. Except the bathroom lights all room lights were controlled together so could not use the bed side lights independent of the overhead lights which meant I couldn't carry on reading when my daughter wanted to go to sleep.  It is quite expensive for one night at ¬£170 for a standard room.  Both times I have stayed recently 1 of the three lifts was broken.

Very handy location- though not in the heart of the CBD it is right near the QV market and easy to access via tram etc. The parking- was truly challenging to get a car down the ramp- a sedan barely fit.

Yogi (staff member) was exceptional. The location was great as you can get to sun sets spots on the west of the island and go further west. It‚Äôs a short scooter ride to the main harbour. Amazing breakfast with fresh juices It could do with a bathroom cabinet

Great room, very clean and nice bathroom. also had hot shower with decent water pressure. can rent scooters from the property. the host is very nice and makes a great breakfast every morning. also very helpful at organising transport. would definitely stay here again if in Kuta Lombok wifi was a little bit dodgy but data works
The room was very clean and comfortable, the owner is very friendly. From the harbour is about 2km by scooter and was easy to find. Highly recommended! All was perfect üòÄ

clean room, nice bath, wifi good staff at reception very rude, both toilets were out of order and she refused to let us use the disabled toilet! it‚Äôs advertised there‚Äôs bike rental but when we asked they said they don‚Äôt do it. very unhelpful about anything we asked.  had drunk people knocking on our door 2 nights in a row.  there‚Äôs electric blinds for the window that just go up and down on their own waking us up numerous times in the night from the noise of them.

Location  Room - Air conditioning, Comfortable bed, Seating in room, Efficient blind on window kept light out, TV size  Bathroom - Hot water readily available, Large shower tray shower easily worked, Clean soft towels daily if required  Breakfast - Good choice to eat Shower tray relatively smooth - elderly may require non slip mat (might be available did not enquire)
The location was Excellent and the breakfast Was very good. The room extremely small and the bathroom was for disabled people.

We loved our stay here. It is located in the middle of the rice fields, so it‚Äôs very quit, but only 10 minutes scooter ride (it‚Äôs only possible to reach the villa by scooter) from the Ubud city centre. The stuff is very friendly. Highly recommend this place :) The street which leads to the villa is very narrow so it is not the most comfortable way (only reachable by scooter). The breakfast selection is not very good, maybe not the best breakfast we had in Bali (we ordered a floating breakfast there) but it was still nice.

I had the best time there. The hostel is a 5-min walk from the pier and they recommended me a scooter driver (since I can't drive lol) & it was the best way to get to the places I wanted to visit (thousand islands viewpoint, Kelingking beach, and diamond beach). My only complaint is that they have some plastic-y mattress cover that's quite loud when you move. I still had a great night of sleep, tho.
Location accessible by bus, 24 hour reception was helpful, very clean room Locks could have been more secure

Amazing location. Few minutes walk from St Peters Square and lovely streets with bars and places to eat.  Extremely comfy beds and kids loved having NETFLIX to watch after a day of sightseeing. One of the bathrooms felt a little cramped and toilet didn't flush properly. Privacy has been addressed with a roller blind.
Good wifi, scooter available for rent Insects in the room, but this is normal in Bali

The staff was lovely and very helpful. They had scooters you could rent cheaply and was always ready to answer any questions you might have. Breakfast was good and a great food court nearby for other meals. Room tidy and clean - great value for money! Nothing

Smooth friendly check in. Quiet location. Reasonably accessible (15-20 minute walk to concert and train locations)  5 mins to the square.. Roof top bar was good but very busy; too small for enough tables with a view for everyone wanting that. Snacks and drinks and service was good. We had a good stay. Happy to use this hotel again. The matress did give my back issues the first two nights. The shower was slow draining so second person had to wait for a few minutes and be fairly slick to avoid flooding. Only one chair to relax in.

You had a spoon which I didn't have at the other place I stayed at after getting out of the hospital to get cleaned up.  Had to eat my cereal and whole milk with my fingers.  All that sticky stuff on your body from the IV and heart monitoring.  I wanted a bathtub and it is rather expensive for a low income senior after being put in a wheelchair for over fifteen years by my employer Berg Electric out of Escondido.  Had some deep vein thrombosis, also known as blood clots.  The other place I stayed.  All of the machines for ice and other things, were broken.  No ironing board with an iron.  It probably works but I didn't need it. Some of the repairs that have been done to the room.  Their work isn't up to my personal quality of a job well done.  I'd like to do your repairs on the rooms for some extra money.  I know for a fact that I can do better than what was done. I took the room on Friday and was told by the front desk that the deal has expired as of tomorrow morning, Tuesday the 28th after asking if I could stay another two nights for the same price.
had privacy in the dorm with a blind bathrooms smelled
It was across from Convention Center where my daughter Gina was working. Close to Boardwalk. Long walk to the beach with children and a handicap daddy.

I did enjoy the fact that there was balconies and that they had gated parking lots. I did not like the the shower for the handicap bathroom ran directly all over the bathroom floor and into the room on the carpet unless we built a dam out of house and when trying to address it with the front counter they told me that's what we reserved... I do understand that we got a less than $70 room in the middle of downtown Dallas so couldn't expect a lot and they did all right for that

relaxing and quiet homestay, really friendly staff. they serve really tasty well priced food all day. the location is great, about 20 mins scooter from ubud centre, which makes it a quiet and relaxing location nothing
Very close to local bars and amenities.  Catered for disabled guests. The food was off a very good standard. Paying for water with your meal in the evening.
The location is great, although a bit outside the city. The staff can speak good English, and arranged scooters in very short notice. The room is cozy. Nothing.

Very nice place to stay in ubud without breaking the bank , the hotel is really nice and staff are so friendly and helpful, amazing views and room is very well equipped. Although breakfast time is between 6 and 10 AM , the staff were preparing my breakfast at 4 AM cuz am leaving early and bringing it to my room. And on my last day my taxi booking to the airport got cancelled due to some road blockages, but the staff took me to the airport with the hotel car without even asking for any extra charges. It was really amazing Nothing much to complain about just its a little bit far from the center of the city , and it‚Äôs not easy accessible if u r not familiar with the area or riding ur own scooter but it‚Äôs perfectly fine if u r taking a CAB

The View here is great! And Nice little Pool. The location is a bit off the beaten path than what we realized - if you‚Äôre not comfortable on a scooter, you will need to taxi everywhere. The road getting there is a little more difficult than what we were used to - but that‚Äôs Nusa Penida :) We stayed two nights, and unfortunately we only got cold water when we tried to shower..

Great location , close to beach and main street If you hire a scooter from them it will come empty with no fuel , you will ride 200 meters up the street and find a guy selling fuel from his make shift bowser for $250 Baht .. 10 times the price from a fuel station

Room size and price. They even have netflix channel for the price really cant ask anything more. They also provide iron board and praying matt even room slippers. They  use curtain blind instead of curtain. I prefer if it curtain.

Very central and friendly staff. Good value for money. I was staying on the bottom was very loud at night time due to being so close to the markets but also the ally way behind the hotel had a lot of foot and scooter traffic. There is a sitting courtyard on the bottom floor many groups sat here until early hours of the morning very loudly talking. Would try to ask to stay on a higher floor.

I like the location and the fire place in the room and the fact it was spotless clean and pretty LED mirrors I didn‚Äôt like how I booked the room I wanted then when I checked in I was given a key to someone‚Äôs else room with their stuff in there. so then the guy moved me to another room far from the room I booked it didn‚Äôt have fireplace or bathtub it had a handicapped shower and it was my birthday so I wasn‚Äôt settling for that. moving room a 3rd time took and hour away from my night. he said he was about to call and tell me he figured out another room which was a lie. if I didn‚Äôt call front desk I would‚Äôve had to spend my birthday in a room I did not want lacking the amenities i chose setting up my reservation. thankfully and finally the 3rd room had the amenities I wanted with an ocean view but checking in on my birthday was a sloppy process due to whoever checked someone in my room prior to the guy who checked me in

Correspondence with the hosts was really quick. We arrived at 18.30 and they provided detailed instructions regarding self check-in and parking availability. Parking was available, although it was 100 meters away on a public car park. Room was nicely decorated and equipped with a coffee machine. Room had an overwhelming smell of odor repellent. The house has a problem with moisture, all our clothes were damp in the morning. We received a yellow room, which was not very bright. Room was not soundproof and nearby is a public football court, where locals play football well into the night (after 10pm). Location is 5 minutes away from the nearest bus stop but beware as last bus ride is around 20.30. After that, you can either get a taxi, an electric scooter or walk home 30 minutes.

Very friendly and kind staff. it is also beside a cafe and supermarket, that has everything. there are many mobile scooters near by that you can scoot to city area with. it was an uphill climb from the train station. so it is best that you take the bus 652/653/M36 to the nearby bus stop. it is also not very close to the city center. the scooters cost a little more than the bus ride did.

Location is great, pet friendly with large area adjacent for them . Great breakfast, clean comfortable room. We have stayed here before. The room they gave us this time was only 1 left, it was for handicapped- the shower was handicap accessible but the water ran out all over the bathroom & into adjacent area- this is a major problem and an accident waiting to happen. Outside the room the upper  floors air conditioning condensation drips down and makes a big puddle in front of the exit from the room- this is also a slip & fall hazard.

The blind in the room completely shut out all the light.  The room was quiet with little/no outside noise.  The bed was comfortable.  You can see the television from the toilet!  Good location close to the airport, I didn't want to wait for a shuttle bus so took a taxi, and the fare was $11.  Fast and easy check-in. A few problems with breakfast that often occurs with inexperienced, inattentive staff: the coffee machine couldn't make a latte as it had no milk, the bacon tray was left out son long the bacon has cold and has a cardboard texture.  The check-in process was fast, however the lady on duty was terribly miserable.  Furiously busy cleaning lady knocked briefly then quickly entered my room at 930am before I was able to stop her. Luckily, I was fully clothed when this occurred.

Close to the airport which was the reason I selected it . Good size lift. Breakfast provided Disabled room provided . Maybe they all are ? No refrigerator in room , very basic bathroom. AC didn‚Äôt really cool room down

The room was clean and big although we were at the -2 level. Breakfast is provided at the rooftop with amazing views to Sultanahmet and Galata Tower. Food variety and quality are good.   Very convenient location next to Galata Tower (crowded and noisy street) but there was no noise inside the room. The safe box in our room malfunctioned but the team fixed it within a few hours. We noticed some bad small in the corridor in floor -2. If you are not a good walker, although the hotel is located next to Galata which is an asset,  you will need to climb the hill till Istiklal street  or when coming from Karakoy you better take the small train. Otherwise you need to be ready to walk up for at least 15 minutes till you get to Gatala.
Great location, comfortable with good showers A couple of things weren‚Äôt working including one blind and the coffee machine.

We were in the room that had not been updated yet Bathroom shower was leaking Lots of noise in the am due to construction upstairs   Close proximity for tourist sites Close to Metro Had a wheelchair we actually used for the duration of the trip which was very convenient Taxi stand very close by
